title: Stayed 10 days - excellent hotel
comment: Everything about this Grandbourne property was excellent. The front desk staff (especially Mariana) was great. The pool(s) and layout were great. We stayed in the Marina tower and had two rooms for our stay. If you charter a boat check out the Sweet Angel. Leaves directly behind the hotel and it was a great four hours. Highly recommended!

everyoneShouldKnow: location is perfect to explore downtown Porstmouth and convenient for local shopping
title: A few issues but overall a great place
comment: At first, we were not impressed by this hotel. We had some housekeeping issues we discovered upon check in. We asked to have them fixed and were disappointed to find they were not taken care of.Not what I am use to in a Belvoir propery. After speaking to another manager, things were taken care of. I'd say the cleanliness overall was a bit of a let down (dusty corners, dirty glasses, toenail on the floor) . But after they fixed the issues, our stay was great. The staff is friendly and polite. The hotel is perfectly situated in the downtown core so you can reach everything. Overall it ended up being a wonderful stay and we'd definitely stay here again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Fnd another hotel until their corporate can retrain and investigate why they run the way they do. The poorest experience out of all the hotels that I have stayed at in the last 5 years
title: POOR EXPERIENCE
comment: In a the years of travel that I have done, this experience will stand out as one of the poorest. Confusion starded the check in process where the hotel couldt understand why I had 2 rooms. Why I was booked with 2 reservations for a suite is beyond me. then I was unable to make calls from my room. I had to call 0 everytime I needed to place a call and that was after many times being placed on hold by the operator befor I was even ever able to make a call out. The hotel, need senior management audit before they end up closing due to poor service

title: Lovely room, staff needs to work on their social skills
comment: I stayed with a friend for eight nights in a superior room with two double beds. Lovely beds, view, bathroom and color scheme, however the walls are thin and both our neighbours had children. The lobby was a screaming mess of young teenagers on a NY trip, I counted to at least three different groups and needless to say the few computers in the lobby were always busy. I met a man who had been put on a floor with one such group and he described his floor as "a carneval" and had been granted a switch of floors. The staff in general don't know how to smile and with the exception of the staff at the tickets & tours counter all other treat you as a trial put on them. Since this was our first trip to NY and the choices outside were overwhelming we tried to get tips on good eating places and other things. After a few attempts we realized why there never was a line-up. Also, this is the ONLY hotel ever that has charged me for storing my bags for a few hours between check-out and leaving for the airport. However, the location was great and the room lovely and I would probably stay here again since I like Belvoir.

title: Needs better lighting
comment: While much of the new upgrades from the renovation are good - the lighting in the bathroom area is really weak. Could use more CFLs or some of the "older" style.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent location; Very good facilities for an airport hotel.
title: Great airport hotel
comment: Chose to stay in the hotel since we had an overnight layover on a flight back from Asia. Excellent location, very close to airport; lobby area, Belvoir link area and lounge area stylish & welcoming; pool area & cabanas pleasant and a nice feature. One negative, No beverages available in the executive club during the day or evening except coffee, tea & water.

everyoneShouldKnow: they are under renovations, but they make every effort to make you comfortable!
title: Renovations almost complete-looking good
comment: I've stayed at this hotel before the renovations ( and Grandbourne properties) and now with the recent room / gym renovations, I will ALWAYS stay at this hotel while in New Olreans. The new rooms are fantastic. The gym is what every hotel should offer in a gym. Well Done!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Steps away from amazing dining and shopping.
title: Great Hotel
comment: I stayed here while traveling with my adult daughter and used this hotel as a base to explore the area. This Belvoir by far exceeded my expectations. I also had to find a notary and fed ex drop while there and the guest services went out of their way to track down in record time everything I needed. The staff could not have been nicer and more helpful. The hotel is beautifully appointed, located within walking distance of the harbor, restaurants, shops and everything to make your stay a wonderful one. I hope to stay here again and would highly recommend this

title: Raphael
comment: Stay here, been to a number of LI hotels, this gives you it all. If you have BPG access to the Club lounge - you get more than what you need, and then some, especially with Lori on duty at night. She makes the stay feel like being with your favorite family member.

everyoneShouldKnow: Newly renovated rooms with a great location
title: Pleasantly Surprised
comment: After reading prior comments, I was a bit nervous about staying here. To my surprise many of the negative comments were not true.

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenient to Fishermans Wharf. A bit expensive, but safety and location are both positives.
title: Fishermans Wharf Belvoir
comment: Overall good experience, although the cost of parking the vehicle is the most that I have ever paid in my frequent travels around the country. Room was clean, but bathroom was extremely small and not updated. Staff was very friendly, particularly the concierge.

everyoneShouldKnow: What an excellent staff they have. Everyone is always smiling and willing to help!
title: Awesome Hotel Staff
comment: I coordinated a business event at the hotel and also stayed there for easy access to the event that I was in charge of. First of all the hotel is beautiful, so elegant and classy, but as beautiful as it is, it doesn't outshine the attentiveness and care that the staff gives you. My event manager was Ernesto and he made everything flow easily. Everyone on the staff always had a smile and so very helpful. Kudos to Hector, Luis, Wilbur, Arnold, Sam, Nancy, Armando, Vu, Jayson, who were always nearby to make sure everything was perfect! Thank you Belvoir!!!!

title: Convenient Location
comment: Coujld easily walk to museums and downtowen to good restaurants and Historical sites

title: Manta Rays amazing!
comment: We thoroughly enjoyed our visit last week. Our room had a great pool and ocean view plus a spacious balcony. One of the major highlights of the visit was the incredibly friendly staff. We were greeted each day, making us feel welcome. We especially appreciated Jim at the Sliders Bar and our housekeeper, Stella. One of the unique attractions of the hotel was the nightly visit of the manta rays. To be able to observe the graceful mantas feeding in their natural habitat was an incredible sight.

everyoneShouldKnow: Bring your ear plugs, it's noisy!
title: Hotel needs updating
comment: We stayed at the Tower while attending an ASTM meeting. The hallway is dark and the carpet worn. In the room the carpet is also worn. It appears that money has been spent on items such as flat screen TVs, but not on basic infrastructure improvements such as carpeting and bathroom upgrades. Soundproofing in the hotel is very poor. We constantly heard flushing of toilets, water running and loud children.

everyoneShouldKnow: not well equipped for business travel needs
title: Nice accomodations but don't expect to work remotely
comment: The hotel was very clean, quiet, very accomodating staff, and great restaurants/food. However, don't come to the Swan or Dolphin expecting that you can work remotely as - despite advertised wireless access - the internet access is horrendous and cell phone signals poor as well. To make matters worse, the business center is owned separately and charged a whooping $22 to send two (albeit lengthy) e-mails. Perhaps the sense is that business shouldn't be important when you're at Disney world but frustrating given conference needs

everyoneShouldKnow: Too expensive for what you get
title: I've seen better for less
comment: They wanted to charge me $10.00 per box to deliver my dialysis solution to my room, The company sent them to the hotel for free. No thermastat in the room. No fan in the bathroom. No fresh air in the room. Charged almost $13.00 per 24 hours for wifi. And at least one of the bellmen were rude to no end. I spent 7 days there for a convention and wished I could have changed hotels.

title: Great Business Hotel
comment: Great location on the river and near the Navy Pier. Easy walk to loads of shops and restaurants

everyoneShouldKnow: Get a golf course facing room
title: Not what it used to be
comment: 3 night stay June 2012

title: Good location
comment: The water temp in this room took nearly five minutes to become warm.

title: ALARM!
comment: Disappointing. 1st thing I noticed was the hallways were not very clean. Rooms were small and would have preferred queen beds to the double beds. On the last night of our stay at almost 1AM, the emergency alarm went off. It was loud and continued for 15 minutes. We didn't know what to do because the alarm stated it was "investigating the situation". After I called the front desk, all they told me was there was nothing to worry about. No info was given until the alarm stopped ringing. The kids were scared, it ruined our final nights stay and were all very tired and weary the next and final day in Philly. No explanation or compensation offered to us by the hotel. Shouldn't have to share these negative stories about our vacation to friends and family when we returned.

everyoneShouldKnow: A very comfortable stay -- great location, efficient & friendly staff, very comfortable rooms & beds.
title: Wedding Trip
comment: We opted to stay at the Belvoir for a family wedding in Chicago (choosing the Belvoir hotel over the "official" wedding hotel). We made an excellent decision -- the staff & facilities were great. The location was perfect. The room was outstanding.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't come at the end of the month for the bar. It will have NO selection! But the staff is great and the food outstanding.
title: Neighborhood location/not touristy
comment: I have stayed in a lot of Grandbourne properties, including many in NY. Every member of the staff was very nice. The cleaning staff was terrific. I was there for multiple nights. I hate it when I move everything into a pile to have it out of my way and the cleaning staff feels they have to move it all back. That didn't happen here. The man who cleaned my room was Alex. I only know this because he hand wrote a nice welcome note after my first night there. He replaced what needed to be replaced and left what I wanted them to leave. I have never understood why some hotels change your sheets every night even though I didn't put the card out. It was beastly hot in NY when I was there and the AC worked great in spite of my window facing into the sun. By NY standards, both the sleeping area and the bathroom were spacious. There is not a lot of closet/dresser space for two. I was fine alone. It was very clean with no bed bugs.

title: Poor Experience
comment: I booked this as a reward stay and was really disappointed. The lobby and staff were very inviting and friendly, but the room was sub-par. I see other reviews noting the nice rooms, but mine was far from it. It was roomy, but in need of serious updating with heavily worn and damaged carpet, peeling wallpaper, dirty table. Not what I expect from a Belvoir property. This experience was a deciding factor in not staying a second night.

title: Decent Stay
comment: My only complaint about this location is that I never received my breakfast order in the room after hanging the order on my door well in time. When I spoke with guest services the next day, they said that I had not put down the time (which I had). In any case, they could have called my room to find out what time I wanted it - a poor excuse.

everyoneShouldKnow: How clean it is and how hard the employees work
title: Traveler's Review
comment: We stayed at the sheridon atlanta hotel from may 11-13, 2012. Everyone made us feel as it was a privilege to help us. Desk clerk checked us in early. Concierge your restraunt crew was great (Ryan the chef and the chelf saturday, as well as our server, Ciera). The room was squeaky CLEAN!!!! We went to purchase coffee early at the snack bar, they were most helpful. The employees deserve 4 stars. I would recommend it to everyone.

title: Poor Staff service
comment: Can not timely solve the customer service issue as the promise

everyoneShouldKnow: great stay close to the university
title: great hotel
comment: nice hotel close to the university

title: Home away from Home
comment: My latest project was in Wilmington which required me to live at the Belvoir for five months during the work week. It's not easy traveling and living away from home but the crew at the hotel made it a great stay. I enjoyed 'coming home' to everyone there. Every morning and every evening when leaving and returning to the hotel I was greeted with smiles and great conversation. Brian, Rich, Courtney, Eric and all of the others that work there were awesome. Thanks for making it a home away from home for me!

everyoneShouldKnow: Perfect location, great service, great elevators
title: Beyond my expectations
comment: As much as I love New York, I always expect a bit of attitude at the hotels. The Belvoir was so wonderful, people were friendly and overly accommodating. I thought I was in Iowa! I'd stay there again. The manager, Alex, is a gem!

title: Great Location
comment: The best part of this hotel is its location. Walking distance to everything you need like Fisherman's Wharf for restaurants and shopping and all transportation needs. The hotel is probably a bit older from what I could tell. The rooms are nothing special. The bathrooms are very small, but who really needs a grand bathroom. It was a place to sleep. It wasn't all that quiet though was probably my biggest "complaint". There are only 4 floors so you can't get away from the street noise and I guess the windows are so old that they are not that sound proof. I have stayed in many big cities like New York and Chicago in other Grandbourne properties and never had noise like this. But, the location outweighs any gripes I had.

title: Room not cleaned well, no hot water, slow elevators...
comment: Stayed for 5 days for a conference and was late to several sessions (on the order of 5 minutes) due to the L O N G wait for the elevators.

title: Stay somewhere else
comment: The pool has garbage (empty drink glasses, empty popcorn bags, etc.) strewn about. No one cleans during the day, they just have numerous people bringing more drinks, creating more garbage. Trash cans stuffed.

everyoneShouldKnow: the only place comfortably cool ~ was the Lobby ~
title: Very Dissatisfied
comment: for a convention center I was displeased in my stay for the only place in the hotel that was wonderful comfortable was the "Lobby". I had to turn the room thermostat down to 66 degrees to get the room comfortable. The staff was nice . Most Hotels have Free Continenel Breakfast, this Hotel charges 14.95 for it. At 11-12pm the hallways were full of students running, jumping an be loud. I would not stay here again.

title: Shyne
comment: This hotel was AWESOME!!!! The staff was remarkable.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's not the high-end resort you would expect for the prices you pay.
title: Not at all what I expected
comment: Having grown up in Central Florida, I had always wanted to stay at the Dolphin. I remember when it was built and how impressive it was. Well, I finally had my chance and was quite disappointed. Don't misunderstand - the hotel is in a perfect location with terrific amenities and a lovely lobby. But that was the end of my excitement. The room left a lot to be desired. It looked just the same as it probably looked in 1988, or whenever it was built. The furniture and decor was outdated, making it look much more like an old hotel than the impressive Disney restort i had imagined.

everyoneShouldKnow: No wifi and $14.95 per day charge for internet was a negative.
title: This hotel has great service.
comment: I had a few service needs being there for our convention and every need was met.

title: Not up to usual standards
comment: Room was great and staff was friendly as always. However, the Wi-fi was so weak, I could not maintain connection therefore, I had to go to club room to get my e-mails at 1AM in the morning (got in very late). Lastly, the club room food and beverage was well below usual standards - limited choice and not so fresh.

title: Great Hotel
comment: Hotel was great - though I was only there for a night. nice upgrade, good facilities...only issue was that the wouldn't recognize my platinum status with the welcome amenity, because they said I'd booked through a 3rd party. However, I ALWAYS have to book through a 3rd party (company requirement)...and every other BPG hotel I've stayed at gives me the welcome amenity (gift, 500 points, etc)

title: Saved a tired traveler
comment: I arrived exhausted and late in the evening. The staff at the front desk were extremely attentive and courteous and perhaps sensing my mood, upgraded me to a corner suite.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very close to National Airport. Beds are awful.
title: Most uncomfortable hotel stay in a Belvoir ever
comment: The bed sagged in the middle and the pillows were terrible. My husband and I were given two double beds instead of one king.

title: Nelson is a gem
comment: Nelson at the front desk was lively and helpful and set the tone for a relaxing stay at the hotel. More could be done with the gym. It was pretty bare bones. The hotel was near plenty of kid-friendly restaurants. My kid's goggles were stolen at the pool.

everyoneShouldKnow: As a Gold BPG members. This experience has made me dislike Miami and the hotel.
title: NOT recommended
comment: The treatment during I received at check-in was simply shocking and unacceptable for a Belvoir Hotel.

title: Great Stay
comment: My stay at the Belvoir Dallas was Awesome from start to finish. I am a very seasoned traveler and the Belvoir Dallas stood out amongst other Dallas hotels I have stayed at.

title: No Gold Elite Recognition
comment: After years of staying at this location with great staff, we had a miserable experience with uncaring staff. Gold Elite is supposed to get complimentary upgrades when available. Upgrades were available IF we paid an extra $30. And then the toilet had residue from the previous user. I see why this location lost a star.

title: $17.50 for a hamburger, really?
comment: I'm sure if you have an unlimited budget this is a great hotel but every thing about this hotel is over priced. One high spot is the staff, great people. But, if you are attending a meeting don't check in late. You don't get the room you requested but something entirely different.There are rooms so small and so far away from meeting rooms you'll have to go outside to put on the track shoes you will need to get you to your meeting on time. I wouldn't be writing this except this type of stuff seems to happen each time I stay at a Grandbourne property.

title: St. Louis
comment: Excellent location. Parking issues need to be dealt with - if you're gonna charge, re-line and paint. Both restaurants offer identical menus - not a good idea. Noisy housekeeping personnel - i.e., they SLAM doors.

title: Great Location & View
comment: The location and views were great and the customer service was excellent. The rooms were very comfortable. I enjoyed my stay!

title: Not That Happy
comment: We were staying there for the weekend and we got back to the hotel after the Phillies game was cancelled due to rain. When we got back we called room service at 11:01pm and they couldn't bring us a piece of cake because they stopped serving at 11pm. The toilet leaked and the shower was sub par. The front desk staff was kinda rude when you asked a question. However the Housekeeper and the bellhop were very good and nice!!

title: Great location and staff
comment: This was my first time at the hotel and we had a great time. It is located central to everything and a great value for the quality of the hotel and staff. We stayed on the club level and had a great breakfast every day and their nightly snacks even fulfilled our dinner needs! Can't wait to return.

title: Loved the infinity pool
comment: This was the first time I stayed at this hotel. The staff were very helpful and friendly. I arrived at my hotel before the published check in time. They were able to give me a room early and I received a partial ocean view. That was great. The view from the infinity pool was awesome. It's also an adults only pool. Which is nice if you just want to relax. The only issue I had was with the dinner buffet. There wasn't a published price for the dinner. So, when I got the bill. I was a little shocked.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don' play gin rummy by the pool. There is not space in the room to sit together and play games.
title: chased from the pool area
comment: I am 74 years old and had to visit the Stanford medical center A friend drove me up so I thought I would treat her to a nice hotel.

title: Sharaton Towers Chicago
comment: The AC didn't quite work on the first day, I called for help and the issue was corrected within the hour.

everyoneShouldKnow: On the beach next to public beach area.
title: Location, location, location!
comment: The location of this hotel is top notch. Assistance prior to our stay was tentative and guarded depending on the phone rep. The staff of the pool/bar/restaurant area is losing Belvoir money.

title: A great pick for the Disneyland area
comment: I was here on business for a conference and every bit of this hotel stay exceeded my expectations. This was my second time at this hotel and I would choose it again if/when returning to Anaheim. Very close walk to Disneyland and restaurants, staff were very friendly and accommodating, rooms were clean, fitness center had new and clean equipment. My only gripe is that the gift shop and cafe wouldn't permit room charges - a pain when you're running around to conference events and may not have your wallet handy. Other than that, a great stay.

title: Overall good but some shortcoming
comment: Requested refrigerator in room when reservation made. Not available when we checked in.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great staff and very well done renovation.
title: What a nice surprise
comment: This was my first visit to this wonderful hotel but it won't be my last. The rooms are newly remodeled, well designed and very modern. I enjoyed the dark colors in both the corridors and guest rooms. My family and I stayed at this hotel for a wedding reception and the food was outstanding as well as the service. The Front Desk staff was incredible and very effcient. Parking is easily accessed and covered, offering protection from the heat we have been experiencing this summer in Denver. The gym was awesome and all of the equipment you would need for a good work out.

everyoneShouldKnow: Always trying to go above and beyond their services!
title: Home away from home
comment: The staff - from front desk to the conceirge service did an "outstanding service."

everyoneShouldKnow: The beds are comfortable to sleep in... just don't sit on the edge. Staff were very courteous even though they were limited with what they could do to make my experience better.
title: Greatly Disappointed
comment: The nightly rate I paid for this hotel was higher than any hotel I have ever stayed in yet there was not even a refrigerator or microwave in the room. The beds were not secured to the headboard. When one person sat down on the end of the bed, the other end flew up in the air like a seesaw. We were on the Club floor which apparently provides more amenities than other hotel guests. Those amenities seemingly consist of continental breakfast as well as afternoon / evening snacks... both of which were minimal and completely unimpressive. We asked to be placed in a room close to the elevator due to mobility problems and were put in a room at the opposite end of the hall. This is the only time in my life I have complained about my accommodations. All in all the best thing that happened during my stay was when the nice man at the front desk reduced my room rate and brought me a refrigerator at no additional charge.

title: Staff is Amazing
comment: I have stayed at this hotel multiple times over the past year. The staff is extremely attentive and goes the extra mile to keep their guests happy. When I mean they go the extra mile, it includes the manager jumping my rental car using his truck one morning when I found my car battery dead (Dean the front desk manager is awesome). Samantha who works the front desk is extremely attentive and always takes care of my requests.

title: Oasis amidst the bustle
comment: I am a BPG member and spent a Sat. nite here recently with my 2 daughters,(19y, 21y) niece(20y) and sis-in-law. We were given adjoining rooms-a king and regular double room which was perfect. The rooms are rather small but you have to expect that for NYand were very clean. Loved the terrace-great views of Empire State and midtown. Look out for David our concierge who was just wonderful-hardworker, great sense of humor and obviously loves his job. Desk staff were soo nice too! Our complimentary evening snacks and b/fast was excellent . Would def. stay here again!

everyoneShouldKnow: The Hotel stands on its own merits, but the people make it special.
title: My extended stay with the Belvoir Harrisburg hershey Hotel
comment: It was my great privilege to stay at this hotel for an extended visit. I work for FEMA and was in Harrisburg, PA for the flood disasters of summer 2011. As a FEMA responder I travel a lot, often for 6 or more months at a time. In this case my deployment to PA was 11.5 months.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you want to be close to many tourist attractions but still be in an area that is calm, attractive, and clean, this is the place to be.
title: Very pleasant stay, perfect location
comment: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here for five days and five nights. The staff in every department were more than helpful and very friendly. I enjoyed the food in the restaurant and most mornings had my breakfast overlooking the courtyard/pool area. The location was ideal:right across the way from Universal Studios, and five minutes walk to the Metro. I couldn't be happier, it felt like the relaxing and luxurious vacation I was wishing for, and I would definitely stay here again. Thank you everyone!

title: Not so helpful
comment: I am a gold member and I had made a reservation using points instead of booking it for June 29 I booked for July 29th. When I arrived at the hotel, I was told that I would need to call reservations to fix that problem and they couldnt help me, after flying for 16 hours the last thing you need is dealing with it. I was offered another room for 209 a night but they never offer to fix my original one. I have stayed at Grandbourne properties all over the globe. never been treated this way.

title: Good location and great service
comment: It's easy to stay in this hotel. Location is perfect to explore the downtown of Indianapolis by walking. Staff is friendly. Rooms are clean. There is great wiev from pooldeck to city center.

everyoneShouldKnow: Expensive Food and Drinks. The gift shop is a rip off!
title: Beautiful Hotel Downtown Chicago
comment: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the hotel. Although the bar was rather pricey, I would not hesitate in recommending this stay to others who visit. Perfectly located! Oh and the gift shop...it was a rip off!!! 9 dollars for Advil???

title: New rooms
comment: The newly remodeled rooms in this hotel are very nice, but beware of construction going on around you if you request one. We were told construction would be going on above us from 9-7 but it went on next door and above us starting a little bit after 8 in the morning. The fitness center has been remodeled and is exceptional. Be aware that when we left on July 29th the lobby construction was beginning and I am not sure for how long it will continue.

title: An Awesome Week
comment: My family (That include 2 teenagers) had an excellent time in Virginia Beach thanks to the staff at the Belvoir. This started each day with a great cup of coffe, followed by a very reasonably priced buffet. Then off to the pool or beach that were very well maintained. The renovations to the hotel were done very professionally and upscale. I also heavily recommend the frozen drinks from the Cabana.

title: Always a Good Choice
comment: I have stayed at this property many times over the past several years. It is my default hotel in the NY/NJ area for many reasons, least of which is not the free parking and proximity to the city.

title: Great Property!
comment: It's not too often that I am surprised at a Belvoir, but this hotel certainly exceeded my expectations. It is a jewel and I am definitely returning in the future. I usually stay at one of the other Grandbourne properties in the immediate area.

title: Spacious suite
comment: hotel is very clean, rooms are spacious, beds are comfortable.

title: Good for an overnight stay.
comment: If you have an early flight out or late flight in this is a solid choice within the Grandbournes brand. I stay here as much as any other hotel for this reason.

title: Our stay in June
comment: Wonderful place all around. Mary in the club room was unbelievable service a beautiful women and so great with us . Just her alone I will be back just to see her..

everyoneShouldKnow: staff above and beyond helpful, but most of all so so so kind:)
title: exemplary service
comment: we have been BPG members for 3 yrs and have stayed at numerous Grandbourne hotels as well as various other hotels. this has got to be the most pleasent stay we have ever had. we came into nashville on a tues night late, checked into an awful motel and proceeded to go out on the town for the evening. we decided very quickly that we would be booking a room at our sherato location in nashville and did so (extremely easily as usual) while out on the town. after getting back to our awful motel around 2am we realized it was even worse than we remembered just a few hours earlier when we checked in, cringed, dropped our things and went out to meet friends. lets just say my husband and i slept fully clothed. i called Belvoir first thing wed morning and spoke with Shelia at the front desk. i proceeded to let her know of the awful experrience we had had at the motel we were at and i was inquiring as to whether or not we could check in early. she giggled at me as i told her i had never felt so dirty in my life:) (no exageration) she not only let me know of our ability to register early in order to be able to get into our reserved room as soon as it was avail she was able to go ahead and get us checked in as there was a room already open......i could have kissed her:) upon driving up to what we already knew would be a great stay we noticed the address of "777" it was like the angels were singing. needless to say we came in met shelia (very very nice lady) and proceeded to our room to shower.....awwww. all of the staff were amazing the grounds were amazing the room (loved the balcony) was amazing .... we decided to stay another night and have already planned to bring family back for several day stay in fall.

everyoneShouldKnow: Service and beach access are amazing!
title: Excellent Stay!
comment: We really enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay again in the future. The beach access was perfect and we appreciated the easy access to lounge chairs as well. The food at Dos Caminos was amazing and we loved having a Starbucks on property. All of the staff we interacted with were very friendly and helpful.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Club Floor room and only 5 minutes by taxi to the casinos
title: Excellent Club Floor
comment: This hotel far exceded my expectations.

title: Best One night stay
comment: This is for the price, absolutely the best place to stay and relax. The layout is stunning, the service was exceptional, and whether it was for our one night or longer, I would so enjoy a whole week here.

everyoneShouldKnow: Do not expect any BPG Gold perks above what is absolutely required for them to offer.
title: Very Not BPG Gold Oriented
comment: I e-mailed the hotel prior to my three day stay asking for a room upgrade but I received no response. At check-in they seemed well trained to deny any such requests stating they are not allowed to. They wouldn't even allow lounge access. As a Gold member I would have expected the same courtesy I have received in the past from other BPG hotels. Judging from the parking lot, the hotel did not seem too full. I guess the lack of BPG competition in that area gives them the green light to act this way.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very good location. Easy and ample parking.
title: Better than expected
comment: I must say that this hotel outperformed my expectations, which were based on the BPG ranking of a categorgy 2. This was my first time staying on the club level. The room was well kept and the bed was extra comfortable. I especially loved the pillows. I didn't do much outside of my room, but the staff and customer service was great.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great hotel in a fabulous location.
title: Incredible location
comment: You couldn't ask for a better location in Chicago. Easy walking distance to the Magnificent Mile, Navy Pier, Millennium Park, Water Tower, lots of restaurants, and more.

title: Clean and comfortable
comment: We stay here 3-4 times a summer to use the nearby beach at Long Branch. The hotel is clean, the beds are comfortable, and the free continental breakfast makes it a good deal. This year we left my granddaughters "blankie" by accident. Housekeeping retrieved it for us and promptly mailed it. Thanks again.

everyoneShouldKnow: There is no refrigerator in the room.
title: The bed and pillows were great.
comment: I stayed overnight at the Belvoir Mahwah for a wedding on June 29, 2012. The room was nice and clean and the bed and pillows were extremely comfortable. The catering and food were superb for the wedding reception. I was disappointed that the pool water was warmer that the Jacuzzi. Also, in the room I would have liked to have had drawers in the bedside tables and a refrigerator. Towel racks in the bathroom would have been a nice touch. What ever happened to the coffee carafe? The coffee maker only makes one paper cup at a time. This room was fine for one night but I wouldn't recommend it for an extended stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: The bellhop and Concierge services is what makes this hotel an outstanding place to stay
title: Bellhop/Concierge were outstanding
comment: The Bellhop was very friendly and helpful as soon as we stepped off the shuttle. The concierge was there to answer any questions we have and helpful with everything from what bus to take to what restaurant to eat at in Hollywood. We really enjoyed our stay with the exception that I thought the breakfast options to be too expensive for the quality as well as the drinks at the lounge.

title: Great Hotel in Indianapolis
comment: I have come to enjoy the city and this hotel was well located to get to everything including a yarn shop.

title: This hotel has one great feature
comment: This is the 1st hotel Belvoir that we have stayed in that do not iron their sheets. I called the front desk to confirm and they sent housekeeping to change the sheets but still not ironed.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent location, good facilities and great staff.
title: Great value for money and good location
comment: Excellent BPG recognition, Brad was awesome at the front desk, Upgraded us to deluxe oceeanfront suite with connecting rooms for family. Great location and good facilities. Resort a little old and needs renovation though.

everyoneShouldKnow: Easy to get to and from I-5
title: Quiet Please
comment: The only thing that wasn't to my satisfaction was the amount of noise the room doors made when they closed. I would think they could ahve some sort of braking system on them so they don't slam

title: Great pool/location
comment: Beds were very comfortable and pool was awesome. However we stayed in a suite and the bathroom was the smallest I have ever seen in a hotel. Only room for 1 person barely. Also phone was covered with something sticky like pop. Yuck!

title: A treasure!
comment: The Airport Belvoir is 5 minutes from the airport and 15 from downtown. Couldn't be in a more ideal location . The outside of building looks dated but it is a treasure once you walk into the lobby. The rooms are very clean, quiet and the staff will do anything from extra towels to extra water because it was 100 degrees ! I will definetly stay again.

title: Customer Service was great!
comment: I must admit, this hotel customer service was outstanding. If something lacked was lacking or if there was anything I needed they made sure I was accommodated. From the door to room service I must give them a 5 score. The building wasn't that great but everything else was very good.

title: Wifi for $15
comment: Other than the slow drainage issue, there is no complimentary wifi.

title: LA Get A Way
comment: Living in West Los Angeles who would think we'd find ourselves in Santa Monica celebrating our 49th wedding anniversary. Well, it happened when we stayed at the Belvoir Delfina a Grandbourne Property, sexy, open, airy, clean, delicious food, surprisingly for hotel dining, pool facility with nooks and lounges, cabanas and outdoor chef. What's not to like! Walking distance to the beach and many restaurants in the surrounding environment to enjoy. Can't wait to do this again!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location, it is more of a conference hotel but is comfortable for other guests.
title: Nice hotel/Great location
comment: This was my second time at the hotel. I had a great stay and the accomodations are comfortable. I do want to say that upon check in I asked whether the requested crib was in the room (my baby was sleeping upon arrival). The crib was in fact in the room but we were placed in a king room rather than the 2 queens that were requested in our reservation. Mistakes happen and I was told the crib would be immediately transferred to the new room. Well...over an hour and multiple phone calls later the crib finally arrived. This was inexcusable in my eyes. Otherwise, the stay was great and met our expecations in every way.

title: Needs a overhaul
comment: The bed was very comfortable. Bring your own towels and bath clothes though. They don't tell you about the $50 deposit until check in.

title: Has so much to improve upon
comment: This does not seem to be a Belvoir hotel, not sure what has happened but the facilities are falling apart. The pool is dirty and unsanitary, the bathroom in the room needs to be remodeled and the wall paper is falling off.

title: wonderful hotel
comment: Everyone was extremely helpful and caring. Great staff. Room was spotless and very comfortable. Highly recommend!!

title: Great location
comment: My wife enjoyed our two day visit and found it to be a great location. The Metro was an short walk away and we had many restaurant choices.

title: Hotel is very nice
comment: The only problem is the AC - thermostat said 60 degrees, but it was more like 75 degrees. Maintenance changed the filter which was very dirty, but it never got any cooler. That was the only thing we found that never changed. Otherwise, it was clean, staff was very nice and our food was excellent. If you have a pet, there were plenty of those to go around that were staying there! Laundry services would have been nice to have.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel seems to be good for both the business and leisure traveler. Free parking in covered garage.
title: Great Value, nice property
comment: I checked in somewhat early as my business meeting was rescheduled to the afternoon from morning. The front desk was more than welcoming and allowed me to check in about noon and offered me a suite upgrade which I accepted (I'm BPG Platinum). I didn't use any of the facilities as I was there only one night but in general, the property and staff were more than adequate. I don't understand why on some of the travel websites this hotel gets less than average reviews, in my opinion, this property is nice and more than par to the standards of a typical nice Belvoir. No complaints on anything. I have to be back in the area in two weeks and I will book this hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: there maybe a 50 dollar deposit for the room other than that it was a good hotel
title: good family time
comment: our stay was good but we did not know about the 50 dollar room deposit that had to be paid but got back when we left-- but the negative was we booked our rooms back in April and was told that we would be next to each other on the same floor but when we arrived we were on two different floors, but they fixed it to where we were aleast on the same floor.But on a very brighter note the manager of the bistro14 (dave) was awesome to help my parents celebrate their 49th wedding anniversary.

title: Good Location, Small Room
comment: Good location and convenient access to members' lounge, which serves good breakfast and snack and is efficiently laid out. The staff there don't bother you but are very helpful in case you have any questions. The cleaners for our room however are mediocre at best - sheets aren't changed and glasses aren't replaced. We were also surprised to find out that the hotel charges storage fee for each piece of luggage stored there (for only a few hours), which was unexpected for a 5-star hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is is a great example of a Belvoir in terms of decor and ambience. It is well kept. There is a large convention center next door. That can greatly detract from the service and attention to guests.
title: great before....but not this time.
comment: I've stayed at this hotel multiple times. It is a well kept hotel. The ambience and facilities exceed that of most Belvoir properties. The staff is also exceptional. Front desk, valet, and wait staff are all friendly and professional. We have enjoyed this property many, many times and continue to choose it when visiting Kansas City. However, we will look elsewhere for our next visit. We arrived to a completely full hotel (based on adjoining convention center event - so call ahead and check). This meant that a very simple request, adjoining rooms, was not met. As a platinum member, I expect a reservation request made months in advance to be met. When traveling with our children, we want adjoining rooms. An upgrade is always nice, but adjoining rooms are essential. When we asked for a rollaway bed, we were told they were all taken, but we could have an air mattress. The air mattress was deflated by the morning. We were told we could move to adjoining rooms the next day. That was reasonable and we thought one night with full occupancy meant we could overlook the negatives of the first night. The next day, we were told by several staff members that the hotel was going to be so empty, that they were only using a few floors. What that meant was that we did indeed get adjoining rooms, but we were next to a barking dog and surrounded by slamming doors, and directly across from an ice machine that was used throughout the night. It also meant that the restaurant, which we really enjoy was closed for dinner one night. It also meant that there was construction noise in many areas. Apparently, when hotels are low occupancy, many projects are completed. The bottom line is that this is a great hotel. It is well kept. It is also staffed with friendly and professional people. However, call in advance and find out about occupancy! Too full and customer service and guest loyalty are not met. Too empty...you might regret the choice. I've had several great stays here, this one was well below my expectations.

title: A Bit Under Par
comment: When we made the reservation, the website told us any room could accomodate an extra fold out bed (we had another friend staying with us the second night). However when we asked we were simply told no that it was not possible and my buddy (6'6") was left to sleep on the floor/love seat.

title: Rooms needs TLC
comment: Room has signs of wear. Needs some TLC.

title: Needs quickly satisfied
comment: Everything was great, except the air conditioner was not working real well, but we told someone and left for a while. When we came back, the room was very cool.

title: front desk help
comment: We arrived early and pre-registered. from there we went to the pool until our rooms(2) were ready. When we went back to the front desk, they asked to see everything all over again. I said we already pre-registered and pointed to a man behind the desk who we spoke with not 1/2 hr before. He said he didnt't recognize us so I had to go back to the pool area to get my paperwork AGAIN. for being BPG members I thought that was unnecessary. Also on check out day, we had arranged for a late check out and so we went out for breakfast. Upon returning to our rooms, the keys would't work. The front desk never saw we had late check out and so at 11am, the keys were usless. Very annoying. We were very disappointed with the service. This was our 2nd time at your hotel.

title: Great place to stay while in Chicago
comment: We loved our stay at the Belvoir. Great location. Wonderful view of the river and all the buildings, boats and activities going on around us. It is close to all the activities that downtown Chicago has to offer. Other than the guy hailing cabs for people, all the staff were very helpful and GREAT.

title: Reservation
comment: The stay was great, but I was expecting two connected rooms with double beds instead of a king with a pullout couch. (I called three or four days before and changed from the original reservations.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location next to lake for strolls and access to restaruants, mall, and movie theaters
title: Welcome relief from power outage
comment: Very friendly reservation clerk who helped secure room for pet during recent power outage. Lots of folks at hotel with pets and this was a wonderful accomodation with no extra fees and lots of lawn for taking care of business. Looked like folks were also picking up after pets as we didn't see any leavings in back or in front. Rooms were spacious and clean; comfortable beds and bedding. Only problem we had was frequent loss of signal on digital TV but overall very happy to have the availability during the area power outages.

title: Good Price and Location, BUT Loud AC
comment: The hotel itself is excellent and perfect location, and excellent view from the 25th floor; However the AC is so NOISE that woke me up all night long each time it would go on. It was nice and quite when off, but it would startle me each time it come back on - so we could not sleep and we were very tired the next day to do Philly tourist stuff.

title: Overnight in Anchorage
comment: After spending 3 weeks in a village in rural

everyoneShouldKnow: Perfect location for Amway Center events
title: Great for Concert Trip
comment: Perfect location for concerts at the Amway Center. Thanks for the hotel shuttle over to the Amay! Great service at check in with lots of info and coupons given for area eateries. Second time staying there and will stay again.

title: beautiful hotel
comment: this was my first vacation in 3 years. thank you so much for making my fiance and mine so nice. you have a great hotel. the view from our room was lovely.loved watching the navy ships roll in, in the morning.keep up the good work. we will be back!

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent food! Must try room service!
title: Great Belvoir!!!
comment: So many great things about this hotel! Free parking. Excellent food (all healthy, just try their room service) and it was very reasonably priced. The food presentation is more like what you'd find in a gourmet restaurant! Kids loved the pool and jacuzzi. Free WiFi. Of note, our kids are 10 and 8, and we came to visit Legoland and SeaWorld. I picked this hotel because of its great reviews. When we got here, folks told us it would take 1.5 to 2 hrs to drive to Legoland! Well, it actually only took us 1 hr and we were driving 65-70mph. We did notice people drive pretty slowly around here. The stay here was so good that the distance did not bother us. Seldom was there traffic and the hotel is right off of Route 4, the main vein to all the parks. Very convenient! BTW - as BPG member, we used the Club Member Lounge. Again, food is great here! Good selection for breakfast. Snacks in evening ranged from spring rolls to chicken pot pies to quiches and skewers. Not bad!

title: Beautiful entrance buttttt
comment: coming in the hotel was beautiful and for the price I thought great deal but after checking in and getting in the room I found they had no microwave, dim lighting and NO FREE INTERNET ecept for having to set down in the hotel lobby to access it or paying additional for it... THIS WAS A BIG NEGATIVE FOR ME!!!!! just comparing for the price these little perks makes all the difference for me.... with all of the upgrades some things should have been a given....

title: not so good for the money
comment: I found this Grandbourne hotel be to lacking.

title: great hotel
comment: great hotel, great beach, great location

title: Overall rating
comment: From the front desk, to the restaurants, to to valet attendents, this was an outstanding experience.

title: Pretty good stay!
comment: I stayed there for three night for attending the conference at Stanford and had a pretty good experience. I would recommand it to otheres!

everyoneShouldKnow: It is safe and secure and the staff is well trained and responsive.
title: Good Experience
comment: We stayed at the hotel for one week recently and had a very positive experience. The staff was receptive to our needs and the location was perfect for what we wanted to do. The 16th St Mall is active with a wide variety of persons, so be prepared for whatever you come across. We upgraded to a suite and enjoyed having the extra space for our family.

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel needs to pay much more attention to details
title: Not the best
comment: Deficiencies make you wonder just how well run this hotel really is. Out of some food items in club lounge during breakfast. Had reserved and received confirmation for a suite upgrade, but room was given away before we arrived. Room we were given instead had light bulbs out and non-working air conditioner. Outdoor pool needed to be cleaned badly. Even the club level room we were given was small with small bathroom. One positive -- the front desk stepped up and offered 7,500 points (2.5 x the points for a free night at this hotel) for the bad experience.

title: Upgraded to a top floor room
comment: I was upgraded to a 19th floor suite without being asked and it was a nice surprise. We loved our room and we also received complimentary breakfast coupons which was a great bonus. One thing I would like complain is that the night crew (even the front desk staff) should pay more attention to the cleanliness of the hotel. One of the elevators was messy and one of the rooms on my floor had an empty beer case left in front of the room (in the hallway) that didn't get cleaned up until the next day. We noticed the night staff (front desk) playing with a computer that is mean to be used by the guests instead of patrolling the hotel to make sure it's kept clean.

title: Great location, but....
comment: This is a great location and the rates are very reasonable, but the room that we stayed in had very dirty carpet. It certainly needed cleaning and probably should be replaced. Room 601.

everyoneShouldKnow: Front desk was helpful and friendly
title: Great front desk staff
comment: The front desk seemed short staff. Felt bad for the staff because they were doing a million things, but still smiling. Janice was great. Area seem a little scary at night, but overall it was a nice hotel.

title: Weekend Stay
comment: My family liked the hotel, and the staff were really friendly. We will come back again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Not great recognition of Gold Status, no access to Club Lounge if you are "only gold". Parking attendant are not proactive.
title: No Club lounge access if you are "only Gold". Poor Service, one bottle of water in room
comment: Arrive by 9.00 PM, 2 parking attendants doing nothing did not bother with us until I started getting the luggage myself.

everyoneShouldKnow: A GREAT hotel if you want to go to Universal Studios or City Walk.
title: Really a wonderful stay!
comment: It was really a nice stay. All staff, front desk, resturant (Billy), parking attendants were very professional, helpful and all with a smile on their face. The room was clean, beautiful linen and decor. I stayed at the Universal City, CA. There was a shuttle that was very convenient for visiting Universal City and the City Walk. Free self parking!! I can say I will be back next year.

title: Excellent Service and Food
comment: I have stayed many times, it is my go-to hotel when in Los Angeles. Excellent BPG recognition, outstanding service, and great food. Reception staff is top notch and a wonderful gym that is way above average.

everyoneShouldKnow: The employees are rude and the hotel itself is understaffed.
title: Convention
comment: My organization held our bi-annual convention at this hotel. From the moment we stepped into the hotel as guests, I noticed the lack of staff and respect from all employees. This hotel was severely understaffed for having not only a convention with over 800 people involved, but also several other large groups. I spoke with three gentlemen and a woman while checking in and out. The two that I spoke with checking in were very nice, but completely overwhelmed. The woman was completely rude. The gentleman I spoke to while checking out and he was very rude to me and other guests in line. And he was supposed to be the front desk supervisor. The housekeeping was slow and understaffed. Nor did they speak any English so when I asked if she could come back in 15 minutes when I was leaving, she had no idea what I was saying, so I had to vacate my room that I paid a lot of money for. Our biggest complaint was that they were not prepared for a group of our capacity. We had booked the rooms far enough in advance that there should not have been the wait we had. We had booked 2 rooms, neither were ready when we were there to check in at 3pm and one wasn't ready until 6:30 - our meetings started at 5:30. There were women in our group who didn't have rooms until after dinner had started at 8:00pm. Completely unacceptable.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is a good stopping off point when you are travelling long distances.
title: Our experience
comment: Our room #113 had problems which kept us up much of the night. Someone had programmed the clock to go off at 2:22AM and then again around 4:30 am. Then the toilet ran. This ttok away from the enjoyment of our stay and made our next day travel much more tiring.

everyoneShouldKnow: excellent location, large enough that rooms are usually available
title: consistently provides excellent service
comment: I've stayed here many times visiting family in Boston and I keep coming back because I know that my room will be clean and ready when I arrive, my car is well-cared for and available whenever I need it. Direct access to the Prudential stores means that weather is never and issue.

everyoneShouldKnow: Pleasant stay at a hotel with a 10 minute walk from the beach made this a quiet retreat. Many European guests added a continental feel to the hotel.
title: Reasonably priced for location and quality
comment: Very pleased with room which was both soothing and contemporary in decor with a large, white marble bathroom. As a Gold BPG member, we were upgraded to a room with partial ocean view on a higher floor. Concierge service at the main desk was very friendly and helpful, less so at the side table to the left of the entry, where there was only one staffer, who was unable to meet the demand. He became curt with me after I had waited awhile to be helped with driving directions. I avoided him thereafter by using only the receptionists at the main desk, who always proved more helpful, and always were pleasant. The pool area was very nice, if a tad small, a problem around 4 to 7 pm when the pool filled with hordes of kids. However, the parents were very attentive to their offspring, aware of more adult tenor of the hotel, monitored splashing and all the children were exceedingly well behaved.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is not worth the price.
title: Very Disapopinting
comment: The room was dank, smelled of urine and cigarette smoke. For the price ($234/night) I expected much better. This is not a property that represents the Belvoir brand well. I am grateful that I was there for a conference and did not bring my entire family-- it would have been a vacation disaster for sure.

title: An Exceptionsl Service Experience
comment: This is a wonderful property with an exceptionally friendly and accommodating staff. Great amenities and a beautiful location.

title: Affordable and consistent
comment: We've stayed here a few times. The price is always fair and it's close to Downtown, SeaWorld and the beaches. The hotel is starting to get a bit beat. but nothing to make it look uninviting etc.

title: facilities needs improvement
comment: I was frozen in the room because of AC malfunction.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is old! The major advantage however is that the location is excellent.
title: This hotel is old and needs a lot of improvement
comment: I expected much better from this hotel. While the room was good and I got upgraded to the club floor because I am a platinum member, the facilities were below average. The club lounge looks shabby and old. The front desk has average service, they never pick up the phone. I tried calling room service and the front desk about 5 times at night and got no response. I was in a suite on the 26th floor and had to go down twice, once because they deactivated my room key and the second time because there was a cockroach in my room! and I could not get through to anyone in Guest Services. The people at the front desk seemed almost annoyed that I had come down to tell them about this. I travel quite a bit and the other Belvoirs I have been to are definitely not like this. I really hope the hotel gets the facelift it so badly needs.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great central location to everything in Seattle.
title: Great hotel; room keys need help
comment: This hotel is in the city center of Seattle and a perfect location to get to anywhere. The Sound Tranzit station is just a block away where you can take the train to the airport, the stadiums and anywhere in between. It is within walking distance to Pike's Market which is always a fun place to walk. It's also within walking distance (a few blocks) to the Underground tour which is quite interesting.

title: Nashville downtown
comment: The staff provided excellent service. The greeting at the front desk was 1st rate, we very made to feel as a guest, not just a customer. The room were clean and very comfortable. Morning breakfast was really good, they even had lox on the buffet, which we would not have expected in Nashville. Our server also offered coffee to go as we were leaving. Only things that could have have been better are it took a while to get an elevator and it would have been nice if the pool had a changing room, showers and hot tub. Overall, an A++

everyoneShouldKnow: Restaurant staff is cheerful and helpful!
title: Super clean, comfy beds, helpful staff!
comment: We stayed for 4 nights while attending the convention of Jehovah's Witnesses in Ogden. We found the room to be impeccably clean, the beds super comfy, and the staff truly helpful.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff are great. Very freindly and very helpful
title: Awesome staff make for an awesome stay
comment: The staff here is A+. From Sam, Max, Emeka, Joey and more at the front desk to Penny at the Mix bar. They are always very friendly, helpful and professional. Its nice to know that most of them have been there for years and understand the needs of their guests.

everyoneShouldKnow: The side facing the freeway is extremely noisy. Request a room facing the opposite side.
title: This location seriously needs a renovation!!!
comment: It's been a while since I stayed at this Belvoir location and now I remember why I have not been back for such a long time. This location seriously needs a renovation. The room lacks good sound insulation (you can hear the traffic from the freeway very clearly), the shower water pressure is very weak and overall needs a lot of work. This location is quite run down and needs a lot of attention. I will probably never stay here again.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's in the perfect location, the staff are extra friendly and the food at Rusty's is the best.
title: Always a Pleasure
comment: I always enjoy my stay at this Belvoir and will come back every year. Thank you so much for always making me feel welcome and safe, even during a tropical storm. :-)

everyoneShouldKnow: Fantastic location. One thing that is disappointing, though, is that the hotel wanted to charge me to ship my phone charger back to me, which was mistakenly left in the room after check-out. Upon calling the hotel the following day, I was told that I would incur the shipping expense. As a loyal BPG member, this was disappointing, as I recall another hotel property I've stayed at where I also accidentally left an item -- and they shipped it to me at no cost to me, no questions asked.
title: Nice stay, superb location
comment: We make at least two family weekend trips to Seattle a year, often staying in Bellevue, but sometimes treating ourselves to a downtown stay. The Belvoir's location is unbeatable, however, the expensive Valet parking is truly a deterrent for us staying here each time we visit.

everyoneShouldKnow: Nicely rennovated hotel in a great location.
title: Great stay
comment: I had a wonderful time at this hotel. Quick check-in and great service at the hotel. My room was very nice and quiet. The location of the hotel is perfect for pleasure or business; close to everything but still a bit removed from the most noisy part of Times Square. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Good but Lacking
comment: Nice hotel. Great view, clean room. When we arrived I asked for a roll-away. We got to the room and noticed there were no wash cloths so I called to request some. We waited 45 minutes but neither arrived. I called and again requested the bed and towels. She apologized, said they we backed up. She said we didn't need to be in the room as long as we didn't have the "do not disturb" on the door, they would bring it in. Before we left, the towels arrived. When we got back to the room at 2am, no bed. I called again and had to wait another 15 minutes or so before we FINALLY got the bed. Very Frustrating!!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice location but everything else was disappointing.
title: This is a Belvoir???
comment: Wow where do I start... Pros: Location Cons: Painfully slow check-in due to lack of desk clerks and no management visible; guest rooms not ready on time (it was 10pm and had to wait an hour for a clean room); valet parking is $22 per day SURPRISE!!! If you want to walk 2 blocks away you can self park for $8 what a deal! a/c in room kept it barely cool enough to stay in room and I was in the prestigious 10th floor... ummm yeah; 10th floor "suite" not worth the money no fridge, small tv, very blah... can do much better in a regular room at most other major chains; 10th floor breakfast was a joke... completely understaffed and little available to eat. Lady working the breakfast room did not have a clue as she was busy replenishing the coffee cream while there was nothing to eat and a room full of pretty upset people (I paid extra for this???); everytime I walked past the front desk it was basically pandamonium with no management in site... long lines full of upset people.

title: Mediocre Hotel
comment: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times. Unfortunately, the rates in Philadelphia are pricey. So, I end up staying here. I wish I could stay somewhere else, but as a loyal Grandbourne customer - have to stay here. The rooms are run down, staff has been inefficient. Inevitably, there seems to be a problem with my reservation every time I check in, as well. I hope they get their act together - as unfortunately, I'm sure I will be here again.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is not an acceptable place to stay.
title: The Worst Belvoir I Have Ever Stayed At
comment: I have enjoyed quality service and facilities with Belvoir all over the world. However, the Birmingham, AL Belvoir is a glaring exception. Service is non-existent at the Birmingham Belvoir. Its hallways and carpets are horribly stained, the rooms stink (literally), and the air conditioning in the three rooms I tried to stay in was unable to cool the rooms to anything below 90 degrees F. My children's rooms had the same issues. We will never stay there again. Never.

title: Summer Vacation
comment: Our room was not cleaned each day. Toilet was broken. Counters and floors were dirty and sticky. Hotel staff all around was unhelpful.

title: The staff is great
comment: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Read House Hotel in Chattanooga. The front desk, housekeeping, and valet staffs were extremely helpful and professional. They really set the standard for great customer service! The room was very clean and spacious with nice amenities. The only minor disappointment was that the hot tub was out of order while we were there.

title: excellent
comment: I will be back!! Wonderful place to stay!!

title: Location is awesome!
comment: Next to the hotels on the monorail system, the Swan and Dolphin are the best located hotels on the Disney property! Be sure to watch the Epcot fireworks from your room or on the Boardwalk. Great pool!

everyoneShouldKnow: Every room has a microwave and mini-refrigerator.
title: Great outdoor pool for swimming laps
comment: We selected this hotel because of its proximity to the Plaza. We had read some negative reviews but had no problems with our accommodations.

title: An old hotel - but priced right
comment: This is an older hotel in need of renovation, but the price is right. The rooms are all suites and you get a little refrigerator and nice living room. The pool is nice - although the seating area is average, but they do have a nice hot Jacuzzi. Sadly, they make you go to the front desk to get/return towels. The staff is super friendly and parking is free. Platinum guests aren't upgraded (since every room is a suite), but they do get free breakfast. It's a decent spread - nothing fancy, but will help you start your day right. Eggs, bacon, potatoes, & yummy fruit. I'd stay here again, especially for the price.

title: july 2012 trip to dolphin
comment: great location and disney access. large hotel so when things go wrong...takes time to resolve

title: Awesome Hotel...Great Location
comment: The hotel is right next to LAX, and not a far drive from Venice Beach or the Santa Monica Pier. The staff was very friendly, and the room service/bar food was the best I've ever had in a hotel. We met some awesome people, including some of the builders/filmers for the X Games, and ended up staying almost an extra week because we enjoyed our stay so much. I will definitely be staying here again! The fitness center was nothing short of amazing and the pool was heated to a wonderful temperature so we could swim comfortably at night.

title: Very Happy
comment: I have stayed at this hotel many times. The staff is great. The rooms are nice, The club lounge is really nice. It's a great feature of certain customers. I would recommend thus hotel over and over again.

everyoneShouldKnow: There are other Belvoirs' or BPG properties in the area that offer better deals.
title: Not up to Belvoir standards
comment: Upon arrival BPG Event Planner did not receive any reward gift non an up grade.

title: Sightseeing
comment: The hotel is just fine when you want to do downtown Manhattan sightseeing. The rooms are a bit small, but okay if all you want to do is sleep there. Free internet is available in the lobby. A real breakfast from the hotel restaurant is very expensive, so it will have to be something from the coffee shop in the lobby or from Dunkin Donuts across the street.

everyoneShouldKnow: Fabulous food and amenities and helpfulness of staff
title: This hotel has one drawback.
comment: As far as we are concerned this hotel's bathroom are somewhat small compared to other Belvoir hotels. I noticed in this hotel that there are no towel racks installed in the bathroom, therefore precluding one from utilizing the towels more than once. This negates the efforts of the hotel to conserve energy and expense of reusing the towels more than once.'

title: Needs Improvement
comment: We requested an early checkin for noon, we arrived at 2:30pm and were advised that our room was not ready yet and to come back closer to checkin time at 3:00 - went back numerous times and at 4:15 were given the room key, proceeded to the room which was not ready yet, the housekeeping staff were still there. The hall on the 2nd floor was a disaster, there were mini refrigerators lining the hall, trash bags piled all over, cleaning carts and towel racks everywhere. It looked like someone had trashed all rooms. We went back to the front desk and asked for another room. We were given another one and also club privileges, but the keys were not activated.

title: Awful for wedding accommodations
comment: When I chose this hotel for guest accommodations for my wedding night, I didn't know there was a distinction between guests and "club guests". This meant that none of my relatives who booked rooms were given the "complimentary breakfast, afternoon hors doeuvres and a variety of beverage options". I was horribly embarrassed that my wedding invitations mentioned features that were only given to guests if they paid for suites. It wasn't clear enough on the website or in my communications with the hotel rep. When I spoke with the hotel staff about it the night of my arrival, they wouldnt offer anything other than that guests could pay the additional cost for the club level, meaning they would have to pay $30 more per room, would still have their regular rooms but could then have access to the 5th floor for the complimentary items. I also thought a "block of rooms" meant everyone would be on the same floor and had planned on everyone joining me while my hair and makeup was done in my suite on the wedding morning, however, I was on the 5th floor and everyone else was on the 3rd or 4th and the elevators didn't allow guests to go further than the floor that their room was on. Those without a room key couldn't use the elevator at all so when my stylist arrived and then later the photographer, I had to go down and get them (even though I was busy with other things). Then I had to have someone go down to the other floors with my room key every time a family member was ready to come up to my room, so my phone was ringing nonstop. It was a huge hassle and I very much regretted choosing Belvoir during both nights of my stay. Also, the shuttle that I arranged to come pick up guests from the venue at midnight went to the front entrance, but everyone was expecting it at the back entrance (where it had earlier dropped them off), so everyone missed the midnight shuttle and had to wait outside for almost an hour for it to come back. This was all extra stress that I did NOT need on my wedding weekend.

title: Great stay
comment: Had a great time. Front desk staff was exceptional at check in. Everything we wanted to do was within a 10 mile radius. Will definitely stay there again.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff works extra hard to please the guests.
title: Staff accommodates your needs
comment: My husband and I had just gotten off a red eye flight and got to the hotel at 10:30 a.m. We were so tired! But I knew that check in was much later. I approached the desk and asked if there was a chance to check in early and they said, no problem. We were able to get the blessed rest we needed right away without having to wait around. I have stayed at this hotel numerous times and I'm always amazed at the great service. Everything was top rate from the room to the bar and restaurant. Never disappointed. We will definitely stay here again!

title: Needs Improvement
comment: We had a lot of trouble with housekeeping during our one week stay. The cleaning performed varied daily. There was no consistency. They did not clean the bathroom unless we asked for it to be done. Same for vacuuming. At times the beds would not be made. The trash was not emptied daily even when overflowing. The coffee and tea were not replenished unless specifically requested. The housekeeping was not what I would expect from a Belvoir. They just did the least amount possible that they could get away with. They even fought with us when we asked for an additional comforter giving us the third degree about why we needed one and what we were going to use it for. We brought the issues to the attention of the housekeeping managers who apologized but the fact that the room was not cleaned daily makes me question returning to this hotel the next time we are in NYC. The housekeeping service was not what one expects from a Belvoir hotel and certainly detracted from our stay.

title: Great Hotel & Staff
comment: Pros:

title: Accommodating Staff
comment: When I got there I was booked for two rooms. My friend and I went to the first room and it was under construction. The room should have been taken off the list but it wasn't. I went downstairs a little upset, but I didn't show it. A young lady changed the room but only King rooms were available. She upgraded the room and included complimentary breakfast. She was very nice and thanked me for being nice. The next day when my other guest arrived, we went back down stairs and got two double rooms. The staff were very accommodating and even moved the things out of one room. The hotel staff was very nice and the Hotel is in a great location! I would highly recommend anyone to stay here.

title: Great location, uncomfortable beds
comment: We stayed for two nights. Positives: access to the pool, location of hotel to shopping, pleasant front desk staff. Negatives: extremely uncomfortable beds (the sheets and comforter were extremely crispy, almost like the paper cover on the doctor's table, and the mattress was murderous to my back). Also, we reserved a deluxe room which should have had a microwave and fridge. When we checked in, we were told they would have to bring those items to us, as they were out of the rooms. Fine. After my second phone call, they brought the fridge, but not the microwave. I called about that, but it was never brought and we gave up hope for it. I have had excellent experience with Sherton in the past, but am hesitant to try again for fear of the uncomfortable beds.

title: Faulty reservation; mediocre room
comment: I had booked a room in April for a king room in the Marina Tower (where our meetings were). When I arrived, they had be down for a twin room in the Bay Tower. They switched me to a king room (with a nice view), but would only put me in the Marina Tower if I paid a $35/night upgrade fee for a suite. Im not authorized to do this. There were other problems with the room. The light switch at the room entry only lights the entryway. There was no light to see the switches to the other lights, so I had to grope in the dark, not a very safe practice. The bulb in the desk lamp was burned out. The desk was too tall relative to the chair height. I had to reach up to use my computer or write (and Im 5-10 tall). This was neither comfortable nor ergonomic. They tried to deliver a package to my room at 10:30 p.m., after I had gone to bed. On a minor note, the coffee service tray was incomplete on the first night.

everyoneShouldKnow: It has the poorest service of any BPG hotel I have stayed.
title: Worst stay
comment: Upon arrival and check in, I was told gold members do not receive upgrades. I was given a room with a view of a back alley and garbage. When I called the front desk and asked for a better view, I was told they would call me in room after checking for something better but they never responded.

title: Great Hotel
comment: This is an excellent hotel. I loved my stay.

title: Awesome facility
comment: We selected this hotel due to its central location. We were able to travel easily to Williamsburg and the surrounding beaches as well as enjoy the harbor at Norfolk. We were afforded the luxury of an upgrade to the Club Level; which was awesome. The staff in the Club lounge were very personable and eager to meet your needs in a very cheerful manner. Our room was harbor side with a small balcony; which gave us a wonderful view of the harbor. The staff at the front desk were very busy; however they greeted you in a very professional and courteous manner. The valet attendents were also first-rate. They were energenic and courteous. Overall I would have to say this facility provided us with a wonderful mini vacation that was more than we expected. We will definitely consider this again; hopefully in the near future.

title: Great Value
comment: Who knew that an airport hotel could be this good? Never had any idea I was near an airport until I needed to get my flight - very convenient. And only minutes from historic Charleston.

everyoneShouldKnow: The parking fee is $14 but you can park on the street at night.
title: Ok hotel
comment: There are two things about this hotel that I didn't like. One being the dirty smell in the hallway on the 9th floor. There were a big pile of sheets left on the hallway floor for two days but the smell was there the first day and stayed there until the last day. Room was fine. The other thing is the parking fee. $14 per day. Just so people know you can park on the street in-front of the hotel at night and not pay the parking fee.

title: GREAT LOCATION
comment: When we initially saw our room, we were a little disappointed in the small size, and considered an upgrade. Since the hotel was full and no upgrades were available, we decided to make the best of it. Turns out that the excellent location of the hotel, and the value for the money we paid for our vacation package through American Airlines vacations made it the best vacation we could have asked for. Absolutely pleased with the accommodations and location.

title: Downtown Dallas
comment: This was my second stay at this hotel and I plan on keeping this one on my list. It has been recently renovated and is very clean. The price is right and the staff is friendly.
