Plus its pet friendly!!! The only downfall is that its not in the middle of downtown, but it's a very short drive to all the sights.

everyoneShouldKnow: GREAT location to view NYC's Macy's Fireworks
title: Fireworks BOOM to fizzle???
comment: My family and I have stayed at the Meadowlands Belvoir for the past several years to watch the NYC Macy's fireworks and attend the Meadowlands Fair. The view from the Club Room is FABULOUS. Check-in was efficient and quick, the staff as a whole was friendly - there were 2 issues on the day of departure that I brought to the staff's attention; 1-a young child was left unattended by the pool area, he entered the hot tub and claimed to have urinated in it to one of his siblings, 2-within 10 minutes by the pool area, several (4+) LARGE (@2 inches long) bugs were found by/in the pool. I understand that issue 1 is beyond staff control in as far as they can not be responsible for another's actions esp. that of a child, but it can/should be monitored by making sure children are supervised by adults. I informed the desk of the issues and received a blanket statement that "it has been noted and the proper staff members will be informed" I LOVE the location of the hotel for the activities attended, bc of health issues during the summer, I can not be exposed to long periods of heat and to be able to watch the fireworks with my family from the comfort of our hotel and a/c is WONDERFUL and to be able to attend the Fair all day and not have to drive is a PLUS. I'm torn in regards to next years adventure because of the advantages of it's location but still have thoughts of the bugs in my mind and the little boys comment of urinating in the hot tub...

title: Festive and Enjoyable
comment: As part of a wedding, we stayed at the Mahwah Belvoir. Not only were we in a festive mood, but there were other wedding parties that just added to our great mood. Great hotel and responsive staff! (Breakfast the next AM after a late night also hit the spot!)

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location and decent, accomodating front desk staff. Manager on duty was awesome. Sorry that I didnt get his name.
title: Disappointed in Amenities
comment: The rooms were fine, as expected but there was no refrigerator or microwave. They wanted to charge me $25 for a regrigerator. And I am a Grandbourne "Preferred" Guest. HaHa. In addition to that, the biggest disappointment is that they wanted to charge me $25 for internet! In this day and age, I'm sorry, but internet should be free!! Adding insult, I borrowed the billards equipment and they purposely decided not to give me the triangle to set the balls up "in case I didnt know enough about billiards". Unbelievable! The guy who made that decision should have a talking to.

title: Would Not stay again
comment: Our stay began with check in, which was suppose to be at 3, but we were not given a room until 4 (We arrived at noon)

title: Nice Hotel - Value = $ for Group Rate
comment: The price was OK for group rate, but if I had to pay "rack rate", I would say it was overpriced. Bar/grill was very good, the Harbor resturant was too pricey. Had some nice "cubbys" for meetings & the concierge was very helpful. Paying for parking is ridiculous.....should not if you are a guest. Fitness center very nice.

everyoneShouldKnow: Ask for a quiet room by the rose garden or koi pond.
title: Terrible road noise.
comment: We have stayed here several times, and know to ask for a room facing the interior. I had the BPG elite operator make a note on our reservation and also asked at check in about a quiet room. We were assured this room was quiet and away from road noise, but alas at 11 pm we were moving to a suddenly available quiet room.

everyoneShouldKnow: A easy to reach location from the major interstate highways. It is "dog friendly."
title: A good value
comment: The Belvoir in SLC is a very good value. The rooms are exceptional and the staff is helpful and friendly. We especially liked that they are "dog friendly" and our dog had a great time.

title: Great Hotel!
comment: We have stayed at this hotel many times, particularly over the July 4th weekend. We have never been dissapointed! Great customer service, great location and always a pleasure to return to after a hot day in the sun listening to jazz. Thanks to everyone that makes our stay pleasant. It takes all of you to make us happy enough to keep returning. Keep up the good work!

title: Wish we had known earlier...
comment: The room, beds and location are great. Our complaint is that there was a youth conference that brought seemingly1000+ teens to the hotel, making just about every space crowded with a teen mob including the rooftop pool which was entirely overrun the entire day and basically unuseable for anyone else. We know its not staff responsibilty to give a heads up when booking but would have been nice. We checked out early.

title: Not as good as I was expecting
comment: Room cleanliness was the major issue. reported the issue to management who contacted housekeeping. the problem was somewhat taken care of, but not to my standards. For 2 nights we were plagued by mosquitoes in the room. Had to have the room sprayed twice. Some staff had an attitude of couldn't care less about customer service. The best feature of the hotel was the spa, the staff were very helpful here.

title: convenient to Syracuse U, but
comment: room rate too high for a weekday & breakfast not worth it. parking cost extra. pool was not clean

everyoneShouldKnow: One of the nicer hotels in Burlington, VT
title: Concert Stay
comment: Was in town for a concert, had stayed at the hotel before. I was sent an email to upgrade to the club level. The hotel never received it. When i went to check in it did not show. I was told the room was not ready went back to the desk and 40 minutes later questioned them about it a room was available and immediately checked in. The associate in the club lounge was very helpful.

everyoneShouldKnow: how awesome it is, nice well kept old hotel, great staff
title: pool/hot tub
comment: hot tub was not in use @ all, indoor pool was way to chlorinated, not much ventalation, having asthma this did not work for us.

title: Excellent Deal
comment: Convenient. Close to airport and highway.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff was extremely friendly which added to everyone, the guests, there being in a good mood or happy mood.
title: Last Minute Stay
comment: I reserved the hotel room on a last minute and they were more than accomodating! The staff was friendly and helpful in regards to the area and everything that I needed. The room was fabulous and the bed was comfy! I did eat at the restuarant there onsite, and will say the food was pretty good. It was a little salty for my taste, but otherwise fair. It was reasonably priced for a last minute reservation. I would and will definitely stay here again!

title: Excellent location-Services need improvement
comment: Excellent location but do not expect any amenities that are standard for rooms at this price range, even if you are a frequent guest or you are celebrating something. A bottle of water, newspaper delivery or a small plate of fruits would have added a warm feeling of hospitality. Breakfast Buffet can be improved. The hotel offers skipping maid service during your stay to get extra points! Not a great idea if you are staying more than a couple of days in a resort.

title: Vacation at Myrtle Beach
comment: We came down for a one day stay to explore Myrtle Beach. The staff at the desk were very professional with both check-in and check out. The young man on duty on the 5 July 2012 at check in went above and beyond. Buffet breakfast service excellent.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good location. Not too close to the main strip, but easy to get to around via the shuttle or scooter.
title: Enjoyed my stay!
comment: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It actualy looked just like it was shown online. The bed was very comforatable and everyone was really nice.

title: Ok for the price
comment: Over all the stay was OK. We were there for just one night and left early in the morning. The room was clean and comfortable. The room did have water from the severe storms that rolled in and the carpet was wet. We were informed of this prior to check in and we were told that the room had been sanitized professionally.

everyoneShouldKnow: We shopped around and found that this was the best place to stay in the area. This is our second stay here and we've not been disappointed.
title: This hotel is a great find!
comment: We stayed here during a visit to the area and found that this hotel offers excellent service. We needed a fold-away bed and it was delivered to our room promptly. This hotel is clean, family friendly and pet friendly, and offers many of the upscale options we enjoy. We will definately stay here again on our next family visit to the area.

title: Restful
comment: We stayed on a Sunday night. It was amazing! We practically had the hotel to ourselves. The bar served us dinner. We were upgraded to a larger room. Had a lovely breakfast in the Club room. We love staying at the West Des Moines Belvoir.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent place to stay, however the restaurants food is too expensive. Visitors will need to rent a car if they want to visit other locations there. Taxi service is too expensive.
title: No enough Food Places to Go
comment: My husband and I visited San Juan PR and we stayed at Belvoir Hotel. This is an excellent and clean hotel, however, there are two things we did not like about the stay. The transportation is very limited unless you take the bus(which is only .75) or taxi(which is too expensive - $18 -$20).

title: Convenient Location
comment: The staff has always been helpful and I like that the hotel has a club lounge, a large fitness room, and attached ramp parking. The exercise room desperately needs new ellipticals - there is only one very old, rough elliptical and it was broken this stay. In comparison to other Grandbournes properties, the rooms could use updating.

title: Great Place
comment: Just stayed at the Sand Ket Resort for the 5th time. This is definitely my favorite vacation place in Florida. Everything is great! The employees all seem to really love giving you everything that you desire.

title: wonderful stay
comment: Our room could not have been better...clean, comfy and INCREDIBLE view.

title: Great experience following Orlando
comment: We used our BPG reward to stay in beach tower on 4th of July. Awesome experience, and met our beach expectations. Tower is right on beach, have use of 2 pools too, great location for fireworks, and sounds silly, worth getting out early for chairs on the beach (awesome cushions on custom terry covers) and reasonable umbrella rental cost. Recommend eating outside hotel, but is close to everything. Parking cost reasonable.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is by far the best resort around for your money. I went and looked in every other hotel in the area, and they were all hundreds of dollars more for less features.
title: Great Hotel for All Ages
comment: I went on vacation with a friend from college. We are in our mid twenties and worried that the hotel would be too family oriented; however, that was not true. Yes, the resort had plenty of entertainment and fun for families (so, if you have a family, it will be great!), but it was also well suited for any other age. There is something for everyone. Our room was the lowest possible rate to be booked, and it was still phenomenal. The bed was unreal, and the room had plenty of space. The pools were fun and well maintained. All of the food onsite was awesome, and the staff was fantastic. The poolside bar was so convenient. The food was great, and the servers were excellent. Overall, the hotel staff was more than accommodating. The location was also great. This is one of the only properties in the area that is actually beach front. The hotel is far enough away from the crowds to be quiet and nice, but it is also close enough to walk to shops, restaurants, and more. I would highly recommend this hotel. It was honestly much better than I ever could have imagined. I can't wait to go back.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is about 3 miles from downtown San Diego.
title: Excellent hotel
comment: The features of this hotel are great they have a pool that is beautiful and the views from the marina and of the bay are beautiful.

title: Great features
comment: We all liked the club lounge...Pat who worked there was so helpful and friendly. We liked the location; you can walk to Target and a few restaurants. The pool was really nice. The rooms were clean - in very good shape, the staff was very friendly and nice. The points used were more than fair. Overall a great visit!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location, nice outdoor pool (no bar at pool)
title: Reserved room not received
comment: I reserved a suite a month prior to travel, when checking in the hotel with my wife and 3 kids was told that there were no suites available and put in a room with two twin beds. It would have been much nicer to get the room I actually reserved.

everyoneShouldKnow: Set on the lake near restaurants and the Columbia Mall. Luxury for a great price.
title: Power Outage
comment: We had been without power 5 days when we decided to escape to the Belvoir which would accept our 74 lb Golden Retriever. Love the hotel and lake, will make this our go to hotel when we lose power. Beautiful setting, hotel pool and the nicest staff ever. Breakfast wonderful and waitress so friendly. Room wonderful with microwave and fridge, spacious and the best bed in any hotel. Keep up the good work. Great setting for a wedding or conferenc

title: Recent Stay
comment: !st time staying @ this location. Staff was initially friendly, but one time I attempted to call guest svc from my rm and no one answered after 2 attempts. The room itself was avg. clean but in need of updating especially the bathrm. Exec lounge was good and attendant was helpful. This hotel is convient due to location, via airport and Atlanta, but I expect better from Grandbourne for the price.

everyoneShouldKnow: Room was very comfortable; balcony room is for viewing, not sitting outside and having a cup of coffee, etc.
title: Nice facility
comment: Enjoyed our stay over the 4th of July-was able to see fireworks in the surrounding areas from the 18th floor. Staff was very pleasant, club lounge was nice, pool was nice but doesn't get sun until the afternoon, great location for shopping and dining, like the "suite" room style. Am a local and was very pleased with my selection over the other Grandbourne options.

title: This Hotel has what you need
comment: The hotel has rooms and features that provide you with everything you need and nothing unnecessary.

everyoneShouldKnow: The lobby is nice, the rooms are a little outdated
title: Issue with water
comment: I had booked a room last minute on 6/20 after a business meeting had been moved to the Belvoir for the morning of 6/21. The lobby of the hotel is very nice, however I felt like I was checking in at a Las Vegas strip hotel because of the check-in line. Unfortunately, the rooms don't reflect what you see in the lobby. They are clean, but rather old and in need of updating. The bathroom fixtures for example looked like they were from the early 80's. None of this would have mattered much to me except when I woke up to get ready for my meeting the next morning, the water was completely off in the South Tower. Unfortunately, I had to attend the business meeting without the benefit of a clean, hygienic body and mouth. It was pretty disgusting. After the meeting, the water was turned back on and I was able to shower, pack, and check-out. The check-out girl managed to comp my coworker's wifi service for the night for her troubles, however, I hadn't purchased wifi and she indicated she was not able to comp anything on my bill. She did indicate she would award me additional Grandbourne points, but I never received them. This is why I'm writing this review. If I would have received the Grandbourne points as promised, I would have remained silent.

everyoneShouldKnow: come to the front desk without any expectation of good attitute.
title: Good Hotel in good location with missing service mind of staffs
comment: Staffs especially in front desk and concierge acted like guests.

title: Great experience
comment: I stayed with my family for 5 nights from 7/2-7/7. Rooms are comfortable with enough space for a family of 4. In general, location is great with access to Disney, multiple restaurants around the area and there is a Target in front of the hotel. We had access to the club lounge which served good food for breakfast and hors d'oeuvre. I will recommend to have more variety of food during the breakfast time. Gym is nice and clean and offers treadmills and free weights. Pool is small but heated. Parking is $12/day. Overall great experience. Staff in general are very professional and helpful. We will use this hotel next summer.

title: Great Location and amenities
comment: I stayed at the hotel while attending a meeting at the Ft. Worth Convention Center. The Convention Center is in walking distance. I greatly enjoyed the Ft. Worth Water Gardens which is right across the street from the hotel. It helped to make my walks to and from the Convention Center very pleasant. This was my first visit to Ft. Worth. The proximity of the hotel and the courtesy of the staff helped to make it extremely pleasant for me.

everyoneShouldKnow: This is a world class hotel!
title: Traditional 4th of July Vacation at the Belvoir Marina
comment: We started a family tradition to stay at the Belvoir Marina in San Diego for the 4th of July about 7 years ago. Granted the Big Bay Boom was a bust this year, we had a blast. We were hanging out at the pool in the afternoon, soaking up the sun and having a few cocktails. The staff at the Shoreline Restaurant by the pool was AWESOME! Beto, Jake, Melissa, Brittany were very busy but made sure you got your orders. The steel drum band set the tone in the afternoon and the pool attendants kept the kids busy with pool games. We met up with some friends and had a great dinner at the Harbors Edge. The family had a blast and my girls look forward to this trip every year.

everyoneShouldKnow: A great location for exploring Santa Monica and Venice beach area, with easy access to UCLA.
title: Belvoir Delfina - Santa Monica - a great long weekend.
comment: I found the hotel delightful and the staff extremely warm and helpful. The entire hotel has been renovated and is clean, modern and fun. The beds were fantastic.

title: Great Customer Service
comment: Everyone went above and beyond to accomodate and make us feel well taken care of. Facility was well kept and comfortable; could use some minor updating or remodeling. We will definitely stay there again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very outdate! Not worth the price!
title: Terrible stay...very disappointed!
comment: My wife and I stayed here over the weekend as a last minute decision. We often stay at another hotel when we are in Pittsburgh but thought that we would try the Belvoir for something different...terrible mistake! For the same price as the competator we stayed in a old, dirty, run down, room at the Belvoir. The room needed renovated about 15 years ago. The carpet is nasty...you will feel like you need to wear shoes at all times. The furniture is outdated. The wallpaper is very old. The bathroom was also very nasty...stained grout, outdated, and dirty toilet.

title: No free wifi
comment: Room comfort and cleanliness can not be matched, simple superb! We were shocked to find that there was no free wifi within the room. Unfortunately, my daughter needed cough medicine and no one knew where to send me after 9 PM in the vicinity of the hotel. After a brief walk around town, I found an all-night convenience store that carried the usual medical needs I was looking for just blocks from the hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: The location is excellent and the beds are comfortable.
title: Great Stay!
comment: I was a little disappoint that I couldn't get a hotel on Kalakaua but Princess Kaiulani is very close to Kalakaua. The location is great. We had a room right above the swimming pool. The bed was comfortable. They even brought up a roll away and that was just as comfortable. No springy coils. The Pikake Terrace Buffet was excellent. If you're staying at the hotel and your child is under 12 they eat free with each paying adult. What a great deal and they had live entertainment nightly. Wish I could stay longer but it was a very busy time so we had to check out and go to another hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Grotto Pool is amazing, the grounds are great and the location is perfect.
title: More disappointed than in past
comment: We have stayed here several times as our preferred choice for our Disney vacations. This last trip was the first time I felt the staff was not friendly. Part of the Disney experience is the friendliness of the staff. I realize this is not an official hotel of Disney World but the expectations should remain the same. The staff (cast members??) on many occasions did not even look in our direction as we walked by, let alone say hello.

title: Great Belvoir
comment: This hotel does a great job. Facility is nicely decorated (country clubish decor) and rooms are nice. Beds are wonderful. One of the staff members asked how was my stay and inquired whether there is anything the hotel can do to make it better. Great customer service here. The Club Lounge did an "over and beyond" typical food and beverage selection for hor devour hour. Very impressive club lounge. One small thing is that i could hear the neighbors in the next room who were not being loud at all, dont know if the sound was coming through the wall or what but was a little surprised not more sound proof, not sure if just my room, this floor or whether same in all rooms. Such a great hotel for a Belvoir, though, i still give it 5 stars.

title: Did not have GOLDEN experience at ALL
comment: Place was old and run down ... the staff was to interested in selling upgrades to the club then recognizing there BPG members -- they were not flexible about adding more rooms to reservations ... just a absolute BUST -- would not and will not go back -- try someplace else

everyoneShouldKnow: Very close to Universal Studios and City Walk
title: Wonderful Stay
comment: Stayed four nights at the Belvoir Universal Hotel. It's the perfect location if you're going to visit Universal Studios. Upon arrival, we were greeted immeciately by the valet staff. They were very polite and courteous. Our room was perfect. We asked for a roll-a-way bed for a 10 year old and it was brought up immediately to our room. Since we drove, to access our car, all we had to do was text the car ticket number to the valet and every time we went downstairs, the car was waiting for us. It's a great service! The gym was great, lots of treadmills. Overall, I would definitely stay here again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Anemic Staff. It is not like other Belvoir Hotels
title: Not what I expected
comment: Our stay was not pleasent. First, it was like a Pet hotel. Two rooms next to us had dogs barking all the time. Next room people smoking, it was reported and they continue smoking next day. No enforcement. The design is ok, the layout is not comfortable. The food was not good (room service). I will not stay at this hotel again.

title: nice hotel with nice pond on site
comment: The staff is friendly, the hotel is comfortable, and we like the nice pond on site.

everyoneShouldKnow: Small rooms - be prepared if it is a family vacation or a dance convention.
title: Not my favorite Belvoir
comment: This hotel is not the best Belvoir around. The rooms are small, the staff is unfriendly, the maids failed to bring enough towels, even after we requested additional towels, our toilet didn't work properly and there was a bug in the room.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Location is great for ease of traveling to nearby destinations.
title: This hotel needs renovating
comment: I enjoyed my stay however the carpets were really stained, and I could hear my neighbors making noise throughout the night. I also thought the elevators were extremely slow both to reach the desired floor and to open the doors. I received excellent service at the club lounge and at the receptionist desk, I can't complain.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location and the staff makes you feel at home.
title: Great Full Service Hotel
comment: I have to say that the Belvoir Phoenix Downtown exceeded my expectations. The entire staff was quick to offer assistance and everyone of them was able to answer any question. The room was clean and very comforatble and quiet. All requests were met with a yes. I ordered a microwave for the room before I arrived and it was in place ready to go when I checked in. Great hotel I will defintely recommend.

title: Great for stop overs.
comment: It was great for my purpose .One night stop over in between travel.The hotel was spotless.

title: Good Location
comment: Nice hotel for over night stay.

title: Just great.
comment: The location is wonderful. One block from the subway and in the middle of everything. The staff at checkin were great, and our maid left us extra of everything. Just clean and professional. We had a child with us to and she enjoyed every minute. Would stay again.

title: Nice Hotel, But A Few Issues
comment: My wife and I stayed here this past weekend for one night, and had just a couple problems. The self-parking wasn't marked with anything that says Belvoir on it, so we had to call the hotel to find out where to park. Also, when we couldn't find a restaurant in the immediate area that was still serving food after we checked in at 10 pm, we wanted to order room service. The menu said it was open until midnight, but at about 11:15 pm, I tried pushing the Room Service button on the phone, I tried dialing the Room Service extension listed on the phone, and I tried calling the front desk and getting them to connect me to Room Service, but no one in Room service ever answered the phone. Other than that, the room was comfortable, the Shedd Aquarium package was a steal, and we enjoyed our stay.

title: Older building renovated
comment: The outside was surprisingly old, but they clearly gutted it to reflect Grandbourne famous modern style. My room had a huge balcony overlooking the Pacific Ocean. The staff was helpful & courteous. The bartender made an amazing Bloody Mary that we made it a point to go downstairs everyday to get one. The hotel was personal & customer orientated.

everyoneShouldKnow: Centrally located for downtown activities. We felt very safe in the hotel. The valet staff was very prompt and courteous.
title: Great hotel for wedding guests.
comment: The Read House is very accommodating to wedding guests. Our son recently wed in Chattanooga, and we chose The Terrace Room as the rehearsal dinner venue. It worked well since there was a block of rooms reserved for those needing lodging for the wedding. The entire staff put our needs as top priority, from the valet attendants to the managers over the catered dinner. They made us glad that we chose The Read House as our home away from home for our long-distance wedding.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent staff and pets are welcome with much enthusiasm.
title: Awesome stay!
comment: The check in was a breeze and the pet waiver was ready for me to sign as I have requested when I made my booking.

title: Wedding group
comment: I worked with the sales office to book a block of rooms for guests at a Seattle wedding and they could not have been more helpful. I got nothing but rave reviews from the wedding guests . . . many of whom remarked on the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. We were not promised suite upgrades for my wife and me, or for the groom's parents, but it turned out that suites were available and we got them (even though the wedding events, planned by the wedding couple) were not held at the hotel. I cannot recommend this hotel enough.

everyoneShouldKnow: Free Shuttle service to and from Sesame Place and Albert!.
title: Perfect for Sesame Place
comment: Enjoyed my stay. Perfect for Sesame Place. Shuttle was so convenient and Albert was such a great Shuttle driver, very polite and helpful. He needs a raise! Very comfy beds. Only thing missing was a refrigerator in our room.

title: staycation
comment: I wish the pool was bigger. I didn't receive my free gift. Maybe I misunderstood the BPG promotion. I did get a larger room than I actually reserved so that was AWESOME. I loved the Jacuzzi tub in the room. thanks..

title: Beautiful Hotel
comment: Great hotel connected to the convention center. We were there for a conference. Did not like the view of the first room we were assigned. Was offered another room, our new room faced the atrium wonderful view. Staff very nice. I would recommend this hotel and would stay at this location again.

everyoneShouldKnow: First-class accomodation in a prime location.
title: Prime location and nice clean rooms
comment: You are within walking distance to all the great things that Downtown Seattle has to offer. The hotel has a beautiful lobby area and nice workout / pool facilities. Our room was so clean and comfortable that the kids wanted to just stay and hang out there! We plan to visit Seattle at least 3 times a year and will stay here everytime.

everyoneShouldKnow: There is NO WIFI in rooms!
title: Renovation needed but GREAT service!
comment: What this hotel lacks in aesthetics, they more than make up for in service. Property is nothing overly special as it relates to convention center hotels. Carpets are far, far, far past needing to be replaced. Rooms are average size. The best thing about the rooms are indeed the linens!! INCREDIBLY comfy beds!!! I was not impressed with the Housekeeping as I saw the same debris on my bathroom floor the day that I arrived until the day I checked out...5 nights later...which indicates they do no sweep. Staff could not be nicer. My expectations were high because I am BPG Gold. However, since I was in town with a convention, that didn't seem to mean much to anyone. I was able to at least get the extended check out.

title: AN EXCELLENT TIME
comment: I really enjoyed my stay. The beds were so comfortable, the shower spacious, and the room service was excellent. I also enjoyed the hotel pool. The location was convenient, being close to the shopping area. We're coming back in October!

title: roach
comment: I contacted hotel mgt about a roach being in my rm..hotel mgt never contacted me on a follow up.

everyoneShouldKnow: Bring a fan in the summer.
title: Uptown Review
comment: The Uptown Belvoir is clean, friendly and comfortable. There were only 2 negatives. One was the Air Conditioning. I am sure that 9 months out of the year, it's not a problem but in the middle of the Summer, it's uncomfortable. We had been there the week before so we brought a strong fan which helped. Also the pool was closed and again, it's the middle of Summer. Otherwise it is a very nice operation.

everyoneShouldKnow: The location is great...walking or subway access to everything you could need in Boston.
title: A great stay at the Belvoir Boston Hotel!
comment: We were in Boston for a convention at the Belvoir Boston Hotel and we loved staying there...we would return to this hotel for any visit back to Boston! The location was perfect...the Prudential Center shops & restaurants, close proximity to the "T", beautiful neighborhood to walk around. The hotel itself was also lovely...very clean and bright rooms and common areas, great pool and a Starbucks! The staff was also very accomodating. My son lost his cell phone in the convention area and it was found by a member of the housekeeping staff. Someone called me on my cell to report that they had found it and then they delivered it to our room...kudos to the housekeeping staff for such great service! We would highly recommend this hotel for a stay in Boston!

title: fantastic hotel
comment: all the staff was great, check in awesome

title: This hotel needs better service
comment: Person cleaning my room did not properly do so nor did they stock it correctly. The parking attendants were unresponsive when I asked for assistance.

title: Very Nice!
comment: Bed was great and staff very courteaous and went out of their way for us!

everyoneShouldKnow: It has a relaxing and comfortable atmosphere.
title: Best Hotel in Avon
comment: My husband and I stayed at this hotel almost 7 years ago and we decided to come back this past June. The rooms are exceptional and the staff is very helpful. It is a nice getaway and the rooms are so comfortable. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Avon/Vail.

title: Great time, needs met
comment: The hotel staff was very helpful with making our stay so wonderful. They were always a phone call away and very helpful with navigating the town. We had a great time in Boston and never once had to worry about our room. We used the pool everyday and the room service was delicious.

title: Wonderful Location
comment: Right on the beach at the end of the public beach area. Infinity pool was beautiful. Wait staff by the pool was rarely seen. Staff by pool did not wipe off chairs after the rain. Several parties left tables without ordering. Wonderful mermaid show in bar on Friday night.

title: Wonderful and relaxing.
comment: Everything was outstanding. Go to the grill at the golf club house and have lunch. Food is excellent and service was over the top. Pools, with place to dine outside, and spa are also a must if you go to this hotel. We would recommend this hotel and resort to our family and friends.

title: Great overall experience
comment: The staff is very friendly and helpful and our room was comfortable and clean. We were there for a convention and were allowed late checkout, to accomodate our needs. The hotel is in a convenient area of downtown Atlanta, within walking distance of restaurants. The staff was also helpful in recommending restaurants and sites in the area and the restaurants in the hotel were great as well. I would recommend the Belvoir to anyone travelling to Atlanta.

everyoneShouldKnow: Internet not included in room and expensive to use. You can connect for free in the lobby and there are computers availabe for use.
title: Friendly folks everywhere
comment: During our stay we found that not only was the hotel staff very friendly but all of the residents in the area were very nice and helpful with directions etc. The DART trains and Buses are right outside the doors so transportation is very convenient and inexpensive. The television in the room was new but the system did not work well and the signal/picture was poor. Only real disappointment was that Internet is NOT included with room. I appreciate the recycling efforts and a great dayly option to opt out of room service, in return you get a $5 voucher to use at any of the stores in the hotel.

title: To much construction in and around hotel during time of our stay
comment: 3:00 p.m. check in was not meet. My room was not ready at 3:00 p.m.. Had to keep checking at from desk and wait in lobby 2 to 3 hours before room got ready. Carpet had stains, bed skirt had stains, AC blowing warm air. Saw too many animals in hotel. What else?

title: Fabulous Experience
comment: This is a fabulous hotel. The rates were reasonable and our stay was very comfortable. One concern was the pool. I don't think the hotel uses professional grade chlorine tabs or chemicals, and is just pouring bleach into the pool for sanitation, or is not testing their chemical levels regularly. Upon entering the pool, our new suits were visibly faded immediately. Do not wear a new suit into the pool. Other than that, the sundeck was spectacular, and our stay was memorable.

everyoneShouldKnow: My recent stay was unacceptable.I went to bed at 4am only to be woken by house cleaning at 9am to ask if I was checking out...and then again 20 minutes latercheck out is at 12:00 I told them I looked over my statement and they over charged me..i call the front desk to complain about both issue. It took 2 more calls and a trip to the desk. But even then the issue as not correctly addressed or corrected. My statement on my CC was not lowered to the correct price but raised by the amount that should have been credit tome. I have sent 2 emails without a response
title: My recent stay was unacceptable
comment: I went to bed at 4am only to be woken by house cleaning at 9am to ask if I was checking out...and then again 20 minutes latercheck out is at 12:00 I told them I looked over my statement and they over charged me..i call the front desk to complain about both issue. It took 2 more calls and a trip to the desk. But even then the issue as not correctly addressed or corrected. My statement on my CC was not lowered to the correct price but raised by the amount that should have been credit tome. I have sent 2 emails without a response.

everyoneShouldKnow: This is a really nice hotel, with a lot of extras, and very nice staff.
title: This hotel is great, and very clean.
comment: I was very pleased with my stay at your hotel. the staff was very helpful, and accommodating. The rooms were clean, and relaxing, with a lot of great extra features. The location was great, and I would definitely stay there again.

everyoneShouldKnow: The internet service is very spotty. My mobile devices required repeated efforts of logging in, even after the first successful login.
title: Great Beds!
comment: My favorite part of staying at the Belvoir in Downton Denver was the beds! The hotel was good, but the beds were great.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Dulles Metro extension (subway) is under construction near the hotel and will be for a while.
title: Club Floor & Room Service Disasters
comment: We paid $20 more for a Club floor room in order to have access to the Club Lounge on the 24th floor. During the 4 days we had access local guests staying in the hotel due to no power at home hogged all of what was served in the morning and evening and nothing was left for out of town guests.

title: Service needs to improve
comment: Horrible experience with the check in. I am a BPG member and had booked for a one night stay. Unfortunately I had sprained my ankle prior to my trip and I had a cane and had to wear an ankle brace on my foot to help me walked.

title: amazing simply amazing
comment: The staff is the best around, helpful and friendly, the room exceeded any expectations I had. One of the best Belvoirs i have ever stayed at.

title: All the amenities
comment: This was a very nice hotel. Staff was quite pleasant and helpful during our stay. They helped arrange trips, gave us directions and suggested local attractions. A complete hotel offering all the services a guest would want or could expect. Would not hesitate to recommend.

title: Excellent reno since summer 2011.
comment: June 2011 one week stay was okay but not good. With all of the renovation and upgrades in the pool area, rooms, bathrooms, decor we had a wonderful stay this June 2012. Upon arrival we were granted oceanfront upon request. The staff was extremely accomodating all week long. We will be back soon. We have gifted a stay this Aug for a young couple close to us. Thank You for a great beach vacation.

title: One Star is Not Low Enough
comment: The entire hotel is run down, but the biggest problem is that it is dirty and unsafe. When a complaint was made nothing was done. We were staying on BPG points and were told that they would be refunded, but after 6 weeks they still are not posted. There were switchplates missing, the duvet was terribly stained, the couch has a big stain on it and the floor was very dirty. We had two different rooms and they were both dirty. Keep going and find a different place to stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: Be careful of going to this hotel. You are not treated with respect.
title: Unfortunate Stay
comment: Unfortunately, this hotel did not meet my expectations by far. The bathroom door did not close. The deadbolt on the door did not work properly. There was no t.v. for most of the afternoon and night. When I asked for another room, I was told to wait. The staff was not helpful. It was an upsetting stay.

title: Great staff
comment: Was recently there for my brothers wedding, and I can't say enough about how nice the staff was, and the room s r clean. We had alot of people with us and the valets ere promt and curtious. I will recomended to anyone I know traveling to philly.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff is friendly and facility is clean and classy.
title: Excellant Staff
comment: When we got there our room A/C wasn't working that well. The entire floor was warm so it was uncomfortable from the elevator to the room. Maintenance(Lee) came up and worked on it but said it would be a few hours before it would cool down. He got us another room on another floor. He offered to help move our luggage and bought up a luggage carrier to assist. He couldn't have been any nicer and helpful. We were also given a free breakfast the next morning. That was unexpected but appreciated. We will recommend this facility to others and the next time our travels take us north, we will stop and spend the night.

title: Charged for two extra days...
comment: Booked via phone for a one night stay. At check out I was told we were checking out early and we would be charged the full amount. We ONLY booked one night and I have e-mail confirmation showing this. Credit card was charged numerous times. Called the front desk three times and I am NEVER able to talk to a manager. Something just doesn't add up....

title: Wonderful Family Holiday
comment: What a simply marvellous family 11 day holiday.

title: Excellent but the club lounge
comment: Overall excellent hotel, location is perfect, rooms are clean and personnel is friendly.

title: Great place to stay at
comment: We stayed at the

title: Awesome stay
comment: Everything we experienced in this hotel was amazing. The location is very convenient and quiet. Valet parking is available for a decent price. Pool and fitness center are awesome. Nice club lounge. Very highly recommended.

everyoneShouldKnow: It charges $40/hour to borrow a stapler, and forces you to pay "service" tips in its cafeteria chow line which has no wait service, even for take outs. Bottom line: it is extremely greedy and it will unnecessarily rip you off every chance it gets.
title: $40/hour for a stapler? Forced "service" tips?
comment: The facility is nice enough, but people, like my 5-member family, pay an arm and a leg to go to the Disney parks once in a blue moon - extremely expensive trip which everyone knows going into it - so the last thing we want is our hotel ripping us off every chance they get - to my extreme shock (and I'm a 41 year old Marine who has seen it all), on Thursday, 5 July 2012, your business center would not let me borrow a stapler for 5 minutes - the young male clerk insisted that he had to charge me $40 an hour for use of a stapler, no matter how short the use - in my shock I could only ask if he was joking, which he assured me he was not, but telling all, he was so ashamed he couldn't look me in the eye, he had to look away when confirming this. To call this a preposterous outrage is an understatement. You know how much money regular folks like my family have to spend to come to Disney - for the parks - and our hotel won't let us borrow a stapler for 5 minutes without charging an unbelivable $40 an hour??

everyoneShouldKnow: The people are great and common areas of the hotel are in great shape.
title: Good airport hotel
comment: I travel a lot and felt that this is a good airport hotel. The location is great, the people were all very nice and the hotel was clean. All of the common areas appeared current and clean. We were happy with our overall experience at the hotel.

title: Awesome awesome awesome
comment: Everything and everyone we interacted with at this hotel was awesome. Clean hotel, nice restaurant onsite, nice staff, nice pool, great Jacuzzi, nice fitness center, and nice rooms. The location is close to everything you might need. Thank you for a great stay and looking forward to stay there again soon.

title: Good hotel for short stay
comment: The rooms were a little small. The pull out bed for my son was very uncomfortable. The bed that I slept in was uncomfortable as well. We were really looking forward to the pool, and it was so small, so no adults got in (there were 4 kids, and it made it seem too busy).

title: Nice hotel
comment: Overall, the hotel was nice and comfortable for a weekend stay. Good price. A couple of caveats: 1. My wife and I went to the restaurant for breakfast and it took way too long to get our food. There was only one chef and he was overwhemed. 2. Our room needed a safe. While I understand I could leave my valuables at the front desk, I didn't want to be bothered to go down there. 3. I was not at check in but my wife had said the staff at the front desk had an attitude.

title: Excellent location, comfortable room
comment: Thank you for the BPG recognition and upgrade to the Club Floor. Staff very accomodating, Room comfortable and clean. Basic ammenities, but for a weekend stay in NYC, or even week day business trip, its more than adequate. Club Lounge can be a zoo, especially on the weekends. It gets crowded very quickly, no place to sit. Staff generally good about keeping the buffet stocked and tables clean. But great views from the lounge and can be relaxing. Nice perk for platinum members. Can't beat the location in Midtown.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff all seemed to enjoy working there and that was really nice - they were very pleasant and that means a lot.
title: Good Stay
comment: We stayed here when we were in town for the dog show and it was a great dog hotel - very welcoming of the four-leggers and lots of grass around the hotel for walking the dogs. Our room (suite) was spacious and clean. Only issue we had was a tub that drained a bit slowly but that has been reported to management and they're addressing that. We ordered room service a couple times and the food was hot, delivered quickly, and tasted very good. We'd stay here again.

title: Great hotel for weekend getaway
comment: Hotel room was beautiful and quiet with view of planes taking off and landing. Great pool for sunning. The staff was very helpful.

title: Nice for a wedding but not the best service to gold members
comment: The room was very nice but a few things were a bit disappointing: 1) I'm a Gold Member and I wasn't offered a gold reward when I checked in (was only given the option of free internet and I didn't have a laptop with me); 2) the drain was very slow in the shower and the toilet ran all night. All understandable but when I told the staff about it at check-out, they seemed uninterested and didn't offer any apologies, which is atypical for Grandbourne facilities in my experience.

title: Great Location
comment: Whenever we go to San Diego we stay here. The relaxing views of either the marina or the bay make this a true vacation. There is not a lot of food nearby unless you like eating at the hotel. We do go to Oggies, for anyone enjoying pizza , sandwiches, or sports this is the place.

title: unsatisfactory experience
comment: booked the hotel for a romantic getaway. the hotel was overrun with unsupervised kids, the pool was overcrowded and ran out of towels, there was garbage left around. only place in the hotel we found peace and quiet was in our room. we were looking for a high-end hotel experience, what we got was a low-end motel experience. RE: pool...apparently they sell local memberships to the pool and exercise facilities. as paying guests, we were unable to enjoy the pool and my guess is that non-guests with memberships were part of the reason for the overcrowding. seems Belvoir has to decide whethere they want to market themselves as high-end guest-oriented experience or LA Fitness experienc.

title: Loved Everything About This Resort
comment: Loved the location, hospitable staff, room amenities, view, pool on the beach, location on the Gulf, variety of restaurants on-site, views from gym on the 9th floor, etc, etc.

title: Vacation
comment: We stayed one night at the Belvoir at the tail end of our vacation. The bartender was great and hotel was nice and clean.

title: A warm Santa Fe like retreat.
comment: I was delighted upon arrival.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is so friendly, amazing pools, and great location.
title: Best hotel EVER!
comment: The pool area is fantastic! the staff is very pleasant. very well air conditioned. great views and balcony in every room. staff so friendly they don't know what to do with you. its a great location- near disney theme parks ! we didnt want to leave! i recommend this hotel to everyone!

title: GREAT STAFF
comment: CHRIS AT CHECK IN WAS FIRST CLASS EMPLOYEE

everyoneShouldKnow: Spa and workout facility is of high quality. Room comfort is second to none.
title: The BEST amognst the rest
comment: The hotel, services, comfort, EVERYTHING was excellent. Can't wait to book our next stay!

everyoneShouldKnow: Shuttle service is awesome in a great area
title: WONDERFUL!!!
comment: I really enjoyed my stay and the staff is awesome. The gentleman that greet you in the am in the dinning area for breakfast is out of this world in service.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Belvoir is beteween an old mall thats an eye sour.... please buy and expand it the hotel is lovely but next to that makes it look off....
title: comfy and clean....
comment: I enjoyed my stay and my cleaning lady was warm and kind.......

everyoneShouldKnow: eat at restaurant instead of ordering room service.
title: decent, bad food
comment: I ordered the BBQ chicken, which ended up costing $25 with fees. It's listed as chicken thighs with vegetables and jasmine rice. When it showed up, it was a pile of over-microwaved stir fry with approximately 3 ounces of cut up chicken. Very very disappointed.

title: Billing issues/miscommunications
comment: When we arrived at the room, the bureau was broken so unable to use the drawers. Called immediately to ensure I was not charged for damage and they were aware the problem existed and would send someone up to correct. Engineers came two days later when we were busy. Told them to come back in an hour, which they agreed to, and they came back two days later as we were checking out.

title: Better first stay
comment: Although our stay was comfortable the first experience staying at this location was better. Some of the advertised amenities were not available as promised at the time of booking and the bathroom was not as clean and had an odor. My schedule was such a busy one so I didn't have time to complain, but for the price I just expected better. The location was perfect and the breakfast in the market was great as usual.

title: review your options
comment: We expected more from Belvoir. The freeway side is very noisy. Choose a room in the back if you want to sleep. We were moved three times because of defects in the rooms. Sink that we could not shut off and a front door that would not open. Musty smelling rooms. The last room we were put in was an Accessible room(808).The toilet leaked on to the tile and carpets were very dirty and stained. Not the standards I expect at a Grandbourne Belvoir property!

title: Can Wait To Get Back!!!
comment: Excellent Excellent Excellent, one problem the floor is too slippery in the indoor pool area it an accident waiting to happen. please add so rubbish water water absorption mats.

everyoneShouldKnow: Rude Front Staff, Horrible Food, and I can go on on.
title: Horrible Front Desk Service
comment: I drove from Santa Barbara, CA and I work for a Luxury Resort as well, I had my two daughters, I had my Father who was just discharged from a surgery, and I came to find a Hotel Manager who was extremely rude, as wel his staff. Horrible Food, fair service in the breakfast,

everyoneShouldKnow: The view from the club lounge is excellent!
title: Home Away From Home
comment: Belvoir Boston is our home away from home. We live just an hour away from Boston and, if we have the points, we always opt to stay there instead of driving home after a night activity in the city. The club lounge is excellent and worth the extra $25 charge. The lobby bar is excellent; love the fresh flowers from Winston's! We don't love the restaurant, but it doesn't matter since the location gives us so many options. Being close to Summer Shack is an added bonus!

everyoneShouldKnow: The lobby is bustling 24/7 so if you need to chat with the one and only concierge on duty, plan to wait.
title: Big disappointment
comment: What a surprise to stay at a high end, top quality hotel, only to find the following disappointments:

title: Great hotel for families
comment: My family and I were looking for a place to stay on Disney property and chose the Disney Dolphin. We could not have had a better experience. The hotel staff was friendly and inviting. The room and bed were very comfortable. We were able to watch the fireworks from Epcot outside our window as our 8 year old and 5 year old got ready for bed. I cant tell you the memories we made at the Dolphin. We cant wait for our next visit. The Disney Swan and Dolphin hotels are now our hotels of choice on Disney property.

title: Great location, too noisy, parking terrible
comment: I like this hotel. Stayed here for several times. This time we faced the airport on 10th floor. VERY noisy in the AM on Sunday. Parking was terrible and they charge you $22 to park on a dirt lot where my clean car got dirty. Pool is nice. Location is very nice. Pool was understaffed. Jacuzzi did not work.

title: Great Weedend Stay
comment: Great relaxing environment in a busy town, everyone from the bell man, to the front desk and beyond were "great" I travel at least 12 times a year and enjoy a friendly staff as well as a great environment and room facility...they had it all.

title: People are the best.
comment: Everyone is great at this hotel, especially the Front Desk, Camila, and restaurant manager, Buu. The hotel may not be the nicest when compared to others, but the staff is one of, or if not, the best I have encountered.

title: Average Hotel
comment: Stayed 3 nights, room was had garbage on the floor under the stools, under the couch and hand prints on the balcony door. Asked to have the room cleaned with attention to those areas and only the window got cleaned. The garbage stayed there until we left. The shower was broken the whole time, couldn't get the shower switch to engage the full way, so half came out the shower and half out the shower head, also no hot water, luke warm water the whole time we were there. I have been to almost all the hotels in that area and this falls below lots of others around there. The view is very nice of the Navy base and downtown SD. You also get all the noise from the helicopters until about 9pm during the weekdays. Only one on the staff that was nice was Dave the Bellman. The valet staff was very rude, took my keys and then when they found out i would be self parking the park my truck in the sun and wouldn't have anything to do with me. The cleaning staff ignored our requests and the people up front at the desk gave the appearance of caring but had no followup on the room. Prices were comparable to other hotels. Swimming pools were very crowded with lots of families and drunks, maybe it was just that time of day, but i went back several times through out my stay and always the same. Also the TV would keep going out and having no signal at night. Good place to drop your bags and go see the rest of SD. Wouldn't recommend it.

title: Room not well serviced
comment: When we checked in, we realized that the room did not have a shower curtain and housekeeping had not provided wash clothes or hand towels. After repeated calls to guest services, we finally got them to install a shower curtain but we never got the towels.

everyoneShouldKnow: Get down to the pool early if you want a lounge chair in the shade!
title: Never Went to Disney!
comment: This hotel was beautifully and thoughtfully remodeled. We enjoyed the amenties so much that we never went to Disney! The staff were wonderful, helpful and knowledgeable. The pool bar servers including Elizabeth & Melissa as well as Enrique were top notch! Oscar came by with cool washcloths to ward off the extreme heat and Jayson was hard at work (and with only one arm we even saw him lift patio umbrellas)! The only little complaint was the price of the breakfast buffet $14 seemed a bit steep as there were only the basic selections - nothing out of the ordinary. However all tasted fresh and delicious. Dinners were great and bar-b-que by the pool was just perfect. Many thanks for a wonderful stay - see you real soon!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great restaurant with outstanding staff and kitchen.
title: A good category 3 hotel
comment: This is a hotel that we often use for weekend visits and have got to know many of the staff. Check in was speedy and an upgrade was made to the Club Floor: I believe that there are some suites but have never been offered an upgrade to one. Dinner on the Saturday night was outstanding. Great service from Sophia and excellent meals. On this visit we did not use the pool or fitness center. The only negative of the visit was breakfast on Sunday in the Club Lounge. When we arrived there were dirty dishes everywhere and the trash can was overflowing. We had to remove dishes and clean a table off ourselves before we could eat. Some time later a service person came to tidy up but all she did was compress garbage in can:there was still not room to put anything more in. Usually there is someone up in the lounge all the while to take care of things: I was told later that he was on vacation. Checkout was good and I had the opportunity to mention the lounge problems to Noelle.

everyoneShouldKnow: We stayed there before and it was an exciting place to spend our anniversary. Hope they return to the same great services we experience the first time we was there
title: Lack of response to room repairs.
comment: The day we arrived there were no face towels and it took them until 1am to bring some to our room.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location great and new pool area is great.
title: Great new pool area
comment: We are staying at this hotel even as I write. The welcoming staff who greet you and offer to park your car are terrific. As well, most of the staff who work the pool area are very attentive. The housekeeping staff needs special recognition for the job they do here. Get rid of the fees for "resort fees", microwaves and most of all parking. These are an insult, especially for BPG members. There is no special recognition for being an BPG member and there should be. Get rid of the cabana rentals too...most people will not ever pay for these. What is the "resort fee" for? There was almost no activities planned and while the pool area is well done, this fee should not exist for that alone. This hotel is in a great location and most staff do a great job.

title: woderful stay? not
comment: passing through NJ. we need a stop and rest bed. checked in at 9pm with no reservations,(my fault) when we got to the room the walls in the shower were not very clean, there was mold growing in between the grout joints and fresh caulking was aplied over existing mold.the room slept 4 but there was only 3sets of towels in the bathroom. after driving all day, figured what the heck we'll watch a little TV before retiring for the evening, Oh sorry No TV for You tonight, it didnt work. all this for 205.85

title: good hotel
comment: Fair hotel with good location and customer service. The lounge is great!

title: good hotel
comment: Great location and service, and the amazing lounge!

everyoneShouldKnow: Horrible customer service by front desk staff, especially Nina.
title: HORRIBLE HOTEL - AVOID
comment: Do not be deceived with the "newly renovated" claim. The rooms are still the same and the rudeness of the staff is still extremely obvious. Especially if you are unlucky to check-in in the morning. The evening shift leaves and the rude morning staff gets in and they are awful. Yes, they renovated the lobby and it's nice but it doesn't change how awful everything else is. AVOID!! There are other better hotels in the area.

title: Great location
comment: My family and I did really enjoyed the stay at this hotel, staff were very accommodating to our last min request for room avail and also polite. We recommend anyone that wants to be treated well.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Staff was extremely friendly and helpful.
title: not bad
comment: Parking was not good for handicap. Not enough stalls. I was willing to park across the street in the Target parking lot.

title: This hotel does not uphold BPG standards
comment: furniture, bath room are not consistent with BPG standards. Older furniture, worn carpet, average bathroom. Terrible room noise isolation

title: Wonderful
comment: We recently visited your facility on our first vacation to New York. It was a wonderful experience. The bed was comfortable and the room was very clean. The club lounge had good food and friendly hostesses. I would recommend the place to all my friends.

title: Plumbing needs upgrade
comment: Hotel location was great (few blocks from merriweather). Room was nice and furniture was very comfortable. Plumbing in the room was not adequate. Tub did not drain and toilet would run after flushing. This was not what I expected from a Belvoir facility.

title: Disappointing
comment: My experience here was sub-par. The room was average, which is fine, but the restaurant was a real let down.

everyoneShouldKnow: Fantastic Tower Views of the San Diego Skyline
title: San Diego Relaxation
comment: I was highly impressed with the hotel and its amenities. The pool added a resort like feeling to the atmosphere and movie night at the pool is great for the kids. The front desk, cleaning, valet and pool attendants were all hospitable. Although the hotel lies on the outskits of downtown we were able to use the Big Bay Shuttle for $1 to get to downtown.

everyoneShouldKnow: Mexican restaurant is very good. Staff are very helpful and courteous.
title: Great Location & Service
comment: Had a beautiful view overlooking the marina & beach. Food in Mexican restaurant was delicious. We were meeting a friend of my husband from high school. Waitress at the pool restaurant was wonderful. She kept our drinks refreshed and courteously let us visit for hours. The burgers and fries in the Whale Watch hit the spot. Staff at this hotel are very good! Someone left Mont Blanc pens in the safe of room. I meant to leave with desk. Now must ship back to hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location is perfect for people interested in staying in downtown Chicago
title: Excellent hotel, excellent location
comment: Besides the location which was perfect with most downtown attractions within walking distance and great views (Hancock and Navy Pier in the North, and Willis Tower and Chicago River in the South), we found the hotel staff to be very accommodating and courteous. They checked us in much earlier than normal and extended our check-out time to early evening at our request. The concierge was very knowledgeable and helpful in charting out a plan for touring Chicago.

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel was renovated last year
title: Weekend Trip
comment: Was in Seattle for a wedding and decided to stay at the Belvoir in the heart of Downtown Seattle. Its in a great location and pretty convenient to anything we wanted to see. Ended up getting an BPG Platinum upgrade to a suite which overlooked the city. Great view. The staff was friendly and attentive, the Concierge Lounge was nice but incredibly busy. Overall, enjoyed our stay at the Belvoir especially for the price we paid.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's very close to Ranger Stadium and Six Flags over Texas!!!
title: Great Staff!!
comment: We were very pleased with the staff at this hotel - they were very attentive and helpful when our cards didn't gain us access to the Club Room and our floor. Very friendly, very helpful and service oriented!! Would highly recommend this particular Belvoir!!!

title: Pain in the back
comment: My wife and I usually stay at a different hotel chain when in town. The Belvoir was more strategically located to our business this time so we thought we'd give it a try...Over all the hotel was OK. The problem was the hotels choice of mattresses. It appeared to be a cheap knock off of some type of memory foam gone bad. It was the most uncomfortable mattress I'd ever tried to sleep on. It offered absolutely no support. I sank in the bed to the point where I swear I could feel the box spring below.Needless to say I ended up sleeping on the couch.The next morning we were offered another room. While the next bed was slightly better another night of sleep depravation was in store for me.Needless to say if you have back problems as I do this hotel would not be for you.

title: An excellent stay
comment: This was my first stay in a number of years and I must saw it met every best possible standard. I will definately stay here again.

title: Problem with hotel room keys
comment: Hotel stay would have been great if we would have not have to keep getting our hotel keys activated on a daily basis. This was not caused by nothing we were doing wrong. We had to keep going down to the front desk to have our keys activated to get into our room. The hotel was too occupied to move us to another double bed room at that time. Maintenance came to fix the door and we still had to keep getting our keys activiated after that. Something was seriously wrong with that hotel room door.

title: Great Home Away From Home
comment: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights during a dance competition. That's a long time to stay in a hotel room but this was very comfortable accommodations for an extended stay. Every employee from front desk to housekeeping seemed genuinely happy to assist in any way possible. The only things I would change about the property would be an outdoor pool and access to wireless internet in the guest rooms.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is right in the heart of the shopping district
title: Good Experience
comment: Hotel is nicely put together, great location. Clean, comfortable, appreciated the BPG amenities. The on site grill was excellent! Would stay here again.

title: Great stay
comment: We had the double suite. It was smaller then expected but adequate. The beds are very comfortable. A couple of times we had to ask housekeeping for linens as they were not replaced. The front desk staff is wonderful. They will answer all your questions, give directions and help you in many ways. Very dog friendly.

title: Very comfortable
comment: Beautiful place. Very comfortable room/bed. We were not informed of any breakfast at check in if it was included with our room.?? Our biggest issue - no free wifi in our room. For a huge chain it is hard to believe it wasnt provided in-room. We had to sit in the bar. Good marketing for sales - but bad on customer service. Overall - a very nice stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: May and the rest of the staff are amazing!
title: Elegant Hotel, Charm is in its Age
comment: This was a wonderful hotel and has the best staff of any Grandbourne Property I have stayed at. I stayed here with my family and there were a bunch of us in a suite. A woman from housekeeping, May, deserves recognition. Not only is she hilarious, offering to bring me a sandwich from cozy (obviously she was joking) since she saw me doing work at the desk, but she brought us extra bottles of water and a truck load of towels.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's dated, but if you know that then it's not a bad place to stay.
title: You Get What You Pay For
comment: Room rates are cheap here which is the reason I chose it. The hotel is dreadfully old and the rooms could use an upgrade although the beds were really comfortable.

title: Great staff/great facilities
comment: My daughter had a great stay back in May. She found the new facilities outstanding and the entire staff was very helpful and friendly. The only thing she missed out on was the extra BPG points for not having the linens changed. See didn't see the offer until she was packing up to leave. Otherwise, her stay could not have been better.

everyoneShouldKnow: The rooms and rest of the interior are awesome!
title: You get more than expected
comment: I was very pleased with the new updated Belvoir! For the price I paid; it was an exceptional value! Good location, VERY friendly and helpful staff, and a great room! I loved the room layout-keeping the bath & closet completely separate from the rest of the room. I am the only early riser in my family and for once I was able to get up and go out in the morning without waking my late sleepers up!!

title: OK, not that impressed
comment: It was an ok stay. I would recommend, but I would recommend others first.

title: Always Great
comment: We've been coming the the Belvoir Villages for the past 6 years and this is the only place we stay the staff is always so nice and friendly.The rooms are always nice and clean I love that they do movie night for the family.I will be returning in December with my granddaughter for her first experience I love the Villages!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: parking is impossible after the parks close
title: Changed since Disappointed in April
comment: Thank you for making our July visit much better than our April visit. The outstanding BPG recognition by Elizabeth, Teo and Kelly's going out of their way to assist in whatever ways needed, and Jon and Michelle's going out of their way to be friendly and attentive to us and our furbabies made us feel as though the hotel's mission statement has been changed to "make the guest feel welcomed!"

title: Great Weekend Trip!
comment: The staff was always pleasant and helpful. Keith was helpful in recommending places to eat. Our children enjoyed the pool. We really appreciated the shuttle to downtown Charleston.

title: Need better service
comment: I stayed here on transit for an international travel with 2-3 bags. I had to locate a cart by the entrance and also had to load and take it up to my room with no assistance. Same for checkout. The hotel needs to provide better service.

everyoneShouldKnow: Not an ideal place for a single person on vacation.
title: This GrandbourneS hotel is not for me
comment: The smell coming from the room as I opened the door was less than pleasant. I could see stains on the carpet. The rooms need serious remodeling/upgrades in furniture, curtains, and bathroom fixtures. When I turned on the hot water and cold water at the bathroom sink, it defaulted to only COLD. There seemed to be a leak around the sink fixtures. Rust was on the shower rod. The safe should be upgraded to digital. Who wants to carry such an awkward styled safe key around. Many times I found no signal for the TV -- it came and went. The hallway was always cluttered with room service trays, extra beds, and loud people. Evidently, there is no soundproofing applied between the hallway and guestrooms. I did leave an item in the room when checking out and never received an email even though you have it. Eating options close to the hotel are limited and many close supper early because the businesses in the area are closed for the evening/weekend.

title: nice hotel!
comment: i was in LI for a couple days, but the location of the hotel was convenient. The staff was friendly and the room was very comfortable. My only disappointment was that I had reserved a room with a double bed and when I arrived, that type of room was not available. I stayed for two nights and was offered to switch rooms for the next night, but chose to keep the same room. I would stay there again though. I'm planning another trip to LI in a few months and most likely will be staying at the same place...for convenience and price!

title: great staff!
comment: wonderful and helpful staff, I experienced true southern hospitality in a chain hotel!

title: renovated hotel...great
comment: Hotel is fully renovated and is great for meeting and convocations! The staff was nice, even though, they gave our rooms away because of the power outage! Overall it's a nice hotel!

title: Major Need to Renovate
comment: I had to pay just under $200 a night for this hotel and it isn't worth it. The elevators were beyond horrible there are 2 sets of 2 elevators and it was a miracle if 1 of the 4 elevators was working. They actually had pre-printed signs stating they were out of service. At one point people were stuck in the elevator.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location isn't the greatest and you'll need a car to go anywhere.
title: Excellent staff
comment: Had a great one night stay at this property. From check-in to check-out the entire staff was wonderful and wanted to ensure I had a great stay. Although the hotel is roughly three years old the facility is beginning to show some wear and could be better maintained. Club lounge is ok although evening offerings were underwhelming and consisted of two pastas, Italian meats & cheeses which isn't really to my taste and would preferred more variety.

title: Great location
comment: Ideal location when planning to see Red Sox at Fenway. Can walk in about 15 minutes or less. Many restaurants nearby.

title: Possible Misunderstandings
comment: Overall the stay was great. The only issue was that they bedding was dirty so it was changed right away. Service was nice...the restaurant was wonderful...pool open until 10pm was great. We wish we had more time to spend. Maybe next time..

title: Had a great stay here
comment: From the moment we entered we were treated with a friendly and helpful staff, on check in we were offered a complimentary breakfast.

title: Only place we'll ever stay in Key West!
comment: Anyone going to Key West, I highly recommend the Belvoir. Everything about our stay was excellant. We had a room with a balcony overlooking the ocean. The room consisted of a kitchenette with refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker and dining table, a living room, really nice bathroom (we loved the shower), and a super nice bedroom that could be closed off from the other rooms. The bed and bedding was super comfortable. The view and the landscaping was awesome as was the pool. And they had the most amazing room service food menu ever. It is very well worth the money!

title: nice hotel with a couple exceptions
comment: Hotel room was fine but the bathroom and staff services left a lot to be desired. Upgrade to Preferred Gues level on 12th floor. The bathroom greatly needed upgrades. No hot water, shower head in bathroom very low and hard for a 6 foot person to use, not very clean. Front desk very rude and not helpful. Tried to cash a large bill and they claimed all they could do is give me 100 one dallar bills. Really a hotel has no money???

everyoneShouldKnow: great location next to soho .. nice rooms .. some staff great .. some average .. felt like they were going thru the motions rather than the usual high quality Belvoir service
title: 25 minutes in an elevator would justify a little recognition
comment: i stayed at canal two weeks ago .. great room .. nice hotel .. great location .. but got stuck in an elevator for 20-25 minutes .,, not really a big deal but was shocked they didnt give me or the others a free cocktail, a free night or even get our info and recognize it when i checked out .. i am at Belvoir 40th this week and will try another Belvoir or even maybe the hilton here in midtown/uptown to find a new home .. i am a big sheratn fan so even more disappointing .. might need a new manager

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellen view for affordable price, no extra fee for pets.
title: BEAUTIFUL VIEW
comment: We love the peaceful view and the breeze of the bay, we also love to be able to bring our dog without paying extra fees, the staff was very nice to help us out when we need it, clean hotel. Few minutes form Old Town and Seaworld.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Club level is very refreshing.
title: It was nice!
comment: This hotel was great...my cousin came to visit, and she liked it so much that I recommended it for her for her birthday. She checked in the next day.

everyoneShouldKnow: Close to SU, but not sure it's worth the money.
title: Good Facilities, Not Impressed with Service
comment: Having attended SU, this was my first time actually staying in the hotel. I know that it's a Belvoir and in Syracuse so they are going to charge an arm and a leg, but charging $15 for parking on top of the room rate is a little ridiculous. Not to mention that when I went to leave on Sunday morning, nobody was collecting money in the garage... So word of advice, if you are staying on the weekend you are better off saying you don't have a car and use the garage anyway.

title: Convention at this hotel.
comment: This was the most seamless, friendly, enjoyable conference I ever attended. From Charley, our liason, the AV guy, the front desk, bellmen, bar staff, housekeeping, everyone was friendly, caring, and so professional. Our room was clean, everything in working order. Our requests were anticipated, or cheerfully carried out. The Belvoir has an excellent team and they should be commended...in this day and age, rarely to people go that extra mile.

everyoneShouldKnow: A little crowded with large teenage groups in the summer. Elevators were a bit slow.
title: Can't beat the location
comment: For the location alone, we would return to this hotel. Can't beat the location. It was quite crowded with teenage dance groups and outside was under construction, but otherwise it was great. I would definitely check on occupancy next visit. Elevators were overcrowded and very slow.

everyoneShouldKnow: Best staff of any Belvoir I have stayed - I have stayed at approximately 10 of them across the country.
title: Great Staff - Worth their weight in Gold!
comment: Even though the hotel was completely booked due to the holiday week and a wedding, the staff was polite and tried to accommodate our needs.

everyoneShouldKnow: It couldn't have been built in a more perfect spot
title: The best stay ever
comment: From the moment we got to the hotel, the service was outstanding. The hotel was very clean. THE VIEW WAS TO DIE FOR!

title: wonderful time
comment: everyone took special care of all our needs and expentations

everyoneShouldKnow: It is in the middle of the shopping area and close to everything. 5 min walk to the beach.
comment: I chose to spend my 23rd bday in AC at the Belvoir. I had an an amazing time with my closest friends. The staff was very nice. The maid came back multiple times to check to see if we needed our room cleaned. When my safe wasnt working, Courtney at the front desk sent me some assistance very quickly. She also was sure to wish me a happy birthday. The price range is a bit outside of my budget to stay on a normal weekend but I do look forward to returning on my next special occasion

title: Average at best...
comment: My family and I love Myrtle Beach. This resort was nice as far as the facilities are concerned but I was NOT pleased with my room or the cleanliness of it. I felt like we were exterminators!
