I kept finding bugs in the bathroom. We have a 10 mo old and he's crawling around. I was afraid he would find a bug to eat on the floor. I've stayed at a Grandbourne resort in Orlando and this resort room did not meet my standards or the standard of being a Gold member and owner. I'm willing to give it another try...maybe...I did like housekeeping everyday which is different from other resorts.

everyoneShouldKnow: Customer service is hit or miss
title: Need to work on customer service
comment: Stayed at hotel for a conference five days. When I arrived I found out that my asst had not made a reservation. However, the nice lady at the desk gave me a room and a great rate. That is when customer service went downhill. The next day was told oops the hotel was oversold and that I needed to vacate my room immediately! I was even locked out in the midst of my conference. After heavy debate and much attitude by staff I got to stay but was charged a different rate than quoted and double billed.

title: Nice modern hotel, great pool!
comment: I really enjoyed this hotel. I would've given it 5 starts however I've been trying to dispute a charge on my bill now for a week to no avail. Customer service post check out is severely lacking. For me this is just as important as service received during check in as well as that during my stay.

title: Great hotel
comment: I had a great experience!!!! Staff was very friendly!

everyoneShouldKnow: Everything has an upgrade charge. Forget about using Grandbourne benefits. Parking is terrinble.
title: Upcharges for every request. No Grandbourne benefits
comment: Overall, the hotel is very average. Our request to be on the Grandbourne floor was denied unless we wanted to pay an additional fee. The parking was terrible. $22.00 for a dirt lot. We requested a 1:00 pm check out, that was available for an additional $20.00. We were issued a free drink card with a 15.00 value, but the martini I wanted to oder was an upcharge. There was a great deal of noise between the windows being replaced and the airport construction. We did love the shuttle to downtown. Food for the quality was very overpriced.

title: Excellent location
comment: The only "con" was the discomfort of the mattress which was very firm. Also, we had to add an additional night to our conference stay, but the hotel would not allow us to stay at the conference rate. The rate went up dramatically.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff is rude and unaccomodating, especially if you book through a 3rd party website.
title: Disappointing Hotel for Location and rude staff
comment: I expected more from this Hotel as was very disappointed. Bath tub dirty when we checked in from a slow drain. The fixtures were old and not properly cleaned. We checked in July 2 for the fireworks. They placed me in a room with palm trees blocking my view of the bay. I asked to change rooms and they didn't accomodate me because I booked my room through an airlines website and not through Belvoir. Front desk staff and Manager was rude and non accomodating

title: July visit to Denver
comment: Great stay!!! Thanks Brad and Josh!!!! You guys made check-in, upgrade and room change seamless!! Bravo guys! To the doorman, never made it to Snooze, next time I will, gotta try the pineapple upside down pancake and thanks for the umbrella. To the lady on the phone thank you big time for directing me back to the hotel, you were so patient and I was so lost! When I'm in Denver I'll make sure to stay at the Belvoir.

everyoneShouldKnow: They provide everything for you in the room/s except the food.
title: I love Grandbourne
comment: In the world of corporations, it is usually an emphasis on profit and very little gain to the consumer. I have been a member of Grandbourne since 2000 and rarely have I been disappointed in any of their properties. The staff is always courteous and treat you with respect even if you are using points. This property was no exception. The surroundings were beautiful and well maintained, the room was large (1 bedroom premium) and fit my family in comfortably. I loved the Pirate Ship pool - well designed for little ones, the slide is designed so that they don't go into above head into the water.

title: Great location but needs improvements
comment: The location is great for rangers game, we walked to the game. When we arrived our room was not ready. We were on the 3rd floor, our view wasn't even to the outside, we had a view to the lobby, very disappointing. It would have been nice if they would have told us that. The carpet and furniture was very stained!! The bathroom was small. In the ceiling above the bathtub there was a hole where water was leaking. The sink was slow to drain. I think they have plumbing problems. The toilet seat was falling off. We really did expect more from a Belvoir.

title: Just a number
comment: Checked in with no platinum recognition. Club access not provided, or even existence of club disclosed to my wife.

title: Beautiful hotel
comment: We love this hotel! The view from our room was beautiful:) There was a young man at the front desk "Drew" that was outstanding. Very warm and friendly and went above and beyond to make our stay perfect!!!

title: Great location for activities in Manhattan
comment: The hotel's location on the Hudson River and the ferry dock at the hotel made the Belvoir Lincoln Harbor an excellent "home base" for a visit to Manhattan. The ferry service combined with the shuttle buses made it simple to get anywhere in Manhattan. We either walked, took a taxi, or used public transit from the shuttle bus stops. It was just as convenient as staying in Manhattan, but at a better price!

title: Great location
comment: I attended a conference at the hotel and found it an excellent location for enjoying the best of downtown Chicago.

everyoneShouldKnow: Average, comfortable hotel with food issues
title: Average hotel; poor breakfast
comment: I have stayed at this hotel many times. I find the room adequate and comfortable for the business traveler. The only issue that I have is that the breakfast service has gone down hill. The last time I stayed there, in July 2012, the breakfast buffett was very disappointing. The scrambled eggs were all gone, the oatmeal was thin and watery, and the egg station had no one manning it. I finally got the waitress' attention and more scrambled eggs were brought out. Also, the 2% milk was also all gone and she refilled it after bringing it to her attention. Obviously, the attendants are not doing their job.

title: Excellent Hotel
comment: This was our first trip to the Belvoir in Iowa City. The Hotel was centrally located and the staff was very helpful

title: Good until the end
comment: Overall my stay went well. However upon checking out, they had 1 person at the front desk with 5-6 people waiting in line. After waiting 10 min I asked the concierge to help, but they said they couldn't. Oddly, they didn't seem to want to help the front desk. So I just left since I was in a hurry. Then when I saw the bill, they charged me for internet when specifically I chose this as my welcome gift and told I wouldn't be charged. So I had to call the front desk the next day. When I called they thought that I was still there at the hotel? Strange. I had to tell the woman 3 times I had already left . Strange ending to my stay.

title: The bed was comfortable
comment: I had 3 reservations and was told I would get new keys under the door at the end of each reservation, only happened one time. I requested early check in, did not happen. Room keys did not work on a daily basis, the hallway and our room smelled of bad soy sauce the 10 days we were there. The phone had a blinking light our entire stay. We had to go out of our several times and go to the desk to request new keys. I have to pay for 2 bottles of water every day?!? Your hotel is concerned about recylcling, what do you do with all of those empty bottles? No maid service every day is fine, but we ran out of toilet paper, coffe, trash was overflowing . I had to go to the desk and ask for my $5 coupon 2 times because it was not delivered. A huge lack of communication between staff and management. I feel sorry for the maid service, they all seemed very pleasant and courteous but there is a language barrier.

title: fantastic
comment: This was our first time visiting New Orleans and I am so thankful our adventure began with this hotel. They were 100 percent helpful with everything from places to eat, to places to see. I barely noticed the renovations going on. The location was perfect and in walking distance to everything! Stay at this hotel for a pleasing addition to yout stay in NOLA!

everyoneShouldKnow: The Manhattan view can't be beat!
title: Splurging really paid off!
comment: My husband & I recently splurged on this hotel for a "bucket list" vacation to see The Big Apple. We were not disappointed.

title: No Internet
comment: I checked in and was given my room key on the 10th floor. I went to the room and didn't enter the room all the way because I could immediately see that the room was either occupied or had not been cleaned. I could see the bed covers in a ball half on the bed and half off. So, I didn't enter all the way in case someone was in there. It's crazy that they gave me a key to get in, but I went to the front desk to tell them. They apologized and gave me a different room. The new room was fine, but Wifi was up for a very short time and then there was no access. I told the front desk and they said that they couldn't figure out what the problem was. I waited a few hours and tried again, but no luck. I tried to use the computers in the lobby to get onto Skype, but it's not accessible there. I called the front desk and they said that there are some rooms that have Internet access and some rooms that don't, but they're working on it. I told them that my fiance is in Afghanistan and we would like to be able to communicate.They said that I could use a computer in the lobby and use Skype. I told them that I had already tried that and am not able to access Skype from there. I mentioned my fiance and the front desk person said that he would immediately look into it and would call me right back. He never called and I was unable to get Internet access. I wasn't offered another room or additional bonus points as compensation. Nothing. I picked this hotel because of Wifi access and then received none with no compensation.

everyoneShouldKnow: When full the lobby is alwayls packed.
title: Great location
comment: We stayed in a renovated room which was a little small, but this is NYC! The room was clean and comfortable. The only drawback was the cleaning service never washed the glasses so that is why 3 stars for that. Otherwise a nice place to stay in the theater district.

everyoneShouldKnow: Perfect location for travelling around LAX and the coast
title: Great stay for random travelling
comment: My experience with this Belvoir hotel was exceptional. It had everything I needed to randomly explore all things LA; from downtown to the coast. The staff was friendly and kind with my needs; esp. the front desk who was most helpful in helping me have the best stay possible. I stayed for two nights. Both nights were undisturbed, as I had requested. The bus line was well within walking distance making exploring easy and inexpensive. The pool area was a bit small as advertised in their photographs; however, it was not crowded during my stay, so it didn't matter. I ordered room service on my first night, and the server was very friendly. The only downside of my stay was the washroom. It was clean; however, the toiletries were scattered about and not neatly kept. To me, it looked messy based on my other stays at other Belvoirs.

title: I found hotel reception staff helpful and friendly, but
comment: I found the breakfast charge for coffee to be outrageous and excessive. My entre was $12.99, and $4 was added for coffee. That's 30% of the bill! Yes I know it is advertised as "Starbucks", but still it is just black coffee.

title: Excellent hotel
comment: This hotel is wonderful and will be my hotel of choice when in Miami. I love the "Pure" rooms and the view of the golf course and the view of Miami. Beds are extremely comfortable and the amenities are great as well. Only gripe is that the valet is very slow even when you text them ahead of time, you still have to wait for your car to be pulled up front.

title: WE will stay again at the Belvoir on 7th Avenue
comment: Our family loved the location of this hotel. It was close to Central Park, Times Square, and great shopping on 5th Avenue. Our room was clean and the cleaning staff were wonderful for our entire 7 night stay. The brunch at the Cafe Market was excellent. That was one hightlight, our compliments to the Chefs for the beautiful and delicious Brunch! It was also great to have the morning Star Bucks cafe in the lobby for a quick bagel, coffee & tea in the morning when we were in a hurry.

title: Great Service
comment: We found the entire staff very friendly and helpful from the front desk to the housekeeping services. The complimentary breakfast in the morning was really good. We ordered room service one evening and that was quick and good and the delivery person was very nice. The room was very clean and spacious. The shuttle service was very convenient and we used it several times a day. Thanks for a wonderful stay.

title: Friendly Staff,comfortable room
comment: Greeted warmly by staff. Room was very clean and comfortable. I had a beautiful view of the beach.Housekeeping staff was very friendly.Loved the location. Close to everything.I will definitely come back here.

title: BDL Airport
comment: Very comfortable hotel and convenient location inside Bradley International Airport. The restaurant has a nice variety of items available too.

title: Great place to stay!
comment: My wife and I stayed at this hotel 7/8/12 - 7/13/12. Check in and check out were quick for us. The location of the hotel was perfect for us. The rooms were very clean, pillows and bed were comfortable and housekeeping was quick with cleaning our room every morning. Anytime we had a question or concern the staff was prompt to help us out. We appreciated the complimentary bottle of champagne and the additional complimentary free drinks at the bar. We took advantage of the tours/activity desk and those guys (Guy & I forgot the other person's name) were very helpful. Kudos to this hotel and the staff.

title: Great Location
comment: Can't beat the location, best thing going for this hotel. This was my second stay, 1st time was 5yrs ago. Our room was smaller than I recalled, beds were comfortable, room was clean but bath smelled musty-most likely due to the shower curtain. During our 4 days stay the lobby was always crowded and the computer stations were packed. There was a dance competition going on at the hotel and there were kids everywhere, luckily we were out sightseeing most of the day. Note: this hotel has no pool.

everyoneShouldKnow: Lots of highway construction hinder access, but it's worth it to get here.
title: Great hotel, unique location
comment: While not impossible to find, this hotel is about all there is north of the river and Downtown Louisville, and construction work on the interstate can hinder travel so allow a little extra time. The quality of the facilities, great staff, free parking, and views make up for any location shortcomings. In fact, it's probably the nicest hotel in Louisville considering price and quality.

title: Awesome hotel! Will stay here again.
comment: I used my points to stay for one night with my family. The staff upgraded us to a larger suite and we were amazed at how fabulous the room was! The hotel staff is very nice and helpful. The Belvoir Waterside is also in an excellent location; walking distance to Nauticus and the USS Wisconsin. Great place to run as well!

title: Very Good Hotel
comment: Everything was very good. Location was close to may restaurants and never waited more than a minute for a cab. Staff were friendly and rooms were modern and comfortable.

title: A/C does not work well
comment: I was very disappointed that the room was very warm when I arrived at 10:30 PM. I was in the room until 6:30 AM and it never cooled down.. At one point I tried opening the sliding door but there were people at the pool and it was too noisy. I ended up sleeping with just a sheet.

title: Staff was great
comment: Wonderful hotel. Staff was wonderful will stay again.

title: Not Cool!
comment: Bathroom got clogged; had to go to a 24 hr store to get a plunger to unclog it! That was not fun. While checking out, we mentioned our ordeal...they didn't seem to care much.

title: Great stay. Great Loft.
comment: Hotel located at a great location. Extremely welcoming lobby and clean, spacious rooms. One of the best Belvoir hotels.

title: Small and smelly
comment: Our room had a strong odor (perhaps stale smoke) and seemed rather outdated.

everyoneShouldKnow: The customer service and follow up service after the stay were a pleasant surprise.
title: Great customer service to match great hotel
comment: My stay there was very enjoyable and I would wholeheartedly recommend the Belvoir to anyone else who is considering an elegant hotel to stay in during the future. What impressed me the most was the customer service, including the follow up service AFTER I had previously stayed there. That will not be forgotten.

title: The Staff is Accommodating and Friendly
comment: Everyone was pleasant and helpful with any and all needs. The room was adequate, but had stains on rug that I guess weren't able to be cleaned. The beds were very comfortable.

title: Nice Room, Great Location, Front Desk not
comment: Overall the hotel was nice, clean and comfortable rooms. It also has a great location. I was very disappointed that our room was not ready until over two hours after the 4 pm check in time. After a long day of travel this was unacceptable. There was no apology and the check in staff was contrite and unsympathetic. Also, upon check out we called the front desk with a question on our bill and was told we could not be helped until management came in later. Another thing is there were a lot of teenage travel groups in the lobby our entire stay which made it crowded and uncomfortable. We were happy with the room accommodations, but not with the service from the front desk.

everyoneShouldKnow: Comfortable and classy at the same time
title: Like a second home to me and my family
comment: I've stayed here often (since 1998) for the Chet Atkins convention, plus on family trips to Nashville. Comfortable rooms, excellent/helpful staff and professional management team -- at a reasonable price. One of my favorite Belvoir properlies.

title: Underwhelming
comment: Room decor is modern, but the hotel is old. Second-floor views of roof-top air conditioning equipment, rooms that have AC units that cycle on/off all night long (6 out of 6 rooms in my group all complained of the same thing), no recognition of BPG members. In this day and age, you still need to pay for WiFi, and in such a way that you need to re-login every time you turn your device on?

everyoneShouldKnow: Would not advise to be on ground floor. Very loud.
title: Not a great stay
comment: Stayed for one night (midweek) and stayed in Lanai Tower. Was woken up twice around 1am and again around 4-5am by loud guests. Could hear guests right outside my room. Overall, stay was not great. Stayed on ground floor. Would not advise to be on ground floor.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's across the street from Smathers beach.
title: Key West beach access
comment: First visit to Key West so surprised to find that Smathers Beach is the ONLY beach anyone really goes to and happens to be directly across the street from this Belvoir Suites hotel. Paid for the upgrade for the ocean view and having the balcony was awesome. The suite was plenty big for 2 people and could easily accommodate a couple of kids. Lots of storage and very comfortable. Hotel runs a shuttle every half hour to and from the infamous downtown area so no need to drive! I work out religiously so the fitness center was important and while they had great equipment, they kept the temperature way to warm, often no towels available and there were no restrictions on children coming in. This was a problem as everytime I went to work out, a couple of mother's brought their young children in who basically ran amuck! A little issue with the hotel staff not changing our reservation to extend our stay one day but corrected once pointed out. Also, checked in early only to find out that previous guests had not yet checked out! Staff was friendly and generally accommodating.

title: Unhappy
comment: This hotel is well located, but service was mixed in guest attentiveness. While room was clean with good FF&E and generally comfortable, bathroom counter had peeling finish. Also TV was smaller than generally found elsewhere. Concierge lounge was heavily used and poorly staffed given the level of patronage. Offering was ordinary. Restaurant food ordinary and overpriced.

title: Never again
comment: The housekeeping staff did not come up to standards of motels. We were very disappointed in the room, bath and overall housekeeping. I would not recommend this hotel unless it is of last resort.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great place to return to in the future.
title: Great Location!
comment: Very friendly staff, and great service. Location is perfect - views, and walk to the beach.

everyoneShouldKnow: High floor rooms with odd numbers have best view in Philadelphia
title: Great Business Stop
comment: Wonderful location, amenities, friendly helpful staff. Excellent value

everyoneShouldKnow: Lock your doors. Housekeeping will probably attempt to wake you up by entering with the master key.
title: Average Belvoir
comment: Hot lobby, outside the front door stinks, and the gym is in the basement without proper AC air exchange. The good news is that there is a Starbucks on property, the rooms are typical Belvoir, and the Club Room is a great benefit for BPG elites (only I couldn't get on the floor during my stay since they were full).

title: TOWEL SHORTAGE?
comment: We recently stayed here with ten other familieis for a softball tournament in Columbus. In addition to the outrageous cost of food and drinks there seemed to be a shortage of towels...although there were three of us in my suite and five in the suite down the hall and five on another floor none of us ever got more than one towel. The drain in my bathroom also didn't work so that you had to stand in dirty water while you showered...disgusting.

title: This hotel has horrible staff service
comment: We went during the Essence Music Festival July 2012. The hotel itself was fine (weird that it did not have a refrigerator or microwave), but otherwise it was fine. Staff service was horrible. We had reservations since January & still had to wait 2+ hours to get a room. We called for towels/washcloths one night & had to call back the next morning to even get them. It was just on & on issues.

title: Disappointed
comment: We stayed at this hotel because we stayed with a group going to a wedding and they reserved a set of rooms for guests. You get a room and that is it. $15 a day to park at a hotel you are staying at. That is not right. They folded the towels that we had used in the morning and put them back in the bathroom. They were not even all the way dry. They popcorn that was on the hallway floor when we got there on Friday afternoon was still there on Sunday afternoon when we left. Most hotels offer a light breakfast, not here. Coffee in the room but if you try to get it in the lobby there is a cost. I do have to say that the beds and pillows were fabulous. Very comfortable.

title: Disney area location!
comment: We stayed at this hotel for 10 days the room was spacious and clean. My daughter loved the pool area and the water slide. The location was great! less than 5 minutes from Disney and walking distance from great restaurants! My only concern was that I had to park my car in a near fast food restaurant parking lot almost every night! since the hotel one was full. Other than that we had a great time and we really enjoyed our stay!

everyoneShouldKnow: They fail to meet their commitment to excellence.
title: Very rude staff
comment: As a business owner, I travel 40+ weeks per year and stay in just as many hotels. I found the staff at this specific location to simply be rude. My flight happened to get in early today, so I came to the hotel at 1:30 in the afternoon. I was told that rooms are not made available until 3:00 pm and was forced to sit in the lobby for over an hour. I certainly understand that some rooms may not be ready, but all of them? Really? By 1:30 none of the rooms had been cleaned? Then I find that the hotel charges for Internet access when my reservation clearly states free Internet. When I brought this to the attention of the front desk clerk, I was told it was my booking agents error and I was lucky they were honoring the rate provided. Although the hotel is clean and comfortable, a business is only as good as their employees. In this case, that really doesn't say much. I truly think the staff need to pick up a dictionary and read the definition of customer service. Rude lip service that fails to correct a problem is not customer service.

title: Great Location / Thin Walls
comment: We had a room in the Queen's tower, overlooking the pool. Providing towels and chairs for use at the beach is a nice service. The machines in the Fitness Center were good, but without air conditioning the room was too stuffy . The view from the room was great. The sliding glass doors did a great job of blocking noise from the street (Kalakaua). However, the walls are too thin. On one side we could very clearly hear a woman on her phone describing daily the details of her trip to someone back home. On the other side we could hear a couple engaging in coitus nearly everyday...must have been on their honeymoon!

title: Some Pros, Some Cons
comment: This is a very large hotel with 3 buildings. Here are the pros:

everyoneShouldKnow: They validate for parking in the ramp, so do not worry when you pull in.
title: Making It Right
comment: Belvoir really tried to make it right on my stay. Brian did a great job checking me in and running the club lounge when no one else did, even though it was not his area. In the morning, the lounge was quite, but good customer service with made to order omelette. At checkout I told the front desk about a car in the neighboring paring ramp that had been there for months, and th GM personally walked out with me to take a look, even though it was not Belvoir's parking ramp. Great customer service!

everyoneShouldKnow: It is clean, comfortable, and staff is oustanding.
title: Hotel is excellent
comment: The hotel is conveniently located, well appointed, clean and comfortable, and staff is outstanding.

title: Will definitely stay again
comment: Hotel staff is amazing! Food was good in restaurants....best Beef Barley I ever had was at the college deli.

everyoneShouldKnow: this is mostly a business motel
title: conference
comment: Hotel was very busy this past weekend however the staff was very pleasant and helpful

title: Good Choice
comment: This hotel is a good pick for those that do not want to stay near the Duvall area. It is clean and staffed with employees that are there to serve. My only suggestion would be to expand the shuttle service to downtown. Even in the summer season, the shuttle would be full during the peak times.

everyoneShouldKnow: Not a True Belvoir. More like a Cheap Motel.
title: Poor Quality Stay, More like Motel sub standards
comment: I am a Hilton Honors member who decided to give the Grandbourne program a shot. I have never been as disappointed in a hotel as I am with the Belvoir Burlington Hotel.

title: Bang! Bang! Bang!
comment: Despite claims that the renovations are unobtrusive, there was a constant banging noise that lasted from approx. 7am -8pm every day. It sort of sounded like an extremely amplified DRIP, like a unique kind of water torture. A concerned call was met with "deal with it, it'll be over by 7pm." Someone signed me up for their ridiculous "opt out" of daily room cleaning. In exchange for an unmade bed, no new towels or glassware, you get a measly $5 gift cert at Starbucks. It took three calls to "guest services" to get that sorted out.

everyoneShouldKnow: Management of this hotel is a cut above others.
title: Great customer service from the Manager down
comment: There are no surprises with this hotel - everything is as per Belvoir standards. The one thing that did stand out was manager involvement with the guest experience. In the large majority of the hotels the manager is never seen - always hiding in a back office. At the Belvoir Portsmouth the manager is often visible, be it talking to guests and asking them about their stay, helping guests check in / out when the staff is overloaded, or even sweeping the carpet on a guest floor late at night when staff has gone home and something is amiss (though whatever was on the carpet was too small for me to have noticed).

everyoneShouldKnow: The view and location is outstanding!
title: A Wonderful 4th!
comment: This was our first time staying at the Belvoir San Diego Hotel & Marina, but I think we have started a new tradition. What a fantastic hotel, from the facility to the staff. You could not ask for much more from a hotel! Top notch.

title: Excellent but beware parking fee
comment: Except for the internet and parking fees, a great place to stay in Seattle. At one end of the monorail and nearby to stores and restaurants, this hotel struck me as highly professional.

title: Needs renovation
comment: Location is great but there was a bad smell in my room, like humidity. I notified the staff and all they did was to spray an air deodorant, which lasted no longer than one hour. I could hear everything that was happening around the ice machine. Maybe enclose it!

everyoneShouldKnow: Large rooms, large pool, large fitness center.
title: Great Stay
comment: Family of 4 with 2 young kids staying for just one night. We loved the very large pool (great for lap swimming). The workout facility was a little old, but still met my needs for the most part -- it was also huge for a hotel workout facility.

title: Great Place
comment: Stayed at this hotel one night for the Comic Con Convention. Facilities were exceptionally clean and service and hospitality was excellent! Very helpful staff and our room was very clean and comfortable. Would definitely stay here again

title: Great Hotel/Great Staff/Great Experience
comment: The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and the bed very comfortable. I would return to this hotel any time I return to Oahu.

title: Nice facility
comment: Great place to stay. The location is perfect.

everyoneShouldKnow: CLEAN and staff was very nice.
title: Lacking a few things
comment: Nice, Clean however you had to pay for internet access and no refridgerator nor mircowave. I have stayed in other Belvoir's and they had these to add touches.

title: 30th anivisary
comment: had a great time had a high floor & room was very clean. We went to Omaha Steakhouse & a hotel manager found out it was our anivisary and he bought our dinner & drinks .

title: Nice Hotel
comment: I have had very positive experiences staying at this hotel. I have also found that whenever I have had an issue it is cared for immediately and then the hotel manager follows up with an email. Great service!

title: Great Hotel in a great location
comment: The hotel has great facilities including the pool with it's slide - kids had a great time. It's also right on the beach so you can swim in the pool or the ocean. The room we had had a great view across to Diamond head. It is truly paradise my family and I had a fantastic time at the Belvoir Waikiki.

everyoneShouldKnow: Clean, friendly, modern, conveniently location to Soho, Tribeca, Chinatown and public transportation. Good rates.
title: Clean, friendly, great location
comment: If you are looking for a modern, comfortable and clean place to stay in the Soho/Tribeca area this Belvoir fits the bill. While Canal Street is a very busy commercial street, the location positions you close to the Lafayette Street restaurant action and lower Soho. The rates are also good especially if you are a AAA member. In the morning we walked Le Pain Quotdien for breakfast which serves simple, elegant boulangerie fare. You are very close to Chinatown and to transportation. The staff was very friendly and the bathroom shower is great.

everyoneShouldKnow: Customer service were excellent and staffs were very helpful.
title: Cozy and welcoming environment
Nice rooms and facilities
comment: Our room was very nice and comfortable. The pool was refreshing and clean. Great workout gym. The best was the signature margaritas with the inside out lime half filled with tequila. Very well done. Food was very good.

title: Very convenient to airport and very good service
comment: I would recommend this hotel for anybody with a late arrival or early departure from ABQ airport. The staff is very helpful and the rooms very comfortable, especially for BPG members.

everyoneShouldKnow: East-facing rooms on lower floors will not make you feel like you are at a resort. And there are a lot of east facing rooms. Beware...
title: really??
comment: I was given about the worst view a hotel room anywhere can have. My room (#313)faced a wall and an airconditioning farm above the conference center. I am surprised they even rent this room to anyone - it is that bad. Pretty horrible considering my group held a conference at this beachfront hotel for a leisurely feeling and instead i got an industrial view. I dont care to ever stay at this place again

everyoneShouldKnow: It's on the beach side of the street with the best staff assisting everyones needs. The skywalk from the parking garage to the main building was fanstastic. No crossing the street dodging cars speeding by.
title: The perfect vacation spot!!!
comment: This was my third visit to Belvoir Ft Lauderdale Beach Hotel. First two were for business and the third trip I brought the family to enjoy the experience of a great hotel and awesome beach! When we checked in, Justin at the front desk was so helpful... he made sure our room had the best view so that my family could have the "wow" factor! The family was so impressed with the scenery and the hotel features they did not want to leave!! The room staff were all so friendly and very courteous. My two sons loved the pools when we were not enjoying the ocean. The hotel was so close to all of our needs including the fishing charter we took and all of the fine restaurants along the beach boardwalk!! Yes... we will be back and thank you, Justin for all of your assistance!

everyoneShouldKnow: The location & view of Waikiki & Diamond Head is spectacular!
title: Beautiful
comment: Housekeeping staff are very flexible and efficient to our needs. Front desk is very pleasant, check in & check out was a breeze! Enjoyed the great view from our room. The food is delicious at the Edge. The Infinity pool & deck is very nice and comforting! This was our second stay & we will come back! Maholo!

title: Great staff
comment: My wife and I recently stayed at this hotel for a weekend getaway (we live in CT). We're pleasantly surprised by the hospitality and helpfulness of the staff - in particular the front desk people who gave us excellent recommendations on local dining and entertainment options. The room is spacious and clean. Housekeeping staff are nice and polite. We're impressed and are considering coming back in near future.

title: Exceptional experience
comment: The downtown Belvoir provided our young family with an exceptional vacation experience. From the moment we checked in we received superior service--our questions were answered, our requests were completed...at every turn the hotel staff anticipated our needs.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is currently be renovated and there is construction noise 9am-7pm.
title: Renovation issues
comment: This was my first stay at a Belvoir and my opinion dropped through the floor. The wifi, which I needed, only worked about 25% of the time, the elevator shafts were alongside my room and it sounded like I was under a subway terminal - day and night. The shower backed up immediately when turned on. The hotel restaurant prices were out of this world. The Starbucks always had a massive line, with one register open and one closed.

title: generally good experience
comment: I was pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to a club room. The down side - the room didn't have a bed, just a pull out couch (more comfortable than most pull out couches but less comfortable than a bed - also - there were no pillows or extra blankets in the room, had to ask for those). The plus: nice view, access to the club lounge (*Very* nice). Wish I'd had more time to use the gym, which looked fabulous. Food (I was there for a conference so ate a lot of meals at the hotel) was decent. All staff were polite, professional, and helpful. Fantastic location near the water and Pike's Market and other destinations. Overall, enjoyed my experience -but next time might prefer to stick with the original (bed only) room!

everyoneShouldKnow: Safe hotel and in an excellent location
title: Excellent Remodelling
comment: We stayed last year at this hotel as well and the remodelling has really made the hotel lighter and classier. The excellent service is still in place from the Concierge to the front desk to the room cleaners. The beds are comfortable and the rooms laid out well. Wifi in the lobby at no charge is great but it would be nice if it was always included in room.

title: Great place to stay
comment: This hotel had a great atmosphere and great service. Also at a very reasonable price. The staff were great.

everyoneShouldKnow: great location, nice staff, comfortable rooms
title: better than the usual
comment: they lost my reservation because the reservation center typed it as another name. the shower head was not working properly. we saw a cockroach in one of the rooms. i had to call for extra towels every day. when i reserved i asked for joining double bed rooms and they told me that was possible. when i arrived the staff told me there was no such thing that they only had doubles joining single king rooms. that was one of the reasons why i got that hotel. the rooms were real clean beds are real comfortable. staff is real nice. pretty nice hotel. the location makes it worth it.

title: Perfect Place
comment: I came to Norfolk on business, and this was the perfect location to stay. The area has a lot of character, and it is in a great location. The staff was great, the room was comfortable and clean, and it was everything I could ask for on my overnight stay.

title: Front desk service inadequate
comment: We chose this hotel because of the proximity to Stanford and because it had a club floor and we were going to be very busy and wanted access to quick and easy drinks and snacks because we would not have time for meals. When we checked in I asked about the club lounge and the desk clerk told me where it was. When we went to the lounge, there was a sign to call the front desk. The front desk said that the lounge was closed on the weekends. There was nothing on the confirmation and nothing on the website when I made the reservation to indicate this was the case. The front desk said they were sorry. That was it! I asked for a rate reduction and they said no. The club rate did not include parking and wifi, which are charged as a package. This experience was very unsatisfactory. The hotel had been remodeled and the room was spacious and clean. The room had a view of the garbage dumpters and HVAC units both of which were very loud inlcuding garbage collection at 5 am on Saturday am. The public areas were dirty (a dirty spill in the elevator that was there the entire weekend and every glass door had numerous dirty fingerprints). We were not able to use the pool but it was very crowded with not a single open chair. The proximity to Stanford was a plus.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is understaffed and under construction. Do not expect a Grandbourne experience, because you're not going to have it.
title: Dropping the Ball
comment: Please be advised on checking in that when they mention there is construction ongoing in the hotel, they are not joking around. I had a mason working on chipping tile with a hammer directly above my room until 7 pm my first night staying at the Belvoir. This was purportedly a "VIP Room," which they were offering me because when I initially arrived, no rooms were available at the hotel despite my reservation. If this is VIP treatment, much less BPG treatment, let me suggest that the acronym can only suggest "Very irritated patron." A terrible Belvoir experience for the second time in three weeks.

everyoneShouldKnow: Best location to see San Diego Bay fireworks on July 4th.
title: Family fun
comment: Our family comes back to this hotel every year and we always have a great time. There have been activities to keep our kids busy and happy from ages 8 - 14 (there's lots for younger kids too). Especially nice for us with the 11+ year olds since it's safe and easy for them to wander around the hotel, pool, and beautiful marina on their own.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent place for BBQ type dinner is Jack Stack on 95th Metcalf - ask Staff. Popular and crowded - eat at bar for fast service.
title: Nice stay
comment: Stayed three nights no problems. Paid for the club level room to have access to the complimentary breakfast, afternoon hors doeuvres and cooler with beverage options. Breakfast is continental type also with eggs, bacon, etc. - meet all my needs worth the price. Like the location, the rooms and the overall hotel. Would stay again.

title: Awesome stay
comment: Close enough to everything but far enough away. Great place in San Diego. Lobby bar is nice with gret service. Rooms are nice but need updating

title: Nice quite place downtown
comment: Stay here a lot for work. Very quite and great downtown spot. One of the best hotels I stay in when traveling. Staff is very good

title: Yet again, our home away from home in the area
comment: We came to Columbia, as we do ever so often along the year and this time the hotel was real busy with a "cheerleading" event. I thought that we would have problems with the noisy youngsters, but we were setup in the lodge and there was no noise at all. Room was well equipped with fridge and microwave and the ONLY criticism would be that Erina at the front desk did not tell us which entrance to use to get to our rooms. We had to walk the whole length of the Lodge, up and down and across several entry points to get to our rooms. It would have been perfect if she had told us to drive to entrance "X", park and then go up a flight of stairs.

title: Great Hotel!!!!
comment: Stayed at this hotel with my family as we were doing a mini-getaway to Sesame Place. What a perfect hotel. The pool was large and clean. Kids had a great time. The room was a perfect size for my family of 5 with one king bed and a pull-out sofa. The beds were some of the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever stayed in. In the morning we enjoyed the breakfast buffet downstairs. Again completely perfect for my kids and they actually had egg whites with spinach which I enjoyed and have never seen at a breakfast buffet before. All the staff was very friendly and I will definitely be staying at this hotel again.

everyoneShouldKnow: valet parking only and it is on a one-way street.
title: Great River View!
comment: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The room was very comfortable with a private balcony and great view of the river. The staff was very attentive and saw that all of my requests/needs were met. I would stay here again if I were staying in downtown Tampa. Good deal in price for my needs.

title: Mostly wonderful
comment: The hotel is now a favorite of mine: however, there are some things that can be improved. The tv had to be fixed twice, the wifi works great in the lobby but not on the 16th floor. The mandatory resort package for which there is a charge of $14.95 per day supposed ly includes wifi and 2 bottles of water per day. As stated, the wifi does not seem to stretch well to the 16th floor and we were not in receipt of the 2 bottles of water per day.

title: Great Hotel
comment: We had a great stay at this hotel! We were located on the Club Level and had the breakfast and appetizers included. Laura took good care of us! The room was clean and supplies were always restocked-never had to ask. The pool and whirlpool were nice too. We have to come back to this area in Sept and are planning to go back to this hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Service is very very slow, and I had a reservation.
title: Belvoir Gateway Hotel to ???
comment: The room was comfortable, and I had a great chance to sit and watch the planes. Rooms very quiet, but service was never great the first time around. Check-in and Check-out requires the patience of Job. I was the 17th person standing in line and waited and waited. Then, I asked for parking, but the request was not put into the computer. I had to go from parking lot to parking lot trying for about 45 minutes trying to figure out what I was doing wrong. Went back to the hotel...stood in line again....I learned that the first person never put it into the computer. Took between 90 minutes and 2 hours to get into the room. Upon getting my bill, I was charged for the Internet, which I was to get with my gold card status. Therefore, I had to stand in line again. The comfort of the room and hotel was very good, but not happy at all with the service. Did not get to take any advantage of the other amenities, such as the pool. It was already closed.

title: Puzzler
comment: This hotel was fantastic from check in to check out. The breakfast buffet was delicious and very well stocked with many choices. Would recommend very highly!!!

title: One of the best!!!!
comment: I travel a great deal and this is one of my favorite hotels. I stay here once or twice a month and they have one of the nicest and friendliest staffs Ive ever experienced. They always go out of their way to make my stay comfortable and enjoyable. Itd be very hard to find anything to complain about. Rooms are very nice, clean and comfortable. Great location to more than a dozen restaurants just a couple of blocks away at Universal Studio

everyoneShouldKnow: make perfect use of all of the services - this hotel strives for excellence in all areas.
title: The best site for our mother/daughter vacation!
comment: This hotel was in the best location during our first visit to LA. It was convenient to everything. We were greeted every morning, afternoon, and evening with the most respectful and courteous staff I've ever encountered. Best of all was the patience of our daily event planner and concierge - Fernando. He was THE MAN. He helped me plan everyday successfully and when I was not happy he did not stop until I was satisfied! We did everything we wanted to do WITHIN our budget.

title: Good
comment: The room was nice and clean, but three times our door was left, not fully shut by the maids. The first time I thougt it was us but then after the 1st I made sure to pull it closed. When we would return all it took was a push on the door to let us in. I know things are expensive in Disney but 16$ for sunscreen. Everything is like that, markup is one thing, what they do is ANOTHER.

title: Great for family vacation
comment: We have been vacationing here for years and truly enjoy this hotel. I really liked the guest laundry facility, fitness center, and the new suites and Sweet Sleeper beds. I miss the old outdoor pool since it was more shallow and zero entry (perfect for little kids). All of the staff (bellhops, front desk, restaurant waiters, and housekeepers) were friendly and helpful. Only one downside was the new chef - seemed to us that the food quality has declined (such as, instant grits for breakfast - yuck, not-fully cooked salmon, and very greasy flounder).

title: Great location and easy parking
comment: The hotel is nice and well maintained. Our room was comfortable and breakfast and hors d'oeuvres in the Club Lounge are very nice. The only drawback was that while he tried very hard, the concierge on duty during the day was not sufficiently familiar with the Pasadena area to be helpful in planning shopping activities in the area.

everyoneShouldKnow: Do not expect polite warm service.
title: Great hotel ... dreadful staff
comment: We arrived at this hotel to be greeted by a receptionist who would not smile and treated us as though we were a huge inconvenience. Very off-putting.

everyoneShouldKnow: Is one of the best if your are going to Disney.
title: Great Hotel
comment: Have stayed here many times and love it.

title: This hotel will accommodate your reservations
comment: Stayed here 3x like the facility close to downtown. Had problems with reservation special but they finally honored the rate I was quoted. Hotel price is really cheap if you use the points from your BPG account. Join it if you haven't already.

everyoneShouldKnow: Need to increase security and as much as possible install CCTV along hallway for everyone security.
title: Unforgettable Nite at Belvoir Hotel
comment: It was early morning on our last night from this hotel at around 3am. A continuous & loud banging on our door awaken us, frigthened and shocked - don't even know what to do. Called hotel operator for help but did come until a follow up after 5mins then they acted upon. Ten minutes passed, security called in that all clear. Following morning, i checked the hallway but disappointed to find that there was no CCTV. Checked from front desk for updates during check out but no report from night manager. Disgusted but we have to leave..Hope this will not happen to other customers/patrons.

title: an outdoor pool is a plus
comment: kudos to matthew at the front desk for providing a quick and efficient check in. great platinum recognition and he took the time to explain the features of the hotel since this was my first visit to the property. nice to find an outdoor pool on the property - never did really care for the indoor ones.

title: Working out the kinks
comment: I usually stay at the Westin which is attached to the Detroit airport, but they were sold out. Being loyal to the chain I stayed at the Belvoir. I understand that the property recently became a Belvoir. I stayed on the Club floor with Club access on the top floor. The food choices in the Club was scarce and greasy. This needs to be addressed ASAP. Also, the fire alarms apparently went off in the hotel, but they were not heard on my floor. If there had been a real serious situation, I would have still been in my room on one of the top 2 floors. Not good. However, the rooms are very comfortable & the staff was very attentive & helpful.

title: Unexpected
comment: Had a very rough start. With the pool hours changing and no notice. Then the rudeness at the front desk from a so called manager. I felt horrible. Then I discovered that my door would not lock at all. When I told them they act liked oh well. So, I called and complained to Grandbourne Hotels Preferred Guest number. They contacted the hotel, then this very nice Manager came and smoothed it all. He made me feel like I did matter, and everything was okay from that point on. I was able to finally enjoy my stay after speaking with him. He was GREAT!

title: Multiple Visits - Consistently Great
comment: I have made frequent visits to this hotel while on business at the University. Always consistently great - front desk is friendly and helpful, rooms are well maintained. Great location, great service.

title: Hotel a Little Overbooked
comment: We were very pleased with the staff at the beginning of our stay. We had reserved a room, and with the influx of people staying at the hotel for the weekend, they did give our reservation away. They gladly gave us an upgraded room at no extra charger. However, the hotel was so overbooked that there was no sleeping by me or my fiance. We had children running up and down the hallway all morning while we tried to sleep in on our vacation. We never said anything, and the staff never asked us as we left how our stay was, so we gave up. The room and accommodations were nice, but no way to relax at the hotel.

title: Beautiful hotel & very friendly/helpful staff
comment: From the time I walked in the front door I was met with smiles, courtesy and warmth. Every staff member from the front desk to the server in the BPG lounge seemed to love being of service and were genuine in their normal speech patterns. Never like what I refer to as the sing-song speech patterns which come from many in the service industry. Nicely done, Belvoir Maitland! Looking forward to bringing my family back there in just a few days. Thanks for a great hotel stay!

everyoneShouldKnow: How reasonable is is, and how it is located around so many attractions:)
title: Best Hotel for your Money!
comment: I run a deal/ savings blog in Long Island which covers hot deals, sale and matchups for Long Islanders and the tri state area. This is my second time staying at the Belvoir and I will continue to come back! The rooms are spacious, VERY clean. The staff is friendly and courteous. The best part is how reasonable their prices are. In addition to being so close to everything! I think for someone coming to NYC for the first time, you couldn't ask for a better location. Few blocks from Central Park , Rockefeller Center , & Times Square. Right in the middle of everything! Thank you Belvoir for such a wonderful stay!

everyoneShouldKnow: Home away from Home only better!
title: Very Family Oriented Warm & Inviting Hotel
comment: Fantastic Hotel & Staff Members. The hotel was beautiful and the rooms were super nice. I wanted to take the bed home with me, it was so comfortable. The Hotel Staff was super nice all the time. The Concierge was so helpful and thought of things that we did not. It was a very pleasant experience. I did not want to leave to come home!

title: Wonderful staff member
comment: Gwen at the front desk was what made my stay. I was not happy with my stay accept for the level of outstanding service Gwen gave me. I had a problem with my parking ticket and she tried to make calls to help me with this and when we got no where she walked me to the parking lot in the heat and stayed with me for about 15 minutes until it was resolved. She is amazing and I am very thankful to her.

title: Ask for North Tower
comment: I joked that the South Tower was the slum tower. Many of my friends had rooms in the north tower which has been recently rennovated. The South Tower had not and looked and felt worn. There were potato chip crumbs in the corner of my bathroom when I arrived and one morning three of the four elevators were broken. I did love the idea of not having your room cleaned in exchange for a $5 voucher, but twice they tried to clean my room anyway.

title: Great Hotel... Wonderful staff
comment: Thank you! The hotel and staff at the Bucks County Belvoir made our stay as wonderful as possible. Bill is an incredible employee at the hotel and should be recognized for his going above and beyond trying to maximize customers stays.

title: July 2012 stay
comment: We were lodged on the 9th floor. The room was spacious and more than met our needs. My complaint about the room is the A/C. It was a hot weekend and the A/C would blast cold and then the room would get hot. So much so that both of us were awakened during the night as we were sweating. It was set to 72 one night and then 68 the second night to rectify - to no avail. The A/C was very inefficient and noisy - so much so it actually interfered with sleeping.

title: Nice Hotel!
comment: Its always a good experience staying at a Belvoir Hotel!

everyoneShouldKnow: Horrible service, first day my room wasn't even cleaned and then I requested towels and I never received them.
title: Not so friendly
comment: The person at the counter had an attitude. I checked in but they told me I couldn't go to my room because it was 2:20 not 3:00. Therefor I had to wait on another 20 minute line at 3:00 to get my keys. Which meant I spent a total of 35 minutes waiting on lines. Then I had to pay for them to hold my luggage for me and again when I checked out. I only stayed there because that was where my daughters dance event was held. I will never return.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is wonderful and the location is close to EVERYTHING!
title: Great Anniversary!
comment: Came to Chicago for a play and stayed the night. GREAT hotel - especially the room - awesome view!

title: this hotel has great room and staff
comment: all was great

everyoneShouldKnow: Management was flippant and not guest service oriented.
title: Highly disappointed in this Belvoir
comment: Airport shuttle to the hotel was prompt and courteous. Check in was extremely long because hotel was not prepared for two conferences and a family reunion. Shared public restrooms were not attended to, even after request. The hotel neighborhood shuttle refused to do drop-offs designated in the information packet. They actually left us stranded at a location they transported us to. Management was flippant and rude.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel has been upgraded in a MAJOR WAY!
title: This Hotel is the BEST!
comment: We've been staying at the Society Holl for a number of years and always found it solid, comfortable and ver well located for our needs.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very clean rooms. Also, they have a very convenient store that offers subs, hotdogs, and so forth at a very inexpensive price. This is great if you are on a budget.
title: Great Hotel for the price
comment: This is my second stay at this hotel and it was great. The staff is very courteous and helpful. They helped me booked ticket for Universal Studious. I left a bag behind, after I checked out and they very graciously offered to mail it to my home! Also, I found a better rate for this hotel on a different website and after the fact I had made reservations, it was honored. Once again, great hotel to stay at!

everyoneShouldKnow: New York is literally a few minutes ride on the Ferry that pick up right out the hotel's front door.
title: Wonderful view
comment: I had a King Executive Skyline view that gave a wonderful view of NY across the water. The hotel and room were extremely clean and well-kept. My only question is, where's the fridge? Even cheaper hotels have that option. I would definitely stay here again though.

title: Great stay
comment: First time that we have stayed here and loved it. The staff was very helpful and the location can't be beat. Wi-fi in the room was the only thing that we missed.

title: Becoming a Friend
comment: I have had the opportunity to stay at the Belvoir Orlando North several times within the past year and they have been wonderful! Staff is recognizing me and Club Lounge staff have been excellent.

title: Great sleep in Seattle!
comment: Spent 5 nights at this Belvoir for a conference. Very clean room and facility and very comfortable bed. Highly recommend the oatmeal and fruit in the hotel's restaurant! Professional and friendly staff. Downside:non stop fan/blower in the bathroom. Also, room service express lacked a simple healthy option (like oatmeal!) Would not hesitate to stay again.

title: Some upgrades needed
comment: This hotel met every expectation of mine except the room amenities need to be upgraded. The rooms have no refrigerator or microwave. I was at the hotel for a convention and stayed for several nights. It would have been nice to have these items in the room.

everyoneShouldKnow: location is great for travelling to Manhattan
title: overall a very good property
comment: Do not stay in room no 2502 Friday through Sunday very noisy from the club on the roof top.

title: Great Hotel - Room readiness disappointing
comment: When I arrived on July 13, after unpacking I sat to relax for a few moments to watch TV but found it not working. After crawling around to seeing if I could find connection problems (unsuccessfully), I decided to call the desk or housekeeping to report the problem. The phone was also not working! By them I had to depart for an appointment and reported the problems to the front desk. By the time I returned late that evening, the problems had been solved. The next morning, I went down to the hotel exercise facility (it is great!) and after the workout I found that my room key would not permit access to the 15th floor (my room was 1566). I went to the desk and was told that the magnetic striip was the likely problem and a new key was made. HOWEVER, since I did not take ID with me to the gym, I had to wait for security reasons to be escorted to my room. The desk clerk called for assistance and I/we waited a full ten minutes or more before someone finally responded. Once we got to the room, he just opened the door and let me in without any check of credentials so I don't see the point of a security escort. The upshot was that I was late for my first appointment that morning. This was unusual because I've always been very satisified with my Grandbourne experiences, but this was definitely a disappointment.

everyoneShouldKnow: Try Vaccaro's (Ice Cream), Tio Pepe (Dinner) and Brewer's Art (Drinks)
title: Reminds You Why to Choose Grandbourne
comment: Hands down the best guest experience for the money in any Grandbourne property that I have stayed in the continental United States. The guest relations manager was standing in-line with guest at check-in and made everyone feel welcome. Drinks and cookies were provided. Room upgrade then given. Butler delivered bags without issue. Pool was large and clean. Workout room was modern and the size of my neighborhood gym. Staff consistently exceeded expectations. As a BPG member, provided free drink and internet without having to explain my benefits (as I have had to remind staff before). All of this for $99 a night! Plus, the neighborhood restaurants (Tio Pepe and Helmand) were amazing.

everyoneShouldKnow: An excellent place to stay over and over again. The staff will be friendly, professional and knowledgable each time.
title: Excellent
comment: Nice location for a quick stop or several day stay . Very clean facilities. Rooms very comfortable and spacious. Deluxe suites excellent. Great value for the money you pay. The staff is always very professional and friendly.

title: A Great Stay
comment: This was an excellent weekend stay at one of our favourite hotels. Check-in was speedy and an upgrade was made to the Club Floor. Dinner on Saturday night was outstanding. Thank you Andrew and Trish for your excellent service. Breakfast in the Club Lounge was more than adequate and the person looking after the lounge did an excellent job including clearing up after guests who were not used to clearing up after themselves. Check out was also speedy. The one minor glitch was there was no coffee for the coffee maker.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't go out of your way to pack a swimsuit.
title: Suggestions for Belvoir Management
comment: Please fix the elevators (at least 2 of the 5 elevators malfunctioned during our stay). Please make sure all the bed sheets are stain free. Unclog the bathtub drain. Vacuum the hallways, especially the elevator landings. Maintain the pool and remove the accumulated debris from the bottom of the pool. Lastly, please update the website to reflect that the Club level breakfast on weekends is no longer at the Chairman's Grill and is no longer a full American breakfast. One more thing, the bagels could be a tad fresher/softer. Thanks!

title: Needs improvement
comment: Level of service is not at par with other Belvoir brand hotels. I travel all over US and this is by far the lowest in service and value. In my last two stays in one month the fixtures in the bathroom does not work. They have to seriously make efforts to improve their service and facility.

title: excellent customer service
comment: the staff as well as manager on duty adressed a concern i had immediately all staff we encountered where amazing honestly a well trained staff

title: excelente servicio del staff en el restaurante
comment: tuvimos el placer de cenar con mi familkia en el restaurante del hotel y el staff fue muy amable, no tenemos queja alguna, nos trataron como verdaderos reyes, se preocuparon por casda detalle y para que todos estuviesemos comodos y contentos. mil gracias por tener tan buen personal para darnos esa atencion de calidad.

title: Conference
comment: The hotel side of the conference was good. Everyone was willing to help, However, I would never recommend anyone to have a conference here. The food was not watched by hotel staff. We had to wait in a line for 20 mins while they replaced items that were cold when they switched them out. I was very dissappointed in the way the staff handled them selves.

everyoneShouldKnow: tienen un servicio excelente, el huesped puede sentirse como en casa siempre.
title: excelente staff
comment: yo estoy hospedada en el hotel en este momento y tuve el placer de cenar el dia de hoy y de desayunar el dia de ayer. el personal es increible, nos sentiamos como reyes y reinas del lugar, nos stendieron de una forma espectacular, se preocuparon de que no nos hiciera falta absolutamente nada. Jose Luis y Alfredo son excelentes en atencion al cliente, sonpersonas que hicieron que nuestra experiencia en el reataurante fuera sumamente placentera. la comida estuvo exquisita. mil gracias por hacernos sentir como en casa y por brindarnos tantas atenciones.

title: excellent hotel in convenient location
comment: The hotel is huge, but still feels homy. The club lounge has excellent views. Location is very convenient - indoor walking to subway and public library.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location on the lakefront in Columbia Town Center, lots of great stuff nearby.
title: Inconvenient...Management needs to get organized...
comment: Stayed in hotel for nearly a month for business. Here were my low points:

title: Great Hotel
comment: We stayed here one night on a quick Hershey Park trip from NY and our room was clean and spacious, the staff were extremely helpful, the facilities were excellent, great pool, great club lounge with tons of food. We would definitely stay here again when we come back to the area.

title: Perfect place for the one night i was in town...
comment: I stayed here for one night (a sunday into a monday) because as a medical student, I was required to travel to Philly for a national board exam. I requested early check-in, but ended up arriving late which was no problem. My room was ready upon arrival and extremely clean. The beds were comfortable and i was tempted to steal one of the pillows to bring home with me (but I refrained.) While I didn't have time to enjoy most of the amenities of the hotel, the front desk staff was extremely helpful in terms of pointing me in the right direction for some grub. Overall A+

title: Very nice stay!
comment: We really enjoyed our long weekend at the Dolphin. The room was clean and comfortable. The staff was excellent and the elevators fast. The only down side is the extra fees that are attached that we did not need such as internet and water. Also we are used to parking at Disney resorts where parking is free. The location is a great feature of this hotel.

title: Sub par
comment: The room was nicely remodeled except the bathtub--original with mold in the grout line and repairs

everyoneShouldKnow: It is in a great location.
title: Great Location
comment: We had a family reunion on July 13-15. The facility is awesome. We specifically enjoyed the view. I would truly recommend this location. You will not be disappointed.

title: Wild Horse Pass
comment: Celebrated my daughter's birthday at Co'sin and spent the afternoon at the pool. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will absolutely return. The staff was the best.

title: Needs Renovation
comment: St. Louis hotel is disgrace to Belvoir, stains on the carpeting and the furniture, wallpaper peeling, hallways needed vacuuming, no HDTVs; great potential but needs updating

title: Excellent Staff
comment: The hotel is a older hotel in downtown but the staff there made up for any short falls the hotel may of had. I travel frequently for work and I have to give hotel 5 stars for it's staff. They went way above and beyond to make our say exceptional. Top notch customer service!

title: Clean Hotel and Great Location
comment: I have stayed here several weeks this year and the rooms are always clean. Beds and pillows are comfortable. Housekeeping does a great job keeping the hallways and rooms clean. Pool and hot tub are nice.

title: AWESOME STAY
comment: We stayed at the hotel for a week with 2 14 year old boys and they kept business with the arcade, pools and walking along the boardwalk. The resort is beautiful, clean and everyone was very nice. The food was kind of pricey but we got a discout with Grandbourne so it wasn't that bad. I would stay here again in a heart beat.

title: small bathroom
comment: bathroom was extremely small. parking $20 per night seemed a bit high.

title: Great Hotel, Club level was exceptional.
comment: The hotel was very well staffed, the staff was really helpful. The Club level catered to all our needs, even with the amount of people which were there for the event this weekend.

title: Highly recommended family hotel
comment: We really enjoyed our stay and would definitley return, and recommend to our friends. This is a friendly place with nice staff and relaxed atmosphere..

everyoneShouldKnow: The king room is fine for a single business traveler, but it will be a tight fit for more than one person.
title: I would stay here again, but definitely in a larger room.
comment: We had a king room in the tower building. It was quite small for two adults and a baby We requested to be moved to a larger room and the front desk staff (Hanna?) was very pleasant and accomodating. The larger room was an additional $15/night, but worth it in the end to have the additional space.

title: Good location, bad policy...
comment: Good location, friendly staff. From a return-client point of view, you should re-think your "Resort Charge". It's a shame for people to have a great vacation at your hotel and then to check out with a bad taste in their mouth because they have to pay the resort fee at the END of the trip instead of it being included in the "Paid in Full" amount from before they reach your hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's quiet, spacious, easy access to Burlington
title: Mixed Review
comment: Property works well for groups - plenty of meeting space and food and beverage quality was good overall.

title: wonderful hotel
comment: The hotel was clean and convenient to atlantasmart

everyoneShouldKnow: It's beautiful and very convenient to all the Disney Parks.
title: Such a GREAT stay!
comment: This was our first stay at the Dolphin Resort and Spa. We loved everything! Everyone was very accomodating, professional and very friendly. The resort was beautiful and exceeded my expectations. Our room was perfect. Thanks for making this a great vacation for us. We will come back again.

title: great stay
comment: Check in was fast yet efficient. Catherine was very helpful and friendly. The bed was comfortable and the view was amazing! I will differently come back I loved the last check out.

title: Poor Public Relations
comment: We booked 2 rooms, four days before arrival. We received a great rate. Due to reading the reviews we knew about the parking fee. When we arrived they notified us of a 14.00 mandatory service fee for wifi and 2 bottles of water, for ea, room (didn't need either) I protested and was told it was explained to me at time of making the reserve. (It most definitely was NOT) Then I was told that it was stated on my email confirmation. I had to call 3 times for the email confirm and it was in the non-cancel period.In essence I was notified when it was too late All in all, we felt we were nickel-dimed. With all these extra add ons, we would have stayed in a different hotel. Room was very comfortable, but service desk, almost rude.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you're able to upgrade to beach building, its definitely worth it.
title: Location is great
comment: When we first arrived, I was a little scared because there was a group of kids that had taken over the computers. They checked out the next day so it was great. I agree with the other reviewer who said that there are better hotels, but the beach building was priceless.

title: Rude staff
comment: Had 2 rooms for 1 night. Besides all the ridiculous add on fees, the maid walked right in on me, while I was in a bath towel, ready to get dressed. Then about 45 min later she opened my older daughters room door. If you are going to stay here, keep the latch on the door! And be prepared to pay BIG! In the past we've only stayed in WDW owned hotels, after this, we will continue to use WDW hotels, they are much friendlier

title: Lobby is great
comment: The rooms needs updating, but other than that it was okay.

everyoneShouldKnow: Has alot of potential but seems more like a neighborhood community center than a place for business professionals and travelers to relax and enjoy.
title: This hotel has potential but needs improvement
comment: Regarding Belvoir Parsippany, NJ

title: Great!!!!!!!!!!!!!
comment: I love this hotel, just need to have more amenities like complimentary breakfast, for the price you pay for everything else.

title: Perfect Location
comment: My favorite hotel in Maui. I have stayed at many high end hotels in Maui but I always come back to the Belvoir. Best location.

everyoneShouldKnow: Food at the Front Yard was very good
title: Better than expected
comment: I was somewhat hesitant to book this location based on the reviews, but took the chance because the location was close to where I had meetings.

everyoneShouldKnow: In front of the Convention Center. New upcoming Area.
title: New Hotel with an old room feel
comment: Hotel design and overall feel is Very Nice and Modern. Asian Restaurant was good a fairly priced, staff was nice and free parking. However, one of the rooms was not ready at check-in time. When we got to our room it was a mess (RM # 746). The bed runners were dirty. Walls were scuffed and there was OPH (other peoples hairs) on the floor and shower. Drawers had paper trash. When we went to sleep, the bed comforter smelled like body odor (pungent) and we had to put it away. I believe that the Hotel was fully booked and they might have slacked on the Job a bit. Maybe understaffed. We never got to use the pool since it was either completely full or under maintenance.

title: A great experience
comment: The Club Level amenities were really appreciated. It was wonderful returning from a long conference day and being able to enjoy delicious appetizers while relaxing, looking at the great view. My room was very comfortable and I was able to adjust the temperature just right. The bed and pillows were more like home than other hotels. Jeff at Penfield's was very helpful when I had to ship a package home. I would definitely try Belvoir hotels at other locations.

title: overall thoughts of stay:
comment: 1. When I looked at your original website - it was deceiving, looking as if hotel was on the water. Convenient tho as right off the highway.

title: Best Place to Stay!
comment: We just completed our second stay at the Dolphin, and we can't wait to return the next time we visit Disney. The grounds are beautiful, the pools amazing, the restaurants better than most of Disney's, and the staff is super-friendly and helpful. You can quickly walk or boat to Epcot or Hollywood Studios. Busses continually transport guests among the rest of the parks as well as Downtown Disney. Our children loved the hotel, too, especially watching Epcot's fireworks as they got ready for bed. Yes, the rooms might be a bit small, but honestly, how much time does one really spend in a room while visiting Disney? We will continue to choose this hotel over Disney-owned property.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't make ANY special requests on your room location
title: Unpleasant Stay
comment: Booked my reservation Feb 2012 for a July 2012 stay using Grandbourne points as I am a BPG Gold member. We were attending a Kenny Chesney/Tim McGraw concert at the Angels Stadium with another couple so I booked (2) rooms. We arrived at the Hotel at 3pm and were told the room was not ready to come back at 4pm. We left to eat an early dinner, and returned to the hotel at 5pm only to be told our rooms were still not ready, (the concert start time was 4:30pm.) I was told because my reservation had a "special request" that was why our rooms weren't ready. My "special request" was to try to put our 2-rooms on the same floor and close together if possible, how dare I want to be near our guests! Also, I was told they didn't expect to be so busy due to the concert. (?) I thought that's why we need to make reservations. The gave us 2-rooms on separate floors and we took room 140. 7:30am I kept hearing a door slam and was sure our room was near the ice machine or a guest kept opening and slamming their door. Nope, every room door slams shut if you don't hold it and gently close it. So if you want to sleep in don't stay at this hotel or near room 140. Oh and the tub didn't drain, had to stand in bath water while showering. I NEVER do reviews, but I felt the need to share my experience because I read reviews to help me determine if I want to stay at a hotel. The grounds are beautiful :)

title: Great experience
comment: Friendly, accommodating staff!

title: Hotel needs an update
comment: I've stayed here on and off through the years (depending on the rate). However, the property is getting tired, and in need of an overhaul.

title: far below expectations
comment: no recognition beeing as BPG Platinum member.

title: just ok
comment: good location and convenience of the club lounge

everyoneShouldKnow: It offers great water shuttle service - boat goes to Hollywood Studios and also to Epcot. From Epcot I took the monorail to Magic Kingdom. The only time I used the bus shuttles was to go to Downtown Disney or Animal Kingdom.
title: Stylish and Convenient!
comment: An outstanding value! This hotel is beautiful inside and out - quite the competion considering the "official" Disney properties next to it. You can't beat it's prime location and the ability to use the water shuttles.The staff was very friendly and courteous, and the restaurant food was great - a little pricey but to be expected. The room was very comfortable and soothing especially after a long day in the parks. Awesome pool area!

title: Excellent Poolside Service
comment: Poolside cocktail service was provided by our server Angie. She was considerate, fast, and friendly. She was always trying to exceed our needs while we were spending the day at the pool.

title: Nice Hotel
comment: Nice Hotel and Staff when traveling thru LAX.

title: Internet did not work
