comment: Internet access was a failure. Belvoir Link did not work in the evening of 18 July. I had brief access via WIFI in the room that evening but it did not work in the morning of 19 July. I was told that Link did work on 19 July, albeit a bit late for my use.

everyoneShouldKnow: The beds are as comfortable as your bed at home...and with more pillows to luxuriate in!
title: Blissful Comfort
comment: This is the second time we have stayed at the Belvoir at Cuyahoga Falls, and both times we arrived very tired after a long day's journey in the car. To be met with friendly yet efficient smiles, to be directed to a room that looks as lovely as the suites at the Belvoir, and to fall into a comfy bed and 4 assorted pillows (you're sure to find one that suits your pleasure)....well, it was just dreamy! Blissful sleep came very quickly to all three of us and we thank you for it! The only downside was that we couldn't stay a second night because the hotel was full. Too bad! Word must be getting out about this place!

title: SEC
comment: Quick check in. Easy access to Michigan Avenue and Navy Pier. Good recommendations from concierge.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent location. Food price at the Cabanas has increased though not necessarily better quality.
title: 5 stars if not for Aqua Vi
comment: This was our 4th consecutive visits in as many years. The staff are courteous as always. The updated room gives a more "clean" feel. The pool is narrow; we much prefer the former meandering pool, though the covered pavilion provides shades for those not wishing to be in the sun - something lacking previously. The main disappointment and dark spot of this stay was our experience with breakfast at Aqua Vi. We (party of 3 adults and 2 children) were made to wait about 40-45 minutes before we were seated. I noticed quite a few people arriving after us were seated before us. I enquired with the hostess and was told they are part of a wedding party of 25 who had reservation and that we will have a table soon. Fine. Meanwhile, the waiting room was cleared and only a few guest waiting. There comes a family of 4, unrelated to the wedding party, and they were seated within 5 minutes wait. Another family of 4 were seated right away upon arrival. I enquired again and complained. The hostess mentioned that she did not know that my party included 2 children. This is not good an explanation. COMMON SENSE should have prevailed that we have been waiting for 3/4 hour already and hence that everything should be done to accommodate our group, either to add another chair to a table or to join 2 tables together. But it never occurred to the hostess that there should be some parity and fairness, its 45 minutes versus 0 wait just because of 1 person. I wondered whether she would have kept us waiting had another family of 4 appeared, and until a table of "5" is freed. In the end, we were given a booth which is not even for 5 as one had to move out of the seat for the person inside to come out. I would not have cared for this had we been seated in the appropriate waiting time. I hope our situation is not repeated and that the hostess will look outside of the box.

title: Front Desk and Valet
comment: Stayed at this hotel for a wedding recently, and was very disappointed with the service by the staff. Didn't have a room ready when we showed up at 6PM and front desk staff was not very friendly or apologetic for this inconvenience. Disappointed with this service and would expect alot more from a hotel in this area with high rates.

everyoneShouldKnow: great location for shopping and visiting clients downtown, worst thing too far from the convention center.
title: not real happy
comment: the plus is the hotel is in a great location.

title: Horrible Hotel
comment: The ONLY thing great about this hotel is the location. We were in town from Florida for a funeral. Read mixed reviews online about this hotel but trusted that a Belvoir would be nice and meet our expectations. Upon check-in we were asked if we would need a parking pass for the parking garage but were not told that it would cost us $25 a day to park at the hotel that we were guests at (ridiculous). We discovered this on the day we checked out and received our bill.The entire hotel desperately needs updating. Our room was on the pool level with a pool view. Every time a guest moved a chair at the pool it was extremely loud in our room. The room was warm and even though we adjusted the air it did not cool down. We asked for a 7:45 wake up call on the morning of the funeral but instead received a 5:45 wake up call. We then had to call back again to request another wake up call so that we wouldn't oversleep. The following morning we wanted to sleep in because we were exhausted so we did not request a wake up call but received one at 7:45 and could not go back to sleep. The pool was absolutely disgusting. The color was off, you could not see the bottom of the pool and there was hair all in the pool. There was nothing "nice" about the pool area either, only the view. You could hear a lot of hall noise in our room. The bathroom layout was small and the toilet is literally underneath the counter. Awful hotel and WAY over priced. Many nicer hotels to choose from in the area. Made a very difficult time even worse for us. Very disappointed.

title: fridge
comment: we really enjoyed the hotel, the staff was helpful and kind. Loved the location.

title: Excellent
comment: Everything was perfect...except one minor thing....a previous guest had left a plastic baggie with some kind of food in it in the minibar. It had green things growing on it. It was easy to ignore, but so gross!

title: Great Memories
comment: Had an awesome stay from 7/17-7/19. The most memorable stay I've had in any city. This Hotel will always be at the top of my list. Thank you for the service. MTLjr.

title: Glad to see improvements from last stay
comment: Overall the hotel was very nice. Nice to see a friendly face I remembered from my previous stay (Mr. D DIxon). I commented on the lack of recycling in 2011 and I was delighted to see that in place in rooms and the common areas. I want to suggest some type of cart that guests could check out (at their own risk) to roll their luggage and personal items in from parking lots. There was no staff available to assist with large hotel carts and I made three trips to my car to unload all my items.

everyoneShouldKnow: small rooms, but good location within good walking distance to lots of places
title: Was average
comment: The rooms were small, for the price we paid I feel the rooms could have been bigger also it stated that the beds were queen size however they were full, also the bathrooms didn't have a fan in them and they were small as well. Every day we didn't receive a full service of bath towels or bath mat and had to search for housekeeping in order to get more towels they were very nice in getting more if we couldn't find them we were told to just take from their carts but it was just inconvenient. Overall was an average stay have had way better hotels for less price and much bigger rooms and better accommodations.

title: Washington DC vacation
comment: This hotel was nice. The sleeper sofa wasn't great so i wouldn't really count on that as a great option. The mini fridge upon arrival wasn't working in the room and after calling the front desk we had a replacement within 15 minutes. I also asked for an extra towel to be left each day and this was done without ever mentioning it again.

title: Great Hotel
comment: First stayed in 1991 for our 15th wedding anniversary. My wife and I learned to scuba dive at the Black Rock. Since then we have been coming back every year or two, sometimes with our kids and sometimes without. We were last here in October for our 35th wedding anniversary. We have 4 rooms booked for next week for the whole family including the grandkids. Simply put, there is no better hotel and location for a family vacation.

title: Love the place
comment: wondrful stay and place. San Diego is great and Hotel is walking distance from Zoo

everyoneShouldKnow: Great, except for extra parking charges.
title: Excellent but watch out for the extra costs!
comment: Stayed at the Belvoir from July 6-9. The location is perfect!. It's right in the heart of downtown. Close to some serious shopping and walking distance to the Pike Place Market and an abundance of restaurants. I adore the scent in the main lobby.The rooms are very clean but the electrical outlets were old and worn. I tried to plug in my blowdryer and straightener and couldn't, they just kept falling out. I was charged extra for Wi-fi access that barely worked. I called the front desk and was told they would waive the wi-fi charge. Parking is NOT included in the room rate. Be prepared to pay extra for parking and WA state parking tax. Also i was still charged for the Wi-fi that was supposed to be waived.. an error on the hotels part that they kindly corrected. Overall good - it's a great place to stay. Overall bad - I wasn't made aware of the extra parking fees. The hotel chain should advertise the extra fees upfront when booking online.

everyoneShouldKnow: Food is very good; location good, room comfortable
title: Great Place to stay
comment: The hotel is located in a favorable area of Columbus; i.e., close to other restaurants and highway. The staff are helpful and professional, especially the bartender - an asset to Grandbourne. I will stay here again when traveling to the midwest.

title: Troubles continue
comment: After a long day on the road with a tour group we returned to the Belvoir at 4:30. Our rooms were not ready. When we finally got to our room after an hour or so our luggage was not there. We were told to wait. After 5 hours and 2 more calls we finally went to the front desk and lo and behold someone checked on it and found it in another room. Something that could have been done 5 hours earlier if anyone had bothered.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent, safe location, right off the highway
title: Exceeded expectations
comment: I was very pleased with our stay at this Belvoir! The location was excellent for traveling around the Washington or Baltimore area without being the in middle of the city. It was set back in a nice, quiet area right off the highway.

title: Great Value
comment: This hotel is conveniently located; has a great staff and is a great value for the money

title: Front Desk Staff Saved the Day
comment: Everything was just fine with our one-night "romance package" stay except for one thing. There was a wedding that night and our room must have been right over or near the ballroom. The noise was so loud from the music and guests, that our room was literally vibrating. This went on from 9:30 pm to 11:45. Needless to say we couldn't sleep - and it sure wasn't romantic. We called the desk and complained. They said it would be ending at 11 pm (not true) and said they'd have security quiet it down (didn't happen - it got even louder). The next morning we complained about this. The front desk staff couldn't have been nicer. They were apologetic, knew about the problem, offered to buy us breakfast, gave us Grandbourne points, etc. There can always be a problem, but if the management accepts responsibility and makes it up to you - that really saves the day. So I think Belvoir should do two things. Says thanks to their front desk staff for a job well done - and soundproof their ballrooms. No guest should every have to lose sleep because of too much noise in the hotel.

title: Not very clean and a little run down
comment: Very dirty carpet in room and hallways. Rundown intreriors (for example my room had a chipped bath tub). The bedsheets were wirnkled but otherwise looked clean (I hope they were!)

title: very poor experience - beware elevator!
comment: Had the pleasure of getting stuck in the elevator for approx. 10 min. Extremely hot. Once I finally heard response to the red button, it was 'SOMEONE IS ON THE WAY!" No apologies. No sorry for the convenience. After being extracted, the front desk had nothing further to offer. The hotel staff appeared completely unprepared to address this situation. I was rewarded by being charged for drinking a 2nd bottle of water on the hotel bill..

everyoneShouldKnow: Outside appearance aside, a great hotel
title: nice hotel
comment: Had two stays over a one week period. hotel was extremely accommodating to me to find a room with my specific needs on short notice and during a period of high occupancy.

title: Pretty standard, room for improvement
comment: This hotel is pretty standard for the Belvoir Suites Hotels.

title: A hassle
comment: This was my first stay as a Belvoir Preferred Guest. The room was above average, and I enjoyed the upgrade to club level and the club lounge and breakfast. My primary complaints are the following:

everyoneShouldKnow: The people here are courteous, attentive and always have a smile. Makes coming here like coming home.
title: Amazing Hotel
comment: Have been staying at the Dolphin for 10 years. Hotel is beautiful. Every restaurant has excellent food and wonderful staff, courteous and attentive. Rooms are clean and beds are so comfortable. Housekeeping is excellent. Location between epcot and Hs cannot be beat. can walk to both. Pools are fabulous, spa is gorgeous. I would definitely recommend this hotel and I have. I plan to come here for many years to come.

title: This place was okay
comment: I came during Comic-Con so I expected it to be really busy. My room was clean, except for the fact that my duvet had a gross stain on it. The shuttle service is nice, and the drivers are great if you're trying to get somewhere on time.

title: Over rated and really needs help.
comment: The staff was friendly but my toilet clogged up and my tub would not drain. Asked for the toilet to be fixed and the guy came with a stopper in a plastic bag, fixed the toilet but left the liquid mess. I took a shower and the tub took over an hour to drain.

title: not my first choice for future stays
comment: We always stay in Grandbourne properties but were disappointed with this hotel. Check in was slow (only one clerk, and a very busy lobby with a large youth sports group on site). There is self-parking on site - the hotel is in a suburban area with plentiful parking, next to a large shopping mall - but the valet was overly persistent in offering his services to two able-bodied adults with only one small bag between us.

title: best kept secret
comment: great hotel. great staff, great area, great club lounge, great bar, great pool

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location to visit patients at John C. Lincoln Hospital.
title: Great for business meetings
comment: We visited a relative and found the hotel to be convenient and meeting our needs. In addition, the staff was very helpful. I complement the hotel for having a relationship with the nearby hospital.

title: Slow shuttle, bad management
comment: I was extremely dissatisfied. After being delayed in airports for 6 hours I had to wait for 50 minutes for the shuttle after being told it would arrive in less than 20 minutes. The driver blamed the front desk the front desk blamed the driver. Neither seemed to care. I had to wake up at 4:45 the next morning and got only 4 hours of sleep. Never going there again

title: Hotel needs updating
comment: Bathrooms need updating. Location is good.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's clean and the pools are THE best thing about it.
title: Great Resort - but not the food
comment: The resort itself was grand and impressive, exp. compared to the official Disney Resorts. The room was nice and clean, the pools were fabulous, but the food was terrible, exp. for the price and we're not picky eaters. A hot dog, fries and drink was $10. A salad was a head of uncut lettuce, with a spoon full of cheese, yogart, and a thin slice of cucumber for $19! I sent it back! They had to be joking!! Most of the staff was courteous, but not as much as you would expect from a "resort". The housekeeping staff was nicer than the front desk and concierge staff! We would stay here again because the room was clean, the pools were great, and it's convenient and free shuttle to the main parks.

everyoneShouldKnow: Kind, helpful staff from reception, to transportation, to housekeeping.
title: Fabulous Staff and Wonderful City!
comment: From the moment we stepped into the lobby, the staff of this hotel treated our family like valued guests! We enjoyed our stay in this hotel and Louisville so much, we stayed an extra night! If you are coming to Louisville, this hotel is a must stay!!

title: Guest relations nightmare
comment: I stayed at the Denver Belvoir for a conference with School Nutrition. I travel 40 weeks a year. The accommodations were fine except the bed was very uncomfortable (loved the pillows). I was in conference Suday morning thru wednesday. I stayed over Wed night to sight see thursday and lounge around the pool before I flew back that night. I called the front desk to request a late checkout and they told me that noon was checkout and anything past that would be a $50 chg per hr. I will NEVER stay at Belvoir again!

title: Muy buen hotel
comment: Super󠮵estras expectativas

everyoneShouldKnow: If you expect a smile from the staff, you are expecting too much.
title: Poor service
comment: All the staff, with a glaring exception of one (Cindy at the front desk) , needs to improve on following :

title: Room small for BIG price
comment: The staff was most accomodating , we take our dogs everywhere we go and they were a big help in looking after them while we went to a concert. I was a little disappointed in the room size, we frequent hotels often and we always pay much less for the same or higher quality hotels and except for Grandbourne have always ended up with very large rooms, this one was quite small. Also if you are going have exposed pipes in the bathroom, they should be kept clean as well as those places behind the toilet, After all we are paying to have the best of the best.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't stay there if you are a traveled business person.
title: Understaffed and acquard
comment: Understaffed and Confusing

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel is very old and it desperately to need to renovated, upgraded, torn down and rebuild.
title: Desparate Renovation and Upgrade
comment: This hotel is old and smell like mildew from the moment I walked in the door. The hallway smell stale and very warm. The rooms was horrible with the stale smell. Furthermore, the pictures of the rooms on the website are deceiving. The phones were old from the 1970's. The floor was extremely dirty and needed to be clean. The floor was so dirty until the white socks I was wearing were filled with dirt. I stayed on the club level and the food was dry and not fresh at all. I was suppose to stay two nights but after arriving and checking in to my room, I could not bear another night at the hotel. So I checked out after the one night stay moved to another BPG 25 min away. Finally, this hotel is very dull and old and it's in desperate need of a major renovation. For the amount of money I paid for the one night was not worth. I understand that Belvoir has been around for long time. But this hotel look like it was the first one built and there has not been any change except for the 40 inch flat screen tv on the wall. I highly recommend this hotel being torned down and rebuilt and this will bring new life to the Midlothian area and I am sure the residence in the area will appreciate it. Therefore, until changes are made short pump will be the area that I will stay in when I visit Richmond.

title: Hotel in poor condition
comment: Air conditioner in unit made loud noise while opertaing

title: Needs Improvement
comment: As a Lifetime Platinum I stay in many Grandbourne properties and this one rates as poor. Many of the "Upgrade" rooms have small bathrooms, poor/bad drainage in the tubs and sinks, and the ventilation is very poor.

title: caring staff
comment: I suffered a death in the family while I was staying at this Belvoir.From the moment I asked the staff if I could extend my stay to deal with this tragedy, everyone from manager to door staff went out of their way to help me and to ease this terrible time for me. I never expected all this from what appeared to be a big impersonal NY hotel. I cannot say how much i appreciate my experience there.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff does whatever it can to help you!
title: Great Location, Great Concierge Level, Great Staff
comment: In town for a convention. Great location! 1 block from 16th street free bus system. 2 blocks from art museum, US mint, 2 blocks from summer taquiria trucks! Great, friendly staff who couldn't be more helpful. I had a medical emergency and concierge recommended a great hospital and when I needed plastic wrap for my bandage, brought the whole roll of plastic wrap!!!. Plus, gave great dinner suggestions and helped with tour reservations. Hotel bed was best I have ever been in. I usually have to ask for a board to be placed under the mattress but this mattress, we wanted to take home with us! And the concierge level - great. Newspaper daily. Breakfast and Cocktail hour food was great - and saved us a small fortune on meals. Plus, all the water, soda, Starbuck hot drinks, we wanted, all day/night long. Thank you for such an enjoyable stay. All of your hard efforts totally show in your staff.

title: Stay at another BPG property
comment: This property is old and the staff are unfriendly and unhelpful. The manager Vinny is uncompromising so don't expect any help from him. It is a disappointing hotel in such a beautiful city.

title: Disappointed
comment: This hotel did not meet my expectations. The television (direct TV) was missing almost all the channels - not channels related to Viacom. Asked for help - all different answers all of which were false.

title: Features
comment: The room was not cleaned for two days had to find towels and clean myself. The hallway way flooded and smelled.

title: It was Ok
comment: FOR THE FIRST COUPLE OF DAYS IT WAS GOOD. THE HOUSEKEEPER CLEANED WELL GAVE US ENOUGH TOWELS. (WE WERE LEAVING $5 TIPS BECAUSE WE HAVE KIDS). THEN AFTER THE FIRST COUPLE OF DAYS SHE DIDN'T GIVE US ENOUGH TOWELS & CUPS. YOU FIGURE IF SOMEONE IS LEAVING YOU A TIP YOU DO A BETTER JOB. I LITTLE DISAPPOINTED ON THE LAUNDRY FACILITY. (ONLY ONE) I WENT DOWNSTAIRS TO THE FRONT DESK ABOUT 0215 TO GET CHANGE FOR QUARTERS AND THE FRONT DESK RAN OUT. (I FIGURE I WASH CLOTHES THAT EARLY BECAUSE I KNOW NO ONE WILL BE DOING LAUNDRY) HE TOLD ME THAT I COULD GO UP THE STREET AND GET CHANGE FROM THERE. YOU FIGURE YOU HAVE ONE WASHER/DRYER FOR THE ENTIRE HOTEL GUEST TO USE AND IT IS OPEN 24HRS THE LEAST YOU COULD'VE HAD WAS A LOT OF QUARTERS IN ANY HOUR OF THE DAY. I DIDN'T APPRECIATE THAT. IN THE BEGINNING I ENJOYED IT BUT FURTHER STAYING THERE I WAS VERY DISAPPOINTED WITH THE STAFF AT THIS Belvoir.

title: Great place! Great location!
comment: Former West Des Moines resident and needed to stay in the area recently. Since I was familiar with the hotel, I thought it would be the best place to stay. Wow! They have done an excellent job with this place and I would recommend it to anyone staying in the area. I was greeted immediately by Matt at the front desk when I arrived. His service was well beyond anything you'd expect in a chain hotel. All of my requests were met with a smile including an early morning check-in due to delayed flights from Dallas. The suite I stayed in was great, nice leather sofa, new TV's and very comfy beds. They have done great things with the lobby restaurant and bar area which welcomes everyone as they arrive. Housekeeping staff was very efficient, speedy and thorough. Price was right too!! :)

everyoneShouldKnow: Horrible management, unfriendly staff, and dirty rooms.
title: HORRIBLE STAY
comment: This was suppose to be a great family weekend at a nice two bedroom Villa at the Belvoir Vistana Resort, within ten minutes of getting to the resort we quickly realized our hotel stay was not going to be so pleasant. We have stayed in this resort a couple of times and are Grandbourne Preferred Guests. As we walked into our room, we were greeted with a garbage full of beer bottles, a kitchen full of dirty dishes and the refrigerator wide open. It looked like the room had never been cleaned, and that a party had just recently ended. We made our way to the master bedroom to find a bed that looked like it was just laid in, and a bathroom with towels all over the floor, and all the complimentary soaps opened and used. The second bedroom was suppose to be two DOUBLE beds, and to our surprise was two TWIN beds, mind you we were four couples. What I found a little comical of all of this is that we called around 6:00pm to say we were running late and wouldn't be in until 11:00pm , and we were told your room is already clean and ready. I guess the Belvoir has different opinions of what constitute a CLEAN and READY room. We called management and were told someone would be right over, it took about 40 minutes for someone to come, this was already 1:00am. The supervisor didn't even bother looking at the condition of the room and simply stated he believed us, which leads me to believe this isn't the first time the Resort encounters this problem with a guest. They moved us to another room, and we were told that we would receive a $40 credit to use in the resort for our stay. When we got to the other room, again we were greeted with unmade beds, at this point we were tired and just wanted to sleep, so we just asked for clean sheets, the supervisors response was "look in the closet", clean sheets were never brought to us. We decided to go and use our $40.00 credit at the supermarket located inside the resort, much to our surprise, there was NO CREDIT TO USE! the overnight supervisor never notated the account with the credit, and forgot to mention why we requested a room change. We decided that we had enough of the resort and went to the front desk to ask for a credit of $40.00 back to our credit card. Again, we were greeted by unfriendly staff, unwilling to help. We were told that they could not do anything for us and that a credit to our account was illegal, mind you we reserved our stay directly with the hotel, I would understand if we booked with a third party. After about an hour of arguing with management we were given a $40.00 credit towards our credit card. I am sorry, but after all the problems we had with the resort, I sincerely though management would have offered a little more then the initial $40.00 credit were we offered for a DIRTY, UNKEPT, SMELLY, room and UNFRIENDLY, UNHELPFUL employees. I visit Orlando on a constant basis and have stayed at the Belvoir several times. Unfortunately our next stay in Orlando will NOT be at the Belvoir Vistana Resort. This is not the service you expect from such a large hotel chain, it's not like we paid $40 a night, we paid $212 a night (with taxes) for horrible service, and an initial dirty, unkept, smelly room, with dirty sheets. I would never recommend this resort to a family member, friend, colleague, or random passer by. This was the worst hotel experience my family and I have ever had.

title: The hotel is for tour groups, not individaul travellers
comment: Booked 2 x 1 night stays as part of my families trip to Alaska on club floor. 1st stay. Sent to room with maid still cleaning, coffee/tea tray not refreshed, minibar empty. no extra amenities in club room. 2nd stay, same room facilities however i'd left luggage at hotel while travelling around for 3 days. checked back into hotel and asked for luggage to be delivered to the room, waited, chased with call to reception. After making coffee and shower, still no luggage, went to reception to collect, no chance of an apology... just told busy with coach arrivals. amazing. Club room continental breakfast. cereal, bread, cake, fruit, few other items. No Eggs, cold meat, oats or anything heathy to eat, except friut of course. saw one member of staff drop in for few minutes who couldn't help a customer use coffee machine, said it was new and nobody had showed her.

everyoneShouldKnow: They have an Ant problem and don't seem to care!
title: Expensive, internet extra, and ants!
comment: I had some expectations for staying at a fine hotel like this, but problems started with the reservations, which took two phone calls (had to start over) when the first one did not go through. Pool was a joke. Isolated from everything, and the final kicker was Ants. Ieave any food item on the desk an it would be swarmed by ants in a little while. Told the staff TWICE about this in the short stray we had and they did nothing, offered to do nothing, and said "oh, that happens sometimes". Won't stay there again...

title: Really enjoyed our stay
comment: From the moment we entered the hotel till we left, we found the staff extremely attentive and helpful. Room was wonderful, clean, modern and great views. Steve, at the front desk was especially welcoming. Computer access, safety features on elevator, all added up to making our NY stay a great one.

title: Wonderful Stay
comment: Hotel exceeded all expectations and the staff was friendly. Thanks.

title: Good location and staff but...
comment: The room was less than I am used to at Grandbourne Hotels. The door to my room required slamming it to close, sometimes more than once. The air conditioner banged each time it started, There were stains on the bathroom wall and the paint on the bathroom ceiling was bubbling.

title: Clean Comfortable Downtown Stay
comment: This is one a the better Belvoirs where I have stayed. Everything was in place , the staff was helpful and all was as it should be.

title: Hope you are ready for a hassle...
comment: After my stay there, a week later than the hotel charge on my CC, I get another charge on my CC for an additional night stay. After 4 calls over a week and a half in which I was continually transferred to the manager's voicemail and assured he would return my calls, I finally got him to answer. He said that it looks like they put me down for 2 reservations for a room for one of the nights by accident and charged me for a no show. Honestly the first time I have heard of charging for a no show, especially on a weekday. He said it would be refunded that day. 2 weeks have gone by without seeing it yet and being sent to voicemail yet again. You might want to think twice about staying here. There are plenty of other decent hotels in Duluth that have to have better customer service.

title: Do not believe staff
comment: We were checked in by the Front Desk Manager. We were given a room on the first floor halfway between the elevator and the door to the parking lot. The noise and traffic kept us awake until after 1 am and started again at 5 am. When we complained at check out, the desk clerk told us that we should have been informed about the noisy room and given a discount-neither was done. She also told us the manager would be contacting us-which has not happened. There are too many other choices to put up with this.

title: Great Downtown Hotel
comment: This hotel was great! It was one of the only hotels in the downtown area to offer free internet in the room. This is the main reason I stayed here. It was also very close to restaurants and where I was working. The staff was very friendly and I appreciated the free bottles of water every day. The only problem I ever had was that the internet went down for a couple of hours one night of my stay.

title: Staff was fantastic!
comment: The nature of my job requires that I am on the road 80% each week. To me a hotel staff is what makes difference and thestaff at the Belvoir Music City was outstanding. They made me feel vey welcome and very comfortable. Great experience and I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Not What I Expected
comment: I stayed in a room on the Club Floor. When I entered the room, it smelled as if someone had been smoking there previously, and due to the loud traffic noise in the room,I thought the window was open. It was also hot in the room...around 80. So, I thought perhaps someone had decided to smoke, propped open the window, and left it open, and that would explain everything. But that was not the case: the loud traffic noise was just incredibly bad window noise isolation, and the 80 degree temp was because the a.c was not functioning.

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel overbooks and sends you to a different city.
title: Hotel Overbooks and the Customers Losses
comment: We wanted to stay at this hotel because it was 1 mile from the place where we wanted to be. After a day of delays we arrived at the hotel at 9 p.m. (in my mind I was thinking all we need to do is take a shower and hurry up to make it to our event) and the hotel staff tells me the hotel is overbooked and there is no room for us. Their alternative is to send us to another hotel 15 miles away in La Jolla. By the time we got to the other hotel and checked in it was past 11 p.m. The whole point of us going to San Diego was to enjoy and have fun . This experience was anything but that. The hotel overbooks and we end up losing. We didn't make it to our event that night because it was a 30 minute taxi ride back to San Diego and another 30 minute taxi ride back to the hotel. We ended up calling it a night after realizing that by the time we would get back to San Diego we would be to late for our event. This disrupted our travel plans and made us miss the reason we were going to San Diego. This is unprofessional and should not happen. I booked this hotel because we wanted to visit San Diego not La Jolla.

everyoneShouldKnow: There are two hotels only minutes from each other and the main one is the better.
title: Great location and amenities
comment: This was a special trip for our 10 year old granddaughter. The pools, location to Sea World and the Zoo, Starbucks right in the hotel -- all met and exceeded our expectations.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is easy access to the Interstate and very nice looking hotel.
title: Small uncomfortable beds and pillows
comment: On the club level, there are no rooms that work for a family or more than 3 people, really. They have 2 small doubles, or one king. The beds are very uncomfortable and the sheets come up off the bed with the slighest movement. The pillows are just horrible. The room size is nice and spacious, so there is room for larger beds or a pull out sofa. The waterslde, pool, and hot tub were very nice. The breakfast was decent, but could've been better.

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenient to the airport and always offers a warm welcome
title: Hotel Staff
comment: I complement the entire hotel staff, particularly Stanley who always greets with a smile and a handshake, Torri who often handles my reservations in a most professional manner and also offers a friendly greeting, the entire room service staff and the folks in the bar. Maria also offers a warm and kind welcome. Thanks to all.

everyoneShouldKnow: The recent renovation is really nice; rooms are clean and comfortable.
title: Impressive . . . But For a Couple Things
comment: Overall, our experience was quite nice and we would stay again. The recent upgrades to the property were obvious and appreciated. The rooms were bright and clean, although the bathroom was quite small. Our two small boys thoroughly enjoyed the pools and the water slide -- well done! We ordered food three times during our stay and every meal was very good. We were also pleasantly surprised with the entertainment options for both kids and adults - the movie by the pool at night was a great touch. But there were two things we felt really detracted from the "upgraded" persona of this hotel -- #1: While the staff were always friendly and happy to help, there were just too few working the pool bar. Every time we went for a drink or to place a food order, it was a long wait and they just seemed to be always running around. And getting anyone to take your order while lounging at the pool was an impossibility - a real challenge for parents with two small children. Secondly, while the idea of the poolside movie after dark is great, we think the hotel really should have invested in double paned windows for the pool facing rooms. Our two small kids couldn't fall asleep until well after 10:00pm with all the noise.

title: My Stay
comment: The whole stay at the hotel from the valet parking service to the cleaning staff , and all other staff members were excellent. This made our stay there very enjoyable.

title: Much Better Than Last Year!
comment: Finally this hotel is improving,The room & furnishings have been / are being upgraded. Finally got rid of the old CRT Televisions, now LCD flat screens!

everyoneShouldKnow: BPG preferred guests are treated very well
title: Comfortable with Friendly Staff
comment: Friendly staff and comfortable accommodations. Would definitely stay here again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Peets coffee, the Yardhouse, 16 Mix has great martinis
title: Worst stay.... :(
comment: Would not recommend any king size rooms in their Tower building. Room/bathroom very small, about the size of a handicap stall in a public bathroom. Walls thin and lots of noise on the floor. First time I've ever had to call security for noise issues. The a/c unit was so noisy that we had to turn it off for the night just so we could sleep. We have stayed on the Plaza side previously and have not had any issues there. Also, only 2 bathroom towels, had to call for extras.

everyoneShouldKnow: Valet Parking is only $4.00 more. Self Parking is very difficult.
title: DISSAPPOINTED
comment: Very disappointed. The room we original got it appear that somebody smoked in the room. The front desk attendance was nice and changed to a pure-room which it was much better. My bad experience was with the accounting department, my credit card was charged: $145.21 for one night including parking which is okay, however a second charged for the amount of $352.00 was charged on my credit card and a third charge of $50.00 was charged on my credit card with no explanation. I called the front desk on Saturday morning and I was told that the accounting department was close and there is nothing they can do.

title: Average hotel. Not good or bad.
comment: Spent 4 nights in this average hotel.

title: Beware of the enhanced charges for the Club Lvel Rooms
comment: I recieved a note from the Hotel to offer an upgrade from the room I had booked to the "Club" level. It was for $20.00. We decided the benefits were worth the extra $20. To our surprise, the "Club" level room had two double beds instead of queen or king beds. The room was very small. When we got into the room we were very disapointed. We went back to the front desk. We spoke to Clint. He was very helpful. We told him we were disapointed and he tried to get us into a suite with queen beds. There was none available for Friday and Saturday night, but we did get to switch to the suite on Sunday6 evening. The suite was huge, but the bath was extremely smal for an executive suite. We were disapointed in the size of the bathroom, but the suite was extellent. Overall we had a great stay and the staff was suberb!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Fantastic location - super close walk to Navy Pier and Loop (~ a mile for each). We did this with two small children and no problems.
title: Everything but coffee
comment: There's no question that I loved everything about this hotel except...the lack of a coffee bar in the lobby for us "early risers." When traveling with my family I typically get up a few hours before everyone else and slip away to the lobby to work. It would be wonderful to have a self-serve coffee bar available. Instead, I walked three blocks to Fox and Obel (which is wonderful) and back. Otherwise, the stay was marvelous.

title: Great Amenities
comment: Extremely helpful staff - great food and beverage

everyoneShouldKnow: There are two buildings located a five-minute walk from one another: Bay and Marina.
title: Lots of amenities and close to airport
comment: This hotel is located mere minutes from the airport, and a free shuttle service is provided. I stayed here for a yoga conference for 5 nights in July 2012, and found the 12th floor Club Access room to be very comfortable and the view spectacular (overlooking the ocean and marina). Everything was great, including the prompt room service and very friendly staff throughout the properties.

title: Front Desk
comment: The Staff went above and beyond in checking me in. My colleagues had an issue with booking and they did not book properly, so they did not have a room for the night. The staff found them alternate accommodations for the evening. The staff took it upon themselves to find them a room for the evening.

title: BPG awareness
comment: Club room was not even mentioned to us, only found out about it while reading reviews. AND... parking valet and garage not attended to, though we did not pay to park, we were asked to move our car from the valet spot after we had settled into our room for the night,or we would be charged .

everyoneShouldKnow: Rooms facing the airport can see the SeaWorld fireworks at night; right now those same rooms may hear construction at the airport so best to have activities outside your room during the day.
title: Get lots of room keys
comment: Loved the hotel - different from others as there are two separate buildings, which are connected by a pleasant, short walk or via their shuttle. Had a terrible time with getting a room key that worked. First key worked once, but not the second time. Next key didn't work the Club Level, even though I paid more for that luxury. The next key didn't work either. Then finally the desk clerk realized that I didn't have Club Level keys. He swapped those out but still didn't work. After my 6th trip to the desk, I finally got keys that worked. I spent the better part of 6 hours trying to get keys that worked. Very frustrating.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very convenient for getting to Johns Hopkins hospital via interstate, plus being in a nice neighborhood.
title: Very friendly staff
comment: Nice hotel and very friendly staff. Has walkway to large mall. Very convenient to 695 interstate. Great workout facility and Indoor pool. Only downside is pool is frequently closed.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is wonderful and go out of their way to make your stay comfortable.
title: Exceeded our Expectations!!
comment: My partner and I stayed at this location July 2012 for a Birthday get-a-way for two days....Everything exceeded our expectations. The customer service was Exceptional! Christian....thank you so much for your kindness you were "First Class" all the way. All of the employees were very courteous and helpful. The room was comfortable/clean and the Club lounge was well stocked. The breakfast was delicious!

title: Best Grandbourne hotel in the Philadelphia area
comment: This is my favorite hotel in the Philadelphia area. I have been in the city many times over the past year and my time here has been the best by far.

title: Great hotel for travelers in historic Philadelphia
comment: I spend a significant amount of time in Philadelphia, and that has meant visiting the various Grandbourne properties (including this hotel).

title: Good hotel with great value
comment: Good location. Comfortable setup in lobby. Clean with good cafeteria for breakfast, and Starbuck as well. People are pleasant and helpful.

everyoneShouldKnow: There are two different buildings. It was not a problem to access both.
title: Great Stay at A Great Hotel
comment: We had booked a double room for two nights. We were upgraded to a corner room that had a separate sitting area, two queen beds, and a great view! We had access to the Club Lounge, which was fantastic. Breakfast was great, drinks available all day, hors d' oeuvres in the evening. The attendants were fantastic. Very attentive to everyone. Matt, brought our luggage to our room. He was great. Very friendly, offered to get us ice, he gave us information on the hotel and downtown. We were in the Tower Building. I had read a lot of reviews from people, saying it was confusing to get from the main lobby to the rooms in the Tower Building. Not so!! Once you know where your going, it's no problem. From the valet parking to check in and check out, we had very friendly professional service.

title: Best Stay
comment: I truly enjoyed my stay. The only complaint was that there was something on the headboard.

everyoneShouldKnow: IN the middle of renovating. Make sure you get a renovated room, as the old ones have horrible mattresses.
title: Great staff, horrible matresses
comment: I literally sank 5 inches into the bed when I laid down. No Sweet Sleeper beds here.

title: Great Location and staff
comment: I found the location of this hotel on this, my first visit to New Orleans, to be excellent.It is within easy walking distance of Harrah's Casino, the Riverwalk Mall, the French Quarter, Bourbon Street, and many wonderful places to eat.

title: Recommended for vacation traveller
comment: Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful - that was the best part. Rooms themselves were clean, tidy and functional. Decorated in a more traditional style.

title: Poor check in
comment: Check in was slow. Then we were

title: Belvoir San Diego Hotel - Bay Tower
comment: Disappointed in the Belvoir. When I checked in they asked if I need an accessible room on a lower floor, I said no, it had been booked for me. They upgraded me to a deluxe King Bed room right next to the Elevator Bank. I spent 6 days listening to the elevators going up and down. Thank you for the upgrade. Room was neat but dirty. Blood on the bathroom door and cookie pieces in the closet and by the bed.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location and service. Prices were competitive with area hotels with fewer amenities.
title: Great experience, except for bed size
comment: Staff member Steven C. recognized my name at check-in and desk staff was very helpful throughout our stay. We had to bring our two dogs last minute, which was no problem at all.

title: the staff need customer service training
comment: I arrived at the hotel with approximate 8 other guests that were in my party. We were not greeted by the staff member. The person that assisted me never recognized that we were waiting on assistance until another staff member advised him of this. He Didn't mention to myself nor the other guests the different activities and/or functions that were on the other floors in the hotel.

title: billing
comment: As the person that handled the billing on my teachers stay at the hotel I am not satisfied, when I made the reservation I faxed in the tax exempt form, I then received our credit card statement and the tax was included in the rooms. I called and I was told it was not received and then when Mrs. Furr got to the hotel she was charged her second night on her credit card I called and was supposed to be emailed a credit authorization form it never came.

everyoneShouldKnow: Rooms need to a thorough cleaning
title: Dirty and need of a refresh
comment: I am a very experienced traveller and have stayed at this hotel in the past. Overall I was unhappy as the room was down right dirty. Grease on the windows and skanky carpets. Plus the bathroom fixtures were also generally dirty. I wiped down the windows myself and the towels turned black. Gross!

title: Needs process improvement...
comment: My res said 'plez have rollaway in room for VERY late arrival' since we have a young child. Res agent said they'd note it on the res...

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't be concerned if you are an individual traveller and you see conventions there. You will still receive the best of attention and service.
title: Like Coming Home
comment: I have been staying at the Boston Belvoir (first for business; now for personal) for over 30 years. I love it -- the staff, the rooms the view, the location, etc. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Boston.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is in a great location close to everything
title: For the most part a good stay
comment: I enjoyed staying at the Belvoir and I have stay previously. I had a wonderful view and slept well. The location is great easy access to the attractions, events and activities. The concierges were helpful and attentive. My check out person and the door man were not the most pleasant or personable and the recommended van service to the airport was 1 hour late picking us up; we missed our flight. Overall it is a good place to stay. I would recommend it to a friend. Matter of fact I would like to suggest to my family that we visit Chiacgo and stay at the Belvoir.

everyoneShouldKnow: How clean the property is and how friendly the staff is
title: Pleasant Stay
comment: My stay at the hotel was wonderful.. I found the rooms to be clean and beautiful. The meeting facilities were amazing and the food was great. I really enjoyed my 3 day stay.

title: Great staff and good food!
comment: I stayed at the Virginia Beach Belvoir hotel with my family from July 18-23 and I had the most wonderful time. We have been coming to this hotel for last 3 years and this hotel not only transformed to more modern facility, but the staff are wonderful. All the staff were very friendly and helpful throughout our staff. The new happy hour menus were great and with a great staff, we kept ordering oysters, chicken wings and local beers at the beach side restaurant and wine and fish taco at the main lobby bar. Please send my compliment to the entire staff and to the general manager for making the hotel vary family friendly hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: You get First Class Service!! They made me feel like a million bucks!
title: Great Place, Comfy Stay
comment: Belvoir's service is of high quality and the staff members are so cooperative in meeting your needs. They really go the extra mile to see every concern is met and follow up with e review. My stay was great!

everyoneShouldKnow: The amenitites and customer service are not great.
title: Mediocre at Best
comment: I had a less than average experirence at the Belvoir Brooklyn Hotel. I stayed four weeks in a row. The rooms are less than spectacular. The furniture was worn, the bedding was not cleaned thoroughly, and there were cigarette burns in the carpet of my smoke-free room.

title: My room was lacking
comment: I was so disappointed my room 2641 did not have a Gideon Bible in the room.

everyoneShouldKnow: Front desk staff provide excellent customer service, and my stay was wonderful
title: Excellence
comment: customer service was pleasant and accommodating to all of my needs. I stayed here the last day of my trip, but will be sure to stay longer the next time I visit Philadelphia!

title: Nice hotel, but very slow checking in & out
comment: The hotel is nice and most meeting rooms are convenient. The front desk was understaffed at check-in and extremely slow. There was also a huge line at check-out.

title: The true "Sunny Side of Louisville"
comment: Great location, the Hotel Staff were beyond some of the best I have experienced.

title: I love this hotel!
comment: I love this hotel! The rooms are very comfy and the beds are heavenly. The food was delicious and the meeting space was very comfortable. What I really love about this hotel is the staff. Everyone on was very helpful and accommodating. I did not feel like I was at a hotel, I felt like I was at grandmas house. Thank you to everyone for your hospitality.

title: Great stay!
comment: A co-worker and I stayed here for one night, while we attended a conference. We were treated very well - the front desk staff was super helpful and very friendly. We were given rooms on the same floor, which we requested, and the views were great!! Very happy with this hotel and we would both return. Fantastic location too!

title: Great service
comment: The staff was very friendly (Brooke) and treated you like one of the family.

title: Great service!
comment: Randy, the manager, and his team did a great job for us on our recent stay at the Universal City property! The service was extremely personalized, the staff was friendly, and they met our special requests on all fronts. Kudos to Randy and the staff at this hotel!

title: One problem
comment: The hotel is really good. Location is perfect. Only issue is the access to food as there aren't many options within walking distance. Ate at Paparazzi, which was recommended by the person at the check in desk--no surprise. Problem is food is way overcooked. My seafood appetizer and the halibut and the risotto were cooked at least 5 mins too long and were dry and chewy.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's beautiful and close to the beach .
title: Great Hotel
comment: Upon our arrival, the reservations were incorrect. The lady who waited on me told me that the hotel was completely booked. My reservations were wrong. After speaking to someone named Constance at the corporate office, they found a room for us. Everything in the hotel was great. The room was very nice,but the BPG recognition I did not receive the benefits of the free breakfast daily. I will use this hotel again next year for summer vacation.

title: Great location and free shuttle
comment: Great location for work purposes and easy access to NYC!

everyoneShouldKnow: ONCE INSIDE YOU MAY NOT WANT TO GO OUT.
title: EXECELLENT SERVICE
comment: WE WHERE VERY IMPRESSED WITH THIS HOTEL, ITS TOP NOTCH! VERY CLEAN AND UP TO DATE ANEMITIES. BEAUTIFUL/RELAXING OUTSIDE PATIO WITH THE VIEW OF THE CITY. THE STAFF WAS VERY FRIENDLY AND HELPFUL...WE WHERE VERY PLEASED WITH OUR STAY AND LOOK FORWARD TO RETURNING SOME DAY.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location is the best available in Waikiki!
title: Top Notch Family Vacation Experience - HIGHLY RECOMMEND
comment: Incredible family vacation! We stayed 4 nights, July 10-14 and had an incredible experience; (2 kids ages 9 & 11). From staff at check-in to our departure everything was top notch. This property really recognizes their platinum members, we received an upgraded room/suite, which was spacious with beautiful views of Diamond Head, the ocean and property. Platinum members also received a wristband that allowed easier access to the new club lounge & getting towels at the pool. The new lounge on the 30th floor was great, the hostess and wait staff very friendly and helped with island recommendations/directions. Club lounge had great choices for breakfast and evening appetizers. Pool areas were great for families with a water slide and we never had a problem locating chairs by the pool or space on the beach. Overall a nice hotel, great location, and friendly service. Thanks for honoring platinum status...as not all Grandbourne hotels do. Highly professional, courteous and efficient management (Thanks Kelly and Julie). Anytime we are back in Honolulu, this will be where we stay!

title: Great location for this Hotel.
comment: Great clean hotel! Beautiful views of the city and central location for attractions. Almost everything we did was within walking distance or reasonable, available taxi ride. Will stay here again! Lots to do in Chicago!

title: Great location, wonderful amenities
comment: My family has stayed at this hotel several times. The breakfast buffet at the club level was perfect for us. It had great fruit and healthy food selections and the attendants were very friendly and efficient. The fitness facility was first class. Among the best! Our check-ins have always been handled quickly and without problem. We shall return

title: Room dirty and poor service
comment: It took for ever to get checked in, very short staffed. The room bathroom was not clean and required housekeeping to reclean. Slow service. Not what I expected for a Grandbourne Hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: The guy that checked me out was awesome and has great customer service skills. However the girl that I called on Tuesday July 17th kept transferring me to housekeeping when I wanted room service.
title: NYC
comment: This is our 3rd time to stay here and we just started using the BPG points. This is a great place to stay and all of our 3 kids had a blast!

title: Great Hotel
comment: Great Room! Staff was professional, helpful and courteous. Wonderful experience!

title: Overall it's just ok.
comment: The location of the hotel is nice that you could see the nice view of the city center. The front desk staff was helpful when we checked in. There were a couple things we did not really enjoy during the stay. The first thing was the internet. When I booked the room the feature included high speed internet, but I was told it is not free when I checked in. So be aware that is not free internet, it is just an available feature. When I called the guest service regarding to this the lady who answered the phone was very, very impatient and rude, honestly the worst I had had before at an Grandbourne hotel. We stayed there on a Saturday night and there were people shouting and crying in the hallway all the way till 2am. So be aware...

title: Outdated and dirty
comment: Our stay was not what we expected. Being a long time Gold member of BPG we expected a better, cleaner and more updated hotel. The rooms were very old and outdated. They still have the old big box tv's in the bedroom. All the furniture must be from the 80's. It was all dinged up. They still have popcorn ceilings for crying out loud. The bathroom is in need of serious upgrades. When we checked in the staff was pleasant enough, however when we requested a late check out for 4 pm (as per our status when available) they said they could not accommodate. We told them our situation as we have 2 children under the age of 2 that needed a nap before an evening wedding, the best they could do was 2 pm which we were very upset about. This caused our kids to not be rested and we had to leave the wedding early. We didn't make it out of our room until 230 (we were rushing) and nobody had even come to clean it yet so we know they could have extended it for us, they just didn't want to go above and beyond. When we went to give our son a bath there was hair in the bath tub which was just gross and not what you want to see before bathing your child. The one thing that was very nice was their breakfast buffet. I would highly recommend that. Valet was good but took a little long. Overall we were disappointed and will stay at the Westin like we have in the past in San Diego.

title: Great Time
comment: Took Family to SD for a get-away. Great place with big rooms

title: Outstanding
comment: We stayed at Belvoir Waikiki for 3 nights. The check in staff were amazing and, although I had to wait a few hours to check-in, they upgraded my room in recognition of the BPG gold. The service was outstanding on every level and I appreciated the recognition for BPG gold as most mainland north american BPG hotels do not even use their member lines despite having them signed. Upon check-out a later check out could not be provided as they were sold out (not surprising) however the staff allowed us use of a hospitality suite for 30 mins later in the day so we could clean up after spending the day on the grounds and in the pools. With such a late flight, this feature was very much appreciated. Food was also outstanding! Only complaint is we couldn't get a room with 2 queen beds... the doubles were just a little small for a family of 4.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Belvoir web site photo gallery was on point.
title: Family vacation
comment: The Belvoir resort was everything I hope it would be. The staff were very eager to assist you in anyway possible. The resort offers a lot of fun activities for both smaller and bigger kids. My two bedroom condo was very spacious and clean. The best part of my stay at the resort was "the staff" very efficient. Security check point get an A for every safety measure taken to secure each guest safety doing the stay on the resort.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location is perfect for Universal Studios
title: Service was surprising
comment: As a frequesnt traveler with my family that stays at many top hotels around the country, I was pleasantly surprised at the level of attentiveness we received from the staff. They were consistent across the board. I wish I could say the same at other hotels we stayed at. Only disappointment was the size of the sink. Was the size of an airplanes. Not sure I understand why they would do that.

title: the pool area is different and unique
comment: I like it , but the only concern that I spoke to someone and book a reservation 3 days before ,when I got there my reservation was no where to be found ,I end up paying more than what I was offer from the day of my reservation

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff go out of their way to make your stay comfortable.
title: Outstanding service
comment: We couldn't have been happier with our stay. We were able to book the room at the last minute. The reservation lady was very helpful & I consider myself a loyal customer from now on.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's has a great location!! You can see all of downtown Dallas!
title: Great place to stay!
comment: The Belvoir at Marketplace was great! The staff was sweet & the room was nice. It was small and a bit crammed; maybe a little rearranging would help. It was very clean and comfortable. Only downside was that I called to order room service & the operator said they closed at 11:00pm it's understandable but we called at 11:02pm. Oh, and the shower was broken.

title: Disappointing
comment: Staff very friendly but there was no recognition for being an BPG member, nothing special at all. "go Green points" for all and the bottled water in the room was even $4. Lack of quick service food options after 5pm. I would probably stay at another Belvoir property in Dallas but not this one.....

title: love staying at the Belvoir gateway!
comment: first of all, the valet guys are all GREAT! i am a local so i was in and out of hotel without a problem. Thank you so much for being a home away from home :)

title: Needs Improvement
comment: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a wedding we recently attended in the area. Considering the high cost of the room rates, my expectations were that the room would reflect the rate that was charged.

title: check-in
comment: Arrived around 6:30 but couldn't check in because no clean rooms. Received complimentary drinks from girl at desk and waited about 30 minutes for room. Staff was nice, but no manager on duty???? At All?? No problem with staff at front desk, but something needs to be done about your janitorial staff if they can't clean the rooms in sufficient time - checkout is 12?. Room was nice & very clean (which it should have been), but mattress was very firm.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you need a handicapped room, specify one with a roll-in shower. Not all come with one.
title: Superlative staff
comment: My 88-year old mom and I spent two nights for a wedding and were treated with respect and kindness. Ricardo, the manager, expertly handled a glitch in the handicapped room; we needed a roll-in shower. He moved us from a tub/shower room to one with the roll-in shower and made the move easy. The front desk staff, bellmen, and restaurant staff all gave above and beyond great service. My only concern with the hotel is that the back parking and entrance are dated and depressing. Oh, and please- give free wifi in the rooms!

title: This Hotel was very impressive
comment: the staff was more than accomodating. The room was very clean the beds were so comfortable. we stayed at the hotel for a soccer tournament. the restaurant in the hotel did not have a children's menu which would have been nice. but the food was very good. maybe if they could add a more casual dining for kids would be good.

everyoneShouldKnow: This Hotel does an outstanding job with large groups.
title: Hotel easily accomodated our large group.
comment: We enjoyed the Wisc. Reunion. The layout of the Hotel made it easy for everyone to enjoy all the functions.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's nice and clean. Very comfortable rooms.
title: Great Comfort
comment: My team was on official duty and we were in Birmingham for only one night. The room comfort was outstanding. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Loved The Sunday Brunch
comment: The bathroom is postage stamp size. The ceiling is so low that water droplets form from taking a shower, even though the less than adequate exhaust fan is on.

title: Refrigerator
comment: The cost of the refrigerator was too high $20.00 a night. Also the size and quality of the refrigerator was not worth the $20.00. You might consider adding this feature to a service the hotel provides. I've stayed in hotels that provided refrigerators with no additional cost. Also reason for trip was for a Religious Convention

everyoneShouldKnow: Bring money if you plan to eat on site.
title: Location is Amazing
comment: This hotel was located in the heart of everything. The was plenty of stuff to do around every corner. Kids and adults will have no problems being entertained during their stay.

title: An old structure that has been transformed to absolute comfort
comment: The grounds are relaxing and welcoming, the rooms were spacious and comfortable and the location was easy to get to. Staff was informative and very helpful.

everyoneShouldKnow: Everything here is great! However, avoid mission-critical work requiring the internet.
title: Poor Internet Coverage Didn't Ruin Trip
comment: This is my family's third visit for a stay-cation. We really like it here and my platinum status is well received by them. On arrival day, my wife had a web-conference for work. She planned to take this in our room, while the kids and I got out of her way. We spent all of an hour before her start time trying to log in with no success. We spoke with the vendor tech support and still no resolution. My wife had to resort to using the "community" computer area to plug in her laptop for a 5 hour web meeting. She was able to complete her work and worked through the interruptions from other guests and their kids. Shawn delivered outstanding customer care on this issue, and for the significant inconvenience we received an acceptable BPG points credit. We'll absolutely be going back as everything else there is outstanding. Make sure to see Brenda if you're having breakfast or anything else at Zest. Her service is impeccable!

title: Beautiful Spacious rooms
comment: The rooms were beautiful and the restaurants have excellent food. So far I have only stayed in these hotels for events but I am planning a retreat just for me

title: AC
comment: The air conditioning was malfunctioning in my room which led to close to 90 degree temps. Otherwise, everything else was excellent!

title: Great for the price
comment: Everything was great except for the restaurant. This is the second time I've used the restaurant in this hotel and have had the exact same experience both times. I was with a convention that sold out the hotel yet the restaurant wasn't prepared at all. Very, very bad service. Had to ask after waiting 20 minutes for someone to take drink orders. Once our order was placed for very easy stuff (hamburger, BLT) it took 40-45 minutes to get the food. Other than that, I had a great experience at the hotel.

title: Great stay
comment: In town for a convention. The Belvoir staff was friendly and helpful; the room was exceptionally clean and comfortable.

title: A hiddden treasure!
comment: A little hard to find but a great value for the price! The hotel is beautiful and very clean. The staff could not have been more friendly and helpful.

title: Another wonderful stay at this hotel!!
comment: We stay here often and are always welcomed by the excellent staff.

title: Very nice hotel,good location,close to restaurants,shops. About 15 minutes from Hersey Park.
comment: disappointed with the ventilation system in the bathroom, even the ceiling was soaked when using the shower, leaving a mildew odor..

title: Experience not a Belvoir standard experience
comment: I have stayed in may Belvoir properties and was shocked to find for the price that the hotel was not very accomodating. Parking was awful and the drive in front of the door was always full of parked cars not checking in to the hotel and they were not asked to move. The sheets for the pullout bed were not clean and I had to request service for my room at 2 PM in the afternoon. The lobby area was loud and crowded the entire weekend. For the price, I anticipated an upscale hotel with lots of ammenities and instead I found a very average hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: The location can't be beat. I only drove my vehicle out of the lot one time during my stay. Everything else was in walking distance.
title: Great service and location.
comment: The employees are great! They all put forth the effort I expect from a Sheriton. They were always polite, smiling and gave the impression they genuinely cared that we were happy. Rooms and hotel were clean and updated. Negatives -The fitness center is lacking in weight equipment. The machine that is there is junk and not up to the standard I expect. Parking is $10 a day, Wi-Fi is an extra cost, which I think is absurd.

title: Fun Traveler
comment: Good location...not too crazy busy area, plus close to restaurants and stores. Comfortable room with good size bathroom. Friendly staff. Only issue was housekeeping didn't clean room on our 3rd day. Not sure if they got side tracked or what.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's situated on a beautiful stretch of beach on Sand Key - away from the crowds of Clearwater Beach!
title: Great place for a celebration...
comment: Husband and I celebrated our 39th anniversary... lovely facility! Enjoyed the outside bar with the steel drum music! Decided to dine at Rusty's rather than venture out... had a wonderful Pris Fixe dinner! with a wonderful waiter... a very special evening! and weekend....

everyoneShouldKnow: I would definitely recommend this hotel. We will be bringing our kids back next spring.
title: Very Nice Stay
comment: My wife and I booked 2 nights at this property because the property we wanted to stay at was sold out. We were both very happy that it worked out this way. We stayed at a different property for 2 subsequent nights and much preferred the Belvoir. We stayed in an ocean view suite that was clean, comfortable and spacious. The front desk staff was very courteous and helpful. Christopher at the pool was very friendly and fun to talk to. Our service at the bar, pool and restaurant was great, too. The grounds were nice but not overly clean. I wouldn't say dirty, but I didn't notice much attention to detail, i.e. cigarettes, leaves, etc. The pool was very nice and very family friendly. We've been to a lot of places with our kids and it seems there's often pool police yelling at people for having fun. Here, everyone was having fun in a safe and controlled way. I saw Christopher address 2 guests very discreetly, one for smoking a cigarette and one for drinking what was presumably her own alcoholic concoction out of a red cup. He simply asked her to put it in a clear cup from the bar. Very reasonable! The shuttle worked well for us but I overheard a lot of complaints. You are required to book early and if it books up you are out of luck. The van only seats around 12 people. It seems like they could have either more vans or a larger bus-type vehicle. Ed was a great driver. He was very fun to talk to and helpful with suggestions and directions. I would definitely recommend this property. We will be bringing our kids back next spring.

everyoneShouldKnow: The location and price are excellent.
title: Needs updating
comment: We had a commotion in the hallway the 2nd night at 3:30 a.m. Security finally got them quieted down, and the front desk offered to comp our room or give us points to equal a nights stay, so we were satisfied.

everyoneShouldKnow: Since it is out of town, you must rely on hotel services / restaurants.
title: Average
comment: In Arizona there is competition. I feel that for a "resort" this should be well above the average hotel. Things like spa / fitness hours, wi-fi, good AC should be excellent, they were below par.

title: Mr. and Mrs. Gamble
comment: My husband and I were Celebrating our 5th Anniversary and as always we had a very Pleasant and Wonderful Experience during our 1-night stay. The Belvoir Suites Tampa Airport Westshore is always relaxing. The weddings are Beautiful and the atmosphere is inviting. The Customer Service is World Class.......

title: Nice Hotel
comment: Enjoyed Schula's 357 restaurant

everyoneShouldKnow: some subpar handling of basic services
title: current Aug. '12 stay
comment: NYC is a tough place to perfect customer service since there's so much going on, but the staff here is friendly enough. My main suggestion pertains to the TV service - it's one of the worst I've ever seen. There's no channel guide printed in the rooms and the GUIDE through the remote lags in its responsiveness. There are also channels mislabelled and many of them are presented as blown out SD filling a 16:9 set. Reception quality is poor.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel didnot think customer satisfaction is important for them
title: Staff in front office did not solve their own issue
comment: After I purchase /paid this hotel 1.5 month ago thru Priceline, I made a call to tis hotel to request for 2 double bed in room.

title: Nice Hotel, good staff
comment: Your hotel & staff are very good. Ronald in the club room was exceptional. Check-in was very slow. Lack of draw space in room. NO GIDEON BIBLES in the rooms. That will keep us from staying in a Belvoir again.

title: Great atrium lobby
comment: Rooms were clean, comfortable, and cool, and fan could be operated manually, a very important feature.

title: Need Free Wifi
comment: Charging for wifi in the rooms is so tacky. Also the hot tub needs to be repaired, the jets barely work.

title: Minor issues
comment: I rented 3 rooms all rooms had some sort of issue. One room the toliet would not flush all the way 2nd room the phone did not work 3rd room the closet would not open. They offered to switch one of the rooms to another but that would have put the person on a floor that was 10 flights down and full of screaming kids. FYI the elevators are SOOOOOOOOO slow expect to wait atleast 5-10 mins for the elevator

everyoneShouldKnow: The direct shuttle from Disneyland to the hotel was the safest and best idea.
title: This hotel was perfect for our needs
comment: We had never done 3 days at Disneyland before and needed a hotel for 2 nights for 2 families. Our rooms were adjacent, which made it very convenient. Most of all, we appreciate the hotel shuttle to and from Disneyland. We never waited more than 10 minutes for a shuttle. We felt safe letting the teenagers ride the shuttle late at night by themselves. The shuttle drivers were courteous and helpful with the strollers. We were very pleased with the overall experience. Thank you.

title: Home Again
comment: For the past 5+ years, we stay at this hotel as it meets all our needs and expectations.

title: A quiet night at a busy hotel
comment: Although there were two weddings and a high school reunion, check-in was acceptable and the room was much quieter than expected. We appreciated staying on the BPG floor.

everyoneShouldKnow: Hotel staff is very friendly and helpful.
title: Impressive
comment: I enjoyed my stay at the Sharaton Suites Galleria. The suites are cozy. Conceirge staff was helpful and offered suggestions of attractions and things to do nearby. The room was very clean and had almost every amenity needed to have a great stay. The only thing missing in the room was a microwave, being that there was a mini fridge. Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Houston.

title: Wedding One Night Stay Over
comment: The room was average and generally the room itself was clean, but the bathroom needed some work. The vent in the bathroom was filthy.

title: Fantastic Hotel!
comment: Beautiful hotel, excellent treatment for members, loved the room, location was incredible, staff was very friendly. The restaurant atmosphere and music was amazing... best omlet ever!

everyoneShouldKnow: Rooms are not guaranteed, even with your credit card payment.
title: Patrons Beware, You May Not Have a Room
comment: I did not realize hotels overbooked just like airlines. Now I do. Upon showing up to the hotel before check-in time we were told our room is not ready. No problem-we'll come back later, we said. Well, we go back later and guess what, now there are NO ROOMS! What?! The staff knew we would be back, as they were readying our room. Right?! The rest of our two athletic teams were checked in but we were offered a room at a much lesser hotel separated from the entire group. Nice! Upon refusing to allow this, they finally found us a room. 7 hour event.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff goes above & behind to assist you.
title: Beautiful Stay
comment: I was thoroughly impressed with this hotel. The tv in the living didnt work but the staff was very friendly! the hotel overall was beautiful i definitely have a new favorite hotel!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent service in a very nice setting.
title: Took care of me
comment: The front desk extended my stay when the airlines made it difficult for me to leave.

title: Warm Hospitality
comment: The Hotel has a great location by the Airport and is very easily approachable to all the major highways. The staff was very friendly and the Managers were very helpful. We were always treated with beaming smiles. My family had a great time during our 6 days of stay.

title: Staff is outstanding
comment: Hotel has fantastic connections with local restaurants and bars. Used concierge to get into famous deep dish Pizza restaurant with a group of eight and was able to bypass long line of hungry people waiting to get in. Great location, walking distance to almost everything famous in Chicago.

title: Well managed & run hotel
comment: We enjoyed our convention at this hotel. Staff was very responsive and helpful. Great facility!

title: Great hotel
comment: The hotel is faboulous for a visit to Disney.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff was very friendly and accomodating.
title: Charleston
comment: Nice hotel, although rooms could use an update. Staff was very friendly, pool was ok, but fitness center is in a huge need for repairs!! After trying every Elipitical and every treadmill, I could only get one to work effectively. Since it was my husband and I utilizing the facility, one of us had to use a treadmill with no sound for the TV. This made for a very boring run.

title: A Weekend at the Belvoir
comment: Everything about the Belvoir was excellent except for the lack of elevators. Staff was professional and accommodating but the wait for the elevators was between 15-20 minutes most times we used them. Staying on the 15th floor did not make it easy to use the stairs. Don't know how the hotel can solve the elevator problem but it is definitely a negative for the hotel. The lobby flowers were beautiful last w/e.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is close enough to everything but not too pricey.
title: The staff at this hotel are wonderful
comment: This Belvoir was extremely clean and staff was very pleasant and extremely helpful. The room was nice and clean and I loved the bathroom space. I would stay here anytime and recommend it to my friends.

title: Valet Services
