Keys became available immediately upon complaining to the conference coordinator who pushed the hotel  management to move. Bad, bad service and I just BET that the will end up charging my credit card for the $7 bottle of water I drank while withering away from dehydration while waiting for my room. Hotel food is AWFUL. (Great view of Navy Pier from my room, though.)

title: Overall Impression
comment: The hotel rooms were clean and bed and bathrooms well stocked. Staff was friendly.

title: Excellent Service
comment: This is a Top choice for anyone need a comfortable hotel with a friendly and professional staff. Highly Recommended

everyoneShouldKnow: If you have BPG gold status, be sure to insist on Club floor.
title: Mildew in the bathroom
comment: Not only was I given no recognition for Gold status, I was given a room with a shower covered in mildew. I was also told there was no BPG or Club floor when I checked in. The front desk staff was not friendly; no one made eye contact or made us feel welcome

everyoneShouldKnow: Older style hotel with small balconies
title: Nice staff, welcome small balcony
comment: I had a one night staff at this Belvoir and found the staff particularly nice. The property is an older one, but I enjoyed morning coffee on the small balcony.

title: Not a good stay this time
comment: NOrmally a good stay but this time there were substantial issues with billing as well as with the cleanliness of the room.

title: Just OK
comment: Car retrieval system was horrible

title: Very good place to stay in NY
comment: modern and clean hotel, very friendly staff, good location (15min Subway from Manhatten)

everyoneShouldKnow: It is very convenient and provides many comforts.
title: This hotel exceeded expectations.
comment: I was in Dallas to visit a sick relative at St. Paul's hospital. The accommodations and courteous staff made my visit tolerable. All of my questions were answered politely and quickly. I particularly liked the option of having the club floor, the wonderful breakfast made my life a whole lot easier during a very difficult time. Thank you.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great quality and value- you get alot for your money!
title: Great location, great service and amenties
comment: Friendly front desk staff, attractive and updated lobby and bar/restaurant area upon walking in. Room was clean, quiet (with the exception of airplanes flying overhead once in a while, but ear plugs were provided on night stand), bathroom was spacious w large counter space and convenient hanging laundry line over tub. Impressed with hot tub, pool and sauna area- had a great time swimming and relaxing. Food, drinks and service were great for both dinner and breakfast- attentive friendly staff and delicious selection of food/drink for both meals. Also, thank you for the USA Today paper the next morning! I would definitely come back here again if in the area- near the airport, easy to find with large signs to guide you, very close to freeways, shopping centers (ikea, marshalls etc). Will definitely recommend to others as well- thank you Belvoir Portland Airport Hotel for a great stay!

title: Stayed for a week..Awesome!
comment: We just stayed at the Belvoir New York July 23-28 2012. The hotel was perfectly situated and our newly renovated room located on the 50th floor was very comfortable coupled with an amazing view. We really enjoyed the club lounge which offered excellent service. The staff was very nice, courteous and went above and beyond to assist us with all of our travel plans. Big thanks to (Chelsea) the Manager for making our anniversary a memorable experience. G & L

everyoneShouldKnow: Housekeeping doesn't refresh the room, doesn't even make the bed unless you make a special request.
title: Great Location
comment: Beautiful views, easy access to Airport and major freeways, but located along bay.

title: Wow
comment: Service was phenomenal and accommodations were great. This was the kind of experience that you usually only can receive and a much pricier hotel, without any of the snooty factor.

title: Brooklyn 2012
comment: The hotel was great and my room was big and spacious.

title: A little dated
comment: Rooms are small and bathrooms are outdated. Just coming from hotels in China, this hotel was average. Best feature is its close proximity to LAX. Probably would stay at another hotel if I return to LAX in future. Staff was very friendly and met my needs.

everyoneShouldKnow: Bad Internet and doesn't care about it.
title: Great Looking, but needs improvement under the hood
comment: My family of 4 reserved a room for 9 days. The resort is easy to find and kept up in appearance. But internet is very important to my family and our rooms signal was weak and intermitten to a point of frustration. The room seemed clean, but had toenail clippings from previous guest on carpet.

title: Convenient
comment: Overall a good hotel with good room and convenient location. Front desk was understaffed at my arrival. Hallways good smell a bit fresher. Stay was short so don't have many comments.

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel sports bar offers free games such as wii, karoke, and shooting pool.
title: Always stay at this hotel but....
comment: When I travel to Dallas, my first choice is this hotel. I have stayed here on numerous occasion. However, this trip was a little disappointing. My executive suite a/c was working properly, toilet handle broke, and food was found on the floor. Due to the a/c working off and on, I contacted a cold...:-( Needlesstosay, I would still choose this hotel again.

title: Not the best for the money spent
comment: The highlight of this hotel was the friendly and capable staff. From reception to parking, the staff was absolutely the best. Unfortunately I had a corner room which was a bit small for my taste. Paying extra for a microwave/microfridge seemed a bit discouraging. Overall, the room was fine, but not impressive.

title: Plesant experience
comment: Considering it was summer and extremely hot our stay was very pleasant. The cost of our stay at summer rates was very good.

everyoneShouldKnow: The personal service in the Club room is exceptional. Muhammed remembered us from past visits. He is a gem for Belvoir, a true PR representative of the company!
title: A regular at this hotel!
comment: My 20- and 22-yr-old daughters and I have stayed at the Belvoir Towers every visit we have made to NYC over the past 12 years or so! This hotel is centrally located to Times Square to the south and Central Park to the north, with an E line subway stop steps away from the door. I HIGHLY recommend the Belvoir Towers.

title: Exceeded expectations
comment: It had been a few years since we last vistited. We are so glad we were able to stay at the Belvoir. The stay was excellent.

title: Disappointing
comment: I paid for the club floor, called the hotel to ensure that I would be on the actual floor with the club- as a woman traveling alone I prefer the amenities afforded on the floor as opposed to sitting in a restaurant or bar alone. When I arrived I was one floor down and the front desk simply shrugged and said sorry. When I explained that I had called ahead to be sure that my reservation was correct- he shrugged again. No attempt was made to rectify the situation. It was clear he did not care and was not going to honor the agreement I had with the hotel. The hotel rate was equally as expensive and no adjustment was made.

everyoneShouldKnow: The proximity to campus and downtown is great.
title: This hotel has great features
comment: This hotel is located in a wonderful area, close to campus and the downtown. The Club Lounge amenities were great; the staff was exceptional. The cleanliness and ambience far exceeded our expectations. We look forward to coming back soon.

title: Burlington
comment: Very nice hotel, great staff. Rooms seem a bit 'tired' and in need of a freshening.

everyoneShouldKnow: WORSE HOTEL, NOSEY, BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE
title: Worse BPG Hotel I been in
comment: This is worse BPG Hotel i been, you should pay extra to use the club room, . the first room they give me was so small which I thought I am going to closet.Sec. room i had was next to highway, it will be hard to sleep here and have little bit peace and they told be most of room will be like that. Worse Hotel I been in EVER by today

title: Courteous staff and excellent service
comment: I stay here a lot when I travel to LA because it's a great location to places I like to visit. The Rooms are very comfortable and clean and especially noted the staff who went out of their way to make people comfortable. The breakfast service at the Club level was very good despite the unmanageable crowds.

title: Excellent Location, options and facilities
comment: The Belvoir Sand Key Resort is ideally located just outside the hubbub of Clearwater centre, yet in simple striking distance. Their own facilities (pool, service, equipment, hires and staff attentiveness) on their own brilliant beach mean that little else is needed. Relax, kick back, enjoy. Good selection of restaurants and very comfortable rooms, suitably equipped for the beach holiday life. We enjoyed it immensely and would highly recommend for families and couples.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is beyond wonderful and even though there are a lot of guest to be called by name when they see you is awesome!!
title: My stay
comment: My husband and I stayed the weekend for our anniversary. Misty B. and Desiree were beyond wonderful and helpful. When they found out it was our anniversary they went above and beyond to make our stay perfect.

everyoneShouldKnow: Easy access to Disney, pleasant views of area.
title: Perfect spot to see all that Disney World has to offer!
comment: Our room was wonderful, convenient transportation to and from parks via bus or water taxi right into Epcot World Showcase! We were able to see all of Magic Kingdom and Epcot and enjoy the amazing pool and facilities at the hotel. Beds were fabulous and the service we received from everyone was great! The only complaint is that we did not receive the bottles of water in our room as promised, we had to go to the concierge desk in the lobby to pick them up ourselves.

title: My room was comfortable.
comment: I liked the room that I stayed in. The Conceirge and the Valet were both very nice and very helpful. The lady that assisted me with my checkout was not very friendly and just did not seem to care that it was my first time in the hotel and that I was unfamiliar with the area.

title: Nice stay but with a few glitches
comment: The room was great but there was no working ice machine on our floor. We called and was told by the front desk attendant to call and they would be happy to bring it to us. When we called back a not to happy front desk attendant wanted to know who had told us that. Our room was cleaned but no clean towels were left. It took an hour for housekeeping to bring them. The hotel knew a conference was checking out on Thursday yet they only had 4 people working the checkout desk. Long lines that moved very slowly. Conference rooms were frigid first three days.

title: Fine if you are okay with not having your room cleaned.
comment: I was appauled that after coming to the hotel, my room was not cleaned. I had to repeatedly call the manager in order for my room to be cleaned which is not acceptable at all. I will not stay at this hotel again. After I repeatedly complained, the issue was finally rectified, but it never should have went to that level.

title: Needs an update
comment: This hotel could use an update. The rooms are a little rundown and outdated (SD TV and worn carpet). Limited food options in the restaurant for lunch and dinner. Service was excellent though.

title: mine
comment: check in is very slow, ridiculously slow. 6 people behind the desk with one person doing work

title: first time in the city
comment: this hotel was below my expectations. I stayed at othe Belvoirs before so i was assuming they would have the same quality of service. the lobby had a funny smell too it . the bathroom was small and the toilet was in an akward place. the major issue was that the hotel caused a mix up in my bank that resulted in a negative balanace to my account. the wi-fi was only offered in the lobby. not woth the price

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location and they are pet frienfly
title: Family stayed four nights in two rooms
comment: Enjoyed everyday , the staff made our complete stay a great one..

everyoneShouldKnow: Twice I have had problems with this chain. The first was resolved by the manager fast and efficient. The second didn't even ask about my stay.
title: Sorry this one seem to have issues with my skin color.
comment: The hotel was OK and most of the staff excellent. Their were a few staff members that had some serious issues. They where rude and disrespectful. I do not pay my money to be treated this way. I feel sorry for the majority of the staff was excellent but for what we pay to stay there I don't expect or appreciate the disrespect I received.

title: Improvements
comment: I stay at this hotel weekly and am in the service industry so I feel the need to mention what I see.

title: AWESOME
comment: THIS IS MY FIRST TIME STAYING AT THIS HOTEL. IT'S EXCELLENT IN EVERY AREA. I STAYED ONE NIGHT WITH MY FAMILY AND WE HAD A GREAT TIME.

title: This hotel sucks
comment: dont choose this hotel, nothing is good about it.

title: Super Comfortable Beds & Great Service
comment: We loved sleeping in their super comfy queen size beds with down comforters and pillows. There was a generous amount of bedding and it was so easy to relax and go to sleep fast after a long day at Disneyland. The shuttle bus to Disneyland was very convenient. It left every half hour and took about 5 minutes to get dropped off at the front of the park. During the busy times they ran an extra shuttle to make sure everyone got transferred on time. There was only refrigerator in the bedroom, but the microwave in the deli was available to use from early morning to late evening. This hotel is very nice and comfortable.

everyoneShouldKnow: Impressive mini apt very well maintained. Sumptuous bedding. Kitchen had every appliance we needed.
title: Very well maintained
comment: Stayed here last minute and wished we had booked more time. One bedroom unit with full kitchen, laundry and balcony-screened. Very friendly staff both at the front desk and on the grounds. Would absolutely stay here again. Close to the Parks. Easy to get oriented to the area.

everyoneShouldKnow: They really try to make your stay a memorable one.
title: This hotel has a great pool and a great staff!
comment: We had a great time, and we loved the hotel and staff. Everything that we needed was right there for us. We will stay here again!

title: very comfortable room
comment: Great beds, friendly staff

everyoneShouldKnow: Centrally located to all points of interest within the Los Angeles area.
title: Not so easily impressed
comment: I would like the hotel management to know that for 35 years I have checked into some of the finest 5 and 4 star hotels and have easily become accustomed to the best of guest services. I just have to say that I was completely taken aback by your staff there at the Belvoir Universal. From the moment I drove up to the moment I was checked in by Ms. Emenike. They were truly superb and this is coming from someone that has now become tainted and jaded when it comes to guest services. I am so very glad to have taken a few days to reminisce about the 25 years my family and I vacationed there at your hotel. I now have one more wonderful memory to add to it! I truly wish to thank the entire staff there at the Belvoir Universal and cannot wait to visit in the very near future. Thank you so very much to you all!

title: Excellent quality and service
comment: My husband and I stayed at the Swan and Dolphin for a conference and were very apprehensive of staying in a Disney resort as we thought it would be geared towards small children. We were however very surprised and pleased to see that the hotel and restaurants catered for all groups. The quality of the centre and service provided was excellent. Great choice of restaurants, a wonderful pool and easy walk (or boat trip) to the Boardwalk.

everyoneShouldKnow: Remote location but they charged for parking and at a very high rate.
title: Cleanliness Issue.
comment: Staff was coordial but not warm or very concerned when cleanliness of lined and towels were brought to their attention. Towels and bedsheets had stains that were very visible.

title: this hotel centrally located
comment: Disney's Dolphin hotel is centrally located near Epcot and MGM, but ideally next to the Boardwalk. Lovely restaurants of its own also. Offers discount to nurses as well which is nice.

title: only issue
comment: My only complaint is I know when I check in and the front desk always indicates that I am to have my bill emailed to me. It does not happen.

everyoneShouldKnow: Furniture is old and needs updating
title: Needs updating
comment: Hotel is clean however the furniture is in some serious need of attention. Couches and chairs have frayed upholstery, carpets are worn and the whole hotel has a musty odor. Not what I would have expected from a Belvoir.

title: Hotel is adequate
comment: The hotel is ok. Nothing I would rave about. The cold water in the sleeping area did not work - I reported it; a repairman looked at it, but it was never fixed.

title: Superb Service
comment: This is the second time I've stayed in this hotel. The service and amenities were as wonderful as the first experience. The staff members are all friendly and go out of their way to help their guests. I would highly recommend staying here and experiencing the wonderful service.

title: Best beach hotel!
comment: Went here to relax and hang out on the beach. This hotel was great! We arrived at 8am and our room was ready and exactly what I had requested. When I checked out they even offered to hold our luggage and advised they could provide a place to change and shower if we wanted to spend the day at the beach ... how nice! PS - you have to rent a cabanna at the beach - it was great!

title: Professional, nice hotel!
comment: The hotel stay in was great! I am a single mother traveling with an 8 year old - so I wanted to have a safe environment to be able to tour and be and in and out at different hours. The lobby internet was nice and access to the business center free of charge was great!

title: Very accomodating
comment: The hotel staff were great when we requested a late check out.

title: The view is exceptional
comment: This is one of my favourite hotels in the world. The nautical room style is beautiful, the bathroom is big and spotless, the view is amazing.

title: Renovations are great
comment: I love this hotel for many reasons. Location, service, convenience and comfort. The Belvoir Lake Buena Vista is in a perfect location not only for the theme parks but it is within walking distance to dozens of great restaurants. I will definitely stay again.

title: Need More than 5 Stars for the Staff
comment: This continues to be an outstnading establishment. If I could give 10 stars instead of 5 for the staff, I would do it. Everyone is always friendly and wants to exceed anyone's expectations.

title: Need Improvement
comment: I nornally always stay at the Belvoir on Canal street because of the hotel, staff and the location. This visit actually ruined my vacation. If you are remodeling, pleae inform guest prior to arrival. To wake of 4 days of your vacation to banging every morning is not ideal. When I called the front desk to ask them could they have them start after 8am at least, no apology was offered just a flat NO! The accomodations really ruined a

title: This hotel was good not great
comment: The room was a very nice size. The bathroom has two sections but one light control both rooms, only had one place to hang towel and it was in the shower no place to hang towel by the sink. No safe and microwave in room.

title: Not pleaseant stay
comment: Room next to elevator

title: Rusty's Restuarant
comment: Thursday evening we had dinner at Rusty's in the hotel. The Buffet was EXCELLENT! My family was so impressed with the quality and variety of food that was offered. All of the food looked as beautiful as it tasted. The Alaskan Cod was amazing. Thank you for a wonderful evening and great vacation.

title: Great hotel--all features
comment: All of the hotel front desk, tour, bell hop and consigerge services were outstanding!!

title: This hotel has operational problems
comment: I checked into my room and the room was not cleaned from the previous guest but was I checked in to another room promptly. Spoke to another guest who had to leave his room as well.

title: very nice
comment: The hotel is great; and the staff are very nice.

title: Hot Hotel
comment: Hotel needs to improve conditions. Hot too hot in general areas. It seem cost savings should be sought in other areas.

everyoneShouldKnow: Do not let them put you on the opposite side of the building from the elevator.
title: new exercise plan
comment: If you are into exercise, stay at the Belvoir as you will log over a mile just getting to your room. Elevators are scarce and far away from your room. You also might feel like a rat in a maze trying to decide if one way is shorter than the other. Oh, and don't expect to have a glass of wine in the bar while you wait to be seated and expect to take it in with you to dinner. The two are rivals.

everyoneShouldKnow: Make sure your sheets look and smell clean before you climb in to bed!!
title: Would not stay again!
comment: We live in the Kansas City area and decided on the Belvoir for our "staycation." We didn't get back to our room until around 10:00 p.m. We had two double beds, the one I slept in just had a strange smell. After a couple of hours, I pulled back the sheets and saw grease stains and two small "black dot" stains. I got up and slept with my Husband and Daughter in (the very small) full bed.

everyoneShouldKnow: As an BPG member, I waited in line a little longer than I thought I would.
title: Conference Hotel
comment: This was a great place for a conference. I hope we stay here again.

title: Great Stay
comment: This was my first visit to this hotel and it was very comfortable. The breakfast bar was great, room was clean and staff was helpful. I did not have the opportunity to visit the pool, spa or fitness center.

title: Good location and staff
comment: The Columbia property sits on a lake and is within walking distance to restaurants and a public area where there was live music playing. The outdoor pool overlooks the lake and a wooded area. BPG members received complimentary internet. The staff was overall very helpful -- especially a bartender named Pinar.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location and the property is well maintained
title: Front desk
comment: All working the front desk were excellent ,answered all questions in a professional manner.Juan ,the manager,was better than excellent

title: Best hotel in Syracuse
comment: After staying in several hotels in Syracuse NY, I can say that the Belvoir was the best in all regards. Everything from parking to cleanleness to comfort.

title: Time to look at renovations
comment: We upgraded to a suite which was less than desirable. Furniture/carpet had stains and tears. The sinks were clogged and didn't function properly. Overall very unclean. Pool was very large.

title: This hotel was very good
comment: Only one issue. When we arrived we were giving our room. My husband was going for an operation that day at Tampa General. He helped me bring my bags up to the room and when we opened the door there was a man still in the room. He was screaming at us. We tried to explain that the front desk told us i was open and gave us the key. We went back down with all my bags and told the front desk. The lady was nice. She held my bags so I could get my husband to the hospital. When I arrived that night my room was ready.

everyoneShouldKnow: Quality control and service are lacking
title: Unavailable Room at Check-in
comment: I booked two rooms at the Belvoir New York hotel through our corporate travel agency. Upon arrival at roughly 10:00 PM both my colleague and I learned that there were no rooms available for us to check in and that we could expect a 2 hour wait. As a business traveller, I find this unacceptable.

title: Dirty and run down
comment: This hotel used to be nice - but it was plan out gross. Ripped couch, dirty bathrooms - had to check out and go to another hotel.

title: Sheets
comment: The staff was friendly, however when I requested more towels, I never received the them. I had to stop the housekeeping attendant and ask for extra towels. The sheets on the bed had stains on them. I was kind of shock because this hotel seemed very nice on the outside. Mt skin wa svery itchy when sleeping on the sheets.

title: Hotel registration was quick
comment: Attended the CTAT conference. Hotel Check in was very organized and quick.

title: business manager
comment: the room would not get cool and the restroom was not as clean as it should have been (hair, etc).

title: Great features including lovely rooms with spectacular views
comment: I was on a Grandbourne preferred room - view of marina and lake were amazing and so was lightning storm from the 27th floor!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location on 16th St. mall and close to downtown destinations
title: Belvoir Denver Downtown
comment: Great location, excellent conference facilities, elevators in Tower BLDG slow,room in Tower BLDG needed work ...strange layout-large room small Bathroom needed work... non-functional sink drain stopper, toilet leaked from back & H2O pooled on floor/ never noticed by hotel staff in 4 days, non-functional remotes, bad fitting door, light switch/furniture placement in odd areas, no closet doors...Great beds & pillows, towels!

title: Lobby was beautiful
comment: The rooms did not reflect the lobby. The hallways and room had a foul odor. There was a huge roach in our room. The pool was broken/closed and we were very disappointed as this was important to us. We ended up only staying one night and switched hotels.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff is not welcoming and at times can be rude.
title: Front Desk Staff Under Qualified
comment: The front desk staff and management were unconcerned with efficiency and process. Their attitude was one of customer dismissal, and their demeanor was not welcoming. As an BPG flagship my expectation for the Belvoir NY Hotel and Towers would be one of customer service excellence not the substandard mediocrity their staff regularly provides.

title: Very nice hotel with great service
comment: Enjoyed stay. Great customer service.

title: issues
comment: The hotel was under construction, I feel I should have been warned about this and wasn't. I was meeting friends at the restaurant I haven't seen for years and was embarassed about the construction. There needed to be more signs on how to get places, front desk, valet, etc. I would actually get lost walking around and felt stupid asking guests how to get places. It was the most confusing hotel I have ever stayed at. The rooms were just OK. I love having a coffee maker in the room, but made my coffee in the morning and it only had 2 little creamers, NO sugar, and NO stirrers, I had to stir my coffee with a pen. If you are going to have a coffee pot in the room make sure it is stocked. I wasn't dare going to walk and get some cream and sugar i was afraid I would get lost. All of these factors I could have handled. Actually, the bed felt fantastic and I think I had the best sleep I have had in a hotel. BUT when pulling up the covers in the morning I was shocked to find what was on the sheets. I will not mention here because I don't want to embaras. I work hard for my money and this was a special trip. I do not feel it was worth my money. Sorry. Shawn, I believe he is a maintanance worker was very nice and helpful.

title: Unsatisfactory Room
comment: The hotel was beautiful and I enjoyed the amenities and location. However, my room was highly unsatisfactory. I had two main issues. The first, there was an awful humming noise coming from the hallway (I stayed on the 25th floor BPG floor). This noise would cut on and off every 10 seconds. I might have slept for 3 hours due to this. This noise prevented me from enjoying my room and I wanted out of there as fast as possible. Second, I could not get internet in my room. I was willing to pay for it. But I was on the phone with hotel tech support for over an hour. Their only suggestion to me was to go use the internet in the main lobby. I was unable to work from my room my entire stay.

title: Great staff, immaculately clean, perfect location
comment: I stayed at this property before a long drive so I knew I wanted to find a place with convenient access to the highway, comfortable beds and immaculately clean rooms for an affordable price. This property exceeded my expectations in all of those categories.

title: Dirty Floors
comment: No Wash clothes or hand towels on day two. The carpets were so dirty my white socks were brown after walking on them for a few hours. White sock lint was still on the carpet for two days.

title: Hotel had features we wanted
comment: This hotel and resort fit the type of 4 day vacation we really wanted. The room was large, comfortable and had stellar view of the marina from its wide balcony. The service in the dining room and bar was impeccable. The shuttle service between the two hotels was good with one exception. We asked if the shuttle would take us a short distance to a nearby restaurant, (my husband uses a walker) We were told the shuttle doesn't go in that direction and take a cab. The cab driver was unhappy as it wasn't a long drive, but he did take us. After dinner we waited 45 minutes for a cab. In the meantime the Hilton shuttle picked up several guests to take them back to their hotel. Unfortunately this experience put a blemish on what would have been a perfect stay. We hope you will reconsider your policy that would provide a much appreciative service to your BPG guests.

title: JACK 478
comment: GREAT LOCATION FOR PEOPLE GOING TO DISNEY, GREAT POOL FOR KIDS AND ADULTS. HAVE STAYED ABOUT SIX TIMES AND ALWAYS SATISFIED.

title: "will go back and recommend to friends"
comment: staff were all nice and helpful. property was convenient and room was clean. will definitely go back.

title: Needs much staff improvements
comment: Tried to check in at 1pm. Told as a Gold Member we would have a suite in 30 minutes. Waited 2 hours for a room that was a basis room. Lunch took over 1 1/2 hours due to lack of staff.The pool area had mostly chairs and only 2 lounge chairs. Had to go into the hotel to request more pool towels.As a Gold member was supposed to receive a gift. On check out at 11am when I mention I had not received a gift, i was asked if i would like a drink.

title: Nightmare in St. Louis
comment: The place needs a complete make over. The people working there don't really understand the BPG way. I had to wait 10 minutes to check it since they only had one person working there at that was at 7 PM not in the middle of the night. The fellow offered me my gift but never bothered to have it sent up to the room. When I called down 3 hours later, he acted like I made the mistake. Further the club room was the WORST club room I have ever seen. The quality of the food was similar to a public school canteen. In the morning when I went there, the coffee machine was in need of service so I brought it to the attention of the morning attendant who was only concerned with my not having shoes on. He let me know, and everyone in the room (which was packed with families) that I was in violation of the health code which would get him shut down. As I was leaving the room he did his level best to share loudly that I could come back once I put shoes on or even some flip flops as thought I didn't understand what shoes or foot covering might be.

title: Friendly and helpul
comment: Had several times to go to ask front desk for help (band aids and directions) and they were very helpful. Hotel was clean, open and good food. Close to good food and shopping if needed.

title: Great hotel and staff
comment: Probably the best experience I have had in a hotel. The customer service was outstanding.

title: Great stay for conference
comment: Accommodations and staff very pleasant. Eat out of the hotel. Food not so good.

everyoneShouldKnow: If traveling with an elder, it's best to drop them at the lobby before heading to the parking lot, or have the valet park your car.
title: Club Floor lounge was the best!
comment: We often enjoy staying on the Club Floor for the additional amenities. The staff was truly hospitable and the ample food selection was fresh and nicely prepared. The hotel is a close drive to downtown and Little Five Points. The air conditioner was quiet, which is a plus!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location right across the street from train.
title: Good, not great.
comment: This is my second time staying at this Belvoir. The rooms are super spacious and offer plenty of ammenities to keep me satisfied. Gym is phenomenal, great room service, friendly staff...

title: Great view from every room!
comment: Marina view or city view is beautiful!

everyoneShouldKnow: Samll enough and big enough - charming
title: College Visit
comment: Great work out room! Clean everything you could need. Great breakfast buffet with fresh fruit and made to order omeletes and great location. Especially liked the big red sign atop the hotel that always made it easy to find our way home.

title: Stellar!
comment: I stayed at the Belvoir for a conference and was very impressed with this hotel. Great location in downtown Chisago, close to great shopping and attractions. Beautiful spot along the river for a walk when you need a short break from the conference. The staff was incredibly professional every time they spoke to me.

title: Great hotel!
comment: Had a great time. Very nice and comfortable. Really enjoyed the continental breakfast. Staff was very friendly and helpful! Will definitely stay here again!

everyoneShouldKnow: The rooms and bed are clean and comfortable.
title: Belvoir Indianapolis Downtown
comment: A wonderful experience. the hotel was very clean. The beds were cozy and comfortable. The staff is very friendly and helpful. A few features that added to the stay is Starbucks in the lobby and in the room. I also dined in the hotel restaurant. The meal was outstanding and comparably priced to the area. I really like the Green card perk too.

everyoneShouldKnow: Try to get a high floor to rise above the noise of busy Canal Street in front of the hotel.
title: Overall A Pleasant Stay
comment: This hotel is well- appointed and well maintained, and the staff is generally friendly and helpful. I received all the Gold perks including upgrade, internet and late checkout. Being able to print from internet computers in the lobby for free was a nice perk as well. The hotel is located close to two different subway lines, making it easy to get Uptown for shopping and shows.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great pool area and accommodating staff
title: Belvoir Gateway LAX Hotel
comment: Location was ideal, near airport and major roadways. Staff was attentive (shower drain was clogged when we arrived and they fixed it promptly), housekeeping staff was very pleasant and helpful. Walls are paper thin, particularly between adjoining rooms and there is no sound barrier on bottom of adjoining door. Our neighbors were quite loud and it was a problem. Lots of hallway noise also. Bathrooms need updating, shower was very weak. Room was small, but nicely furnished and beds were nice. Gift shop terribly expensive for even the smallest things (like stamps). Pool area and deck chairs were great. Jacuzzi is tiny but great for a party of 2. Onsite food/drink too expensive. Parking behind hotel was a pain and dangerous for women.

title: Great experience
comment: Hotel was nice & comfortable. Great location. Overall great experience. Would stay here again.

title: Awesome week!
comment: We stayed here for a dance competition and the whole week was wonderful. Everything met my expectations and the room was great. Comfortable and clean!

title: Consistently good!
comment: Have stayed at the Belvoir Gateway a number of times and it consistently meets or exceeds expectations. It's always a pleasant stay!

title: Worse staff, features and room cleanliness
comment: This was the worse hotel I have ever stayed at, it doesn't deserve a 4 star rating! At first, I chose this hotel to stay at because they informed me that their indoor pool is open until 11 pm on saturday, but when we got there they told me it's close. The staff at front desk told me that it will be open the next day at 8 am, we woke up early just to be told that it will not open until 10 pm! The room's trash wasn't emptied and I have to call for a new toilet paper. This hotel took $50 from my account without even notifying me! The staff is very incompetent. The restroom in the fitness center is very nasty, it has feces marks all over the toilet seat. This is the worse hotel ever!

title: Good stay, but expected more from club level room
comment: Overall, my conference stay was fine. The staff were friendly and accommodating, the lobby and dining options were nice and the meeting rooms were comfortable. The location was great as well.

everyoneShouldKnow: Do not stay there if you have to check in or out using the front desk registration staff and system!
title: Disasterous Checkin
comment: Our group of 90 guests arrived at the scheduled time on Sunday afternoon. The hotel registration staff was ill-prepared. The two clerks at the front desk were unable to process the guests. More guests, not affiated with our convention, kept arriving as well, futher congesting the lobby and creating havoc. This convention was scheduled months ago, if not years. The staff should have had a system in place to expedite the checkin of the 1500+ guests. The last member in our group received her room at 9PM, 5.5 hours after we arrived at the hotel. The Registration desk is a nightmare!

title: the best employees
comment: bascome,pacheco,mcnair,prez,smith,hudson employees were gracious,professional. they made the stay a joy. the location cannot be beat.

title: This hotel is excellent in every way.
comment: Our recent stay was very pleasant due to the cordial staff, excellent facilities, and very clean and beautiful rooms.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location. Bad service and smell. Dated.
title: Great loaction, Not so good otherwise.
comment: Location was absolutely perfect. However, the hotel had a strange smell, was dated and maid service did not clean my room during my two night stay. No water pressure. Parking is outrageously expensive. It did appear to have a great indoor pool. I did not have the opportunity to enjoy.

title: Great facility for business travelers and meetings.
comment: Amazing meeting space, fantastic food, friendly staff (especially Benny in Banquets)!

title: Very comfortable stay
comment: The hotel was really nice. The bed was very comfortable. Didn't notice the closet till right before we left. No robe. No fridge. The tv remote poorly worked. Otherwise, a perfect stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: Multiple buildings, beachfront may not be the best view--harbor side is great too.
title: repeat stay
comment: Stayed here 4 nights nov 2011 after a cruise. Found it to be a good place. Clean, convenient location, Got a little familiar with the layout of Ft Lauderdale. This year we are staying 5 nights, and to make the most of our time there I have been in touch with concierge James who has been giving me ideas on where to go and what to do before we arrive again after our cruise. So thank you James.

title: Noise problems
comment: This is a lovely hotel with outstanding staff but the sound insulation is very poor. The first night of our visit was fine but the second, sleep was impossible due to noisy above and next door neighbors. Security dealt with the first and I with the second but it ruined a great stay

everyoneShouldKnow: Do not expect to accomplish any work requiring internet access unless you have your own mobile device and are tethering.
title: Great people; poor execution
comment: The restaurant staff at the hotel is the only reason I have revisited this property. Candidly, as a business traveler, the property's lack of investment in a usable internet (even for a price) was a huge issue. Not being able to access the internet costs my firm business as we typically work from the hotel logging into client sites. They only compound the problem at this property by charging for the internet. It is ridiculous. Either A) charge for the internet but provide great internet service or B) don't charge for the internet but provide great internet service. It is a common business standard and I have never had an issue at an BPG property previously.

everyoneShouldKnow: Expect large crowds and a busy atmosphere
title: Very Pleasant Stay
comment: Very nice accommodations. Rooms were nicely appointed and up to date. Pool was nice and clean. However, did not like having to pay a daily parking fee. We would definitely recommend staying here.

everyoneShouldKnow: You have to walk through a gauntlet of less than desirable street people on your way from the hotel to the ball park
title: one of my worst experiences
comment: We left our room immediately after check-in for the ballgame. When we returned, the room temp was 80 degrees--AC not generating cool air. After repacking all of our things, we were directed to a different room; someone was already occupying the room. Now we are standing in the hall way with a bewildered look on our face--orphaned from both rooms. Through the help of your maintenance man (Rodney) we were dircted to a third room (on another floor), and then finally, back to the second room--all of this late in the evening. Not a good day.

title: 5th time the worst time
comment: Have been to this hotel 4 times before and always loved it... This time not so much.. was the 12th hotel on a 12 day trip.. I stay at over 100 hotels a year and this was supposed to be the easiest stay. Booked a 2 bedroom suite with a balcony and river view. Had never had the balcony before just a river view and was traveling with others so looked forward to a 2 bedroom suite. FIRST the 2 bedroom suites here only have 1 full bath between the 2 of them. Next upon arrival was given room keys and went to room..ok 5th floor thought all balcony rooms on lower but ok. We go into the room...large sitting room.. and 15 steps up to the bedrooms.. ok heave luggage after 12 days how are we going to get bags up there?? Go upstairs first room king bed has view of parking lot? second room has a peaked roof shutters that are screwed shut and if I open their blinds I see the roof??. I go downstairs and ask why I don't get the room I was confirmed for??... oh the people that were in it decided to stay another night and we are full booked so we upgraded you... How is this an upgrade?? I have no view, no balcony and I could never get my luggage up all those stairs..oh sorry thats all we have I can give you some BPG points and $100 off... at this point fine I'm really tired...even more tired after I didn't sleep..on the top of the hotel you hear the trains!!! a lot!!! and didn't think about it but I purposely booked a room without a kitchenette because they make me nervous (had hotels with cockroaches) - sorry you didn't enjoy your stay but it was an upgrade I can't offer you any more --- needless to say I WILL NEVER BE BACK - property and cleanliness of rooms is also way below par for a Belvoir since last time I was here...all leaves on property guaranteed are from winter and this is July...and if you want to keep your meal in your stomach don't look at the corners or in the vents by the windows in the restaurant I think the dust has been collecting since they opened.>!

title: Instructions for Individual Occupants Billing
comment: While on the phone prior to arriving for our stay, I requested that each occupant should receive a separate bill instead of one bill for all. After being assured that this would be done, we were presented with a bill whose total was addressed to only one of the occupants. We successfully corrected this error, but only after asking to speak to a manager. The desk emplyees insisted that they were never instructed on how to individualize a bill, that is to make the change that we were requesting. THe manager was most courteous and totally helpful.

title: Good value
comment: I chose this hotel for it's location.Rooms are confortable,although sofa bed in one ocassion had worn down matress and staff said "that's the way they are".

title: Poor House Keeping
comment: I have been staying at this hotel for over 12 years now and unfortunately my stay each time seems to get worse. This time it was housekeeping, they did a poor job, the tub was never cleaned, the shampoo, conditioner etc...was not replenished. The towel mat was missing. All this happened, after I mentioned it to the housekeeping manager. I can't stay here any longer after putting up with it for so many years. I'll take my business to another Belvoir or hotel all together.

everyoneShouldKnow: Amy in room service should not be preaching her religious belilefs to guests
title: BPG Gold - what's the point?
comment: I have been an BPG Gold member for 15 years and this is the ONLY hotel that the only "benefit" is 24hours of free internet. At Grandbourne properties around the world I've received room upgrades, breakfast, at least a "thank you" for making it to Gold. And at this hotel? A big fat NOTHING. Oh, and as an aside, there WERE club level rooms available so it wasn't that. Other than that, it's in pretty decent shape for an older hotel, great view of the lake from the higher floors lakeside.

title: Great Location
comment: I loved the hotel. The room views were great, the staff was helpful and accomodating, hotel in a great location with lots of services nearby. I was not happy that some of the bell staff was not very knowledgeable and the room cleanliness was not what I expected for a Belvoir.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location, noisy at all hours because of cheap, thin walls.
title: Walls are way too thin
comment: I enjoyed my stay at your hotel but the walls were extremely thin. I could hear the people next door having a normal conversation, the crinkiling of plastic ( I assume they balled it up to throw it away), and the movement of the hangars in their closet when they went for their wardrobe.I cold hear people in the hallway at all hours as well. This to me is pretty inexcusable. I understand hearing noisy neighbors who are rowdy and drunk, but this was normal noise that I could hear as if they were in my room with me! I also requested an ocean view upgrade, which was granted (partially). We were on the fourth floor and could hear everything going on in the pool, so I requested another room, which they couldnt accomodate. That was fine as the pool noise wasn't so bad but the club music going on til about 1 in the morning Saturday night was pretty dissapointing as well, especially because I had already requested to be higher up to avoid this but could not be accomodated. I believe that your hotel is nice, but if you want us to be "wowed" by something other than the lobby, invest in some non-connected rooms with thicker walls so that other guests can enjoy their privacy and sleep when their neighbors are conversating, packing, or even changing clothes. A walled bathroom would be nice too.

everyoneShouldKnow: How to make your room cool so you can sleep!
title: Couldnt sleep
comment: First nite music outside played loud& late.

title: Hidden fees
comment: When I looked online it made it seem like everything was included. I had to pay extra for a microwave in my room and parking. It really wasn't worth it. It was small and cramped. The best thing about the room was not being in it, but being in the pool.

title: Appreciation and feedback
comment: We appreciated your great location and the dedication of your staff. Diana in the bar was particularly helpful.

title: convenient to the airport
comment: a renovation would be great; the carpet and walls tell the age. the room was very warm when I checked in; it improved. the flat screen is very nice; additional outlets would be helpful for the business traveler with multiple devices.

everyoneShouldKnow: Its far from the south side of the island where most of the excursions will take place.
title: Very clean
comment: Great pools and spa. Room was clean, fresh and bed was wonderful. Sound proofing walls were a plus. The hotel restaurant menu was very limited and not many options for a large family.

title: Needs improvement
comment: Hotel lobby and bar area are nice, room was comfortable, but stains on carpet. Bed was very comfortable. Price does not match the rooms.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good value, nice atrium and location.
title: One Critical Flaw Mars Good Tampa Airport Hotel Value
comment: I live one hour north of Tampa and this hotel is one of several in Tampa that I use when I visit for meetings, concerts and flights. Over the years, I have stayed at the Belvoir Suites Tampa Airport more than 20 times and am therefore quite familiar with this hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: I have had several good experiences here in the past, but unfortunately the service was well below par this time around.
title: Average
comment: I stayed here for three nights during the Florida Bar exam. While the staff was pleasant, my bathroom was really gross. The bathtub drain was so clogged that by the end of a 5-minute shower, you were wading in 6 inches of filthy, scummy water. We contacted maintenance, but it was never addressed. We arrived home after the test to find that the safety latch on our door somehow closed, so we couldn't get in. The maintenance man came immediately, but it was a little disconcerting to see him literally break down the door to get into our room. Housekeeping staff seemed to congregate outside of our room, which was at the very end of the hallway. They were so unbelievably loud that I had to wear earphones and use a white noise app on my phone just to study. They also failed to replace hand towels and a bathmat. Finally, on the first night we ordered room service. We ordered a club sandwich, but the server brought a Caesar salad, then looked at me incredulously when I told him the order was incorrect. He finally brought the sandwich, but the order was still wrong. We asked for no mayo, but it was slathered in mayo and it came with fruit instead of fries. I caught the server in the hallway and let him know it was still incorrect but he never returned with the correct order. Since we had to be up at the crack of dawn for the most important test of our lives, we gave up and went to bed.

title: This hotel has great location for vacation
comment: Very convenience go to restaurant & shopping center. Nice hotel, comfortable bed, high speed internet. The mostly we like you could walking down the way can found some small restaurant overthere, not

title: Not bad for the price.
comment: The hotel is shaped like a castle, which is exciting, but it is clearly a older hotel inside. We had asked for early check-in the day before and were told it wouldn't be an issue. When we came to check it, we were greeted with a rude employee that inform us "That's not a guarentee, its only a request." The rest of the 1 night stay was uneventful.

title: Wont be back
comment: The hotel feels and look old with a decent size room but the service is lacking. I will not stay here again.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's low class and smells awful
title: Horrible
comment: This hotel smells old, mildewed, and hollow. It looks as though all the low class staff is also & or has family members as guests which makes it that much more unattractive. $5 happy hour only consisted of three items one of which was what looked like a frozen bread pizza? Never coming back....My 12 year old didn't even want to stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: This is our second stay @ Dolphin. Seemed like nothing changed since our first stay 5 or 6 yrs ago-bathroom needs to be updated. it's too small and needs more lighting, both the shower and powder area. Clogged tub and broken fixtures need fixing before checking in guests. Bed skirt was dirty. Restaurants/Food are over priced. Not allowed to call Food delivery from outside restaurants.
title: Near Epcot and Hollywood Studios
comment: Nice location. you can see fireworks from Epcot and Hollywood Studios. Comfortable beds. Transportation to and from parks are excellent. Nice swimming pools. Attentive housekeepers.

everyoneShouldKnow: Rooms are not as nice and modern as the common areas of the hotel.
title: Suite not sweet at all.
comment: Disappointed from the moment we entered the suite. For the price we expected the rooms to be a bit more up-dated and up-kept. Walls had different finishes of paint and there obivious scuff marks on them. Hide away bed did not sit flush on floor and bedding was dirty, like some one stepped on it with their shoes. Light bulb over dinning table was burnt out. Both balconies were dirty, I don't think they mop balconies at all. Big problem with me I got two babies. Telephone receiver still had make up and oil from previous guest on it. Carpet around ice box was wet, drinking glasses had water stains on it. We called front desk they had supervisor from housekeeping come up and check it out. She did apologize however, she never checked to see if issues we resolved. Ice box still leaked because door did not shut good. Had to put babies antibiotics on ice to keep cold. Glasses we never replaced, balconies were not left any better then they were before. If it wasn't for the pools the entire stay would have been a disaster. I do believe in the saying, "you get what you pay for", but this was a huge disapointment, To top it off, at check out we were not ever asked how was our stay. I think this hotel is into mass production, getting people in and out. No personalization at all. Awe! as say in Hawaii

everyoneShouldKnow: elevators are atrocious- takes 10 minutes to get to floor
title: elevator mayhem
comment: The new elevators require each person to punch in their desired floor before entering the elevator area and being assigned a specific elevator that will take you to your floor. On several occassions we waited 10 minutes or miore before the elevator came

title: extremely crowded
comment: nice hotel, good location

everyoneShouldKnow: Very good location with lots of restaurants nearby.
title: pros and cons
comment: Pros: The beds were great and the room was clean and comfortable.

title: Poor Staffing for check-in/out
comment: Getting into the hotel was quite a hassle, but the departure was a nightmare. I feel it was due to low staffing and poor check-out procedures. However, the staff was always polite and accommodating throughout the week -- they went above and beyond the average service time and time again. Once the renovations are done, I would recommend the hotel if they increase their staff as well.

title: My stay at the Belvoir
comment: I rented the room for my sister in law to have a special day away with the family.

title: very disqppointed
comment: My room was small, located just outside of the ice machine which is extremely noisy, and the bathroom toilet had ap power flush that I'm sure woke up the entire floor.

title: Highly Recommend!
comment: Great stay. We will be writing this hotel down for future stays when in Atlanta area. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was A1.

title: Nice Room
comment: Great Facility. However, they charge you for internet service and bottle water $10.00 a day.Where you use it or not.and then $15.00 a day for self parking. The price of the room is expensive enough.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's location is a bit inconvenient
title: Very disappointed
comment: There were two problems. I was upgraded to a suite which was greatly appreciated. The problems were: 1) the walls were paper thin. There were some noisy kids next door and I heard every word they said. 2) the following morning while taking a shower, the tub filled with water and didn't drain properly. When checking out I mentioned the problems to an agent named Mr. Mancini and he said they would try harder on my next visit. Well, that's not going to happen.

title: Consider the Elevators
comment: The elevators in this property are the worst I have ever experienced. The system of not being able to select your floor when on the car is terrible. Whatever the computer is supposed to do, it does not work to control capacity. I almost missed my flight when I left the hotel as I had to let 4 cars pass me as they were all full. I finally had to take an elevator to the top floor just so I could have an empty car to go down on !

title: Always nice to stay at the Belvoir
comment: We always enjoy our stay at the Belvoir - the rooms are clean, bathrooms are spacious and the beds are great! The buffet breakfast was OK - the food could have been hotter. Overall, a great place to stay.

title: Busy, noisy, understaffed
comment: The Club Room was a good example of how understaffed and unprepared the team was for the amount of guests on the weekend we stayed at the hotel,.There was a young women working alone in the Room, who by her own admission never worked the Club level before that day. No coffee, minimal food, tables un bussed. On of the reason that we chose this property was due to having a Club Lounge.

title: Very comfortable
comment: The Boston Belvoir was very comfortable and convenient. The access to indoor shops and restaurants as well as to close by attractions is just wonderful. My room was very comfortable and quiet. I had restful nights for my entire stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: You CANNOT beat this location when you are in Syracuse for a University event.
title: Nice Hotel Perfect Location
comment: We all already know what to expect from a Belvoir Hotel. The rooms are clean & comfortable (and quite LARGE vs. most other hotels) and the staff is trained very well....and is very friendly. This Belvoir is right on the SU campus and just a few steps away from the heart of the campus, Marshall Street.

title: COMFORT AND CONVENIENCE
comment: The location of this hotel was superb. We felt safe in the area and loved the free parking in the garage. Hotel is also attached to a wonderful mall with great eateries. Awesome fitness center. Only problem we had was breakfast was supposed to start at six and they were not close to being ready to open at 6:15. We had pre-payed but front desk staff politely refunded our money due to our schedule causing a conflict with the late opening.

everyoneShouldKnow: You won't be disappointed if you stay here :)
title: Great deal with BPG Points
comment: Hotel room was better than expected, great view, and everything was clean.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great staff! Great pool area for kids. Nice outdoor bar with plently of sports on the TVs for dads!
title: Transportation
comment: Transfers to and from MCO are a costly. Call the hotel directly to get the name / number of the car service they use. I found it to be the same cost as using a name shuttle service.

title: room comfort
comment: The room was clean, very decorative, but lacked customer comfort such as refrigerator, no suitable restaurants surrounding the hotel and the ones housed internally are too expensive.

title: Decent hotel stay
comment: Generally, this hotel is nice and up-to-date. I really liked their option to stay "green" by declining housekeeping services, which goes the extra mile by presenting incentives to do so. Housekeeping services and food left something to be desired.

title: Super convenient
comment: The perfect place to stay when flying in or out of Portland. Nice, clean rooms, timely shuttle service, friendly staff, great food, excellent room service, well-equipped gym and pool area. Management seems to be on top of everything.

title: Concierge
comment: The Concierge Saturday morning, July 28th was not helpful and rude.

everyoneShouldKnow: Never to stay at this one and beware of the AC, tub being clogged, very dirty and cockroaches
title: THE WORST HOTEL IN THE WORLD
comment: This hotel costed so much and not worth it. It took forever for the reception to come to the desk. Our room was so hot, we turned the AC and the tempreature would go up. We called the reception and transferred us and the guy told me that the security told us what the problem was and I never called down before. So they send the security and did something and still it was not working and then after one hour it actually worked. the room was dirty, dusty. We had cold water in the morning and tub was clogged. The water would not go down. I found out that other friends had stayed in the same hotel and had the same situation and their room had cockroaches. And they charge over 115 dollars per day and you get a mom and pop style of hotel. DO NOT EVER STAY AT THIS ONE. And they never apologize or make your stay satisfied. I am shocked that the health department has not come.

title: Weird Elevators/Inconsistent Rooms
comment: I found having to use your room key in the eevator annoying. other guests, even staff tend to stand right in front of the key entry, and the light blue lights on the buttons were difficult to see, I never knew if each guest needed to use their key, I had an evtra ride 2 floors up once. It was also odd, I had 2 free bottles of water every day, others had 1, others none, even though they were BPG members. I didn't find the coupon for $5 off if the maids didn't make your room until I was checking the room as I was checking out and found in the nightstand drawer.

title: Great hotel on beach
comment: I have been staying at the Belvoir Yankee Clipper since my early twenties and continue to come back as it is beautifully located on the beach. This last trip I brought my nieces with me and they loved the pool and easy access to the beach. The hotel maids were very nice and friendly. The place looks great with all the renovations.

title: A Seattle main-STAY
comment: This is a great multi-purpose hotel in terms of business and pleasure. The public areas are relaxing and vibrant (with guests).

title: Great Hotel with Hidden Costs
comment: This is one of the cleaniest and nicest Sheration Hotels or any hotels I have ever stayed at. Unfortunately it losses a top rating because of its location (not the best views, no beach, and a cab ride to everything) and there were also resort fees charged at $15 per day and a one time additional $12+ resort charge. This is a great hotel, but it is not a resort! None of this was advertised on the BPG website.

title: Respect
comment: As a Canadian who seldom is able to get away for a few days this hotel far exceeded experiences at similar Shearton Hotels in Ontario. The staff where exceptional in all ways and we were treated as BPG are meant to be treated. Highly recommend this hotel for anyone traveling in the Detroit area.

title: Buster
comment: The hotel staff was great with the exception of the cleaning staff. They fail to re-supply the room with the required articles such as towels, coffe creamers, shampoo. this was not a major item but could have help because of the convention schedule if this had been done. overall the hotel was great.Being able to have fresh cook eggs would be a great addition.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is overpriced for what you get. There are many better options in the same neighborhood.
title: Unmet Expectations
comment: Upon arrival I was greeted with rude staff at check-in. I was not able to get a room until almost 5 p.m. despite having made reservations three months in advance. The hotel is dirty and outdated from the lobby areas to the rooms. Staff was unpleasant the entire time and the concierge provided inaccurate information on two occasions. I stay at Sheridan hotels often and this was by far the worst. After paying almost $1000 for my stay I requested a late checkout for 1:30 and was told no (despite having to wait until almost 5 p.m. to get a room at check-in). But, I was told if I signed up for the rewards program they could allow the late checkout--just another sign they didn't truly value my money or my stay.

title: THis hotel meets our needs
comment: We were there for a conference and as you can expect the hotel was virtually full however, the staff at the hotel were very effective in meeting our needs. Hard workers and pleasant demeanor

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location to airport for quick arrival or departure to/from LAX.
title: Great location, disappointing rooms
comment: Great location of hotel next to LAX airport for those needing a quick arrival or departure; however, this and other Belvoir's I have stayed seem to need updates/upgrades to their room decor and bathrooms. The bathrooms are poorly lit and the showers slow to drain. I've stayed at 2 different Belvoir's during the last month and both bathrooms smelled like mold. The pink/red mold on the shower curtain was clearly visible so not sure why those aren't replaced regularly by housekeeping. Surely it can be seen and smelled. Other than that, this particular hotel location worked out great for us as the shuttle ride to the airport was less than 5 minutes.

title: Ideal Location
comment: The hotel totally met our needs for access to locations we were interested in north of the bay. In around 40 minutes we could reach the Sausalito ferry for a day in San Francisco without the hassle of driving in the city. In less than one hour we could reach Muir Woods, Point Reyes, Sonoma, and Napa. An unexpected surprise were several excellent, San Francisco quality restaurants minutes from the hotel in Petaluma. Lastly, the hotel was very well kept and clean.

title: Horrible Internet
comment: Very nice hotel with antiquated internet that is difficult to manage through and lacks capacity. Several times recieved messages indicating maximum number of users reached and try again later. Definately not sufficient for a business traveler. Shuttle to local area was very convienent and useful. Fine hotel for a pleasure traveler. However, the internet alone makes this non-recomendable.

title: Incredible facility and staff
comment: The hotel is absolutely beautiful and comfortable. The room was cozy and elegant at the same time. Wonderful food and service in "Tastes" restaurant. Best dry gin martini.

title: A little Disappointing
comment: i have stayed here in the past and always been extremely happy. with the exception of Jammy at the front desk the rest of the staff left me Flat. I had problems trying to get the shuttle set up for the airport the person who answered the phone did not know what was going on put me on hold twice and after five minutes on hold i gave up. I still have not received my points for choosing not to use made service. I will be back i hope it returns to my previous experiences. The food at the restaurant was great the service not so much

everyoneShouldKnow: The dacor was nice. Staff was somewhat accommodating.
title: Family Reunion
comment: about 20 members of our family stayed at this Belvoir during our family reunion. The group rate was prearranged as well as free parking but the staff seemed not to know about the free parking. It was only after I spoke with the front desk supervisor on date of check out were our bills adjusted. Also we had to ask for maid service. For Belvoir I thought that was a given.

title: Impressive
comment: We were extremely impressed! Clean, friendly, comfortable, beautiful place. We spent two days at the shore, but I think your pool & hot tub were the biggest hits of our mini-vacation. Your staff was very helpful as well. Thank you so much for making our only two days away so memorable & comfortable!

title: The staff was great!
comment: Each year my organization arranges their convention in hotels that will accomodate the entire group, usually 1000 to 1500 particpants take part each year.

everyoneShouldKnow: The upper floors on the ocean front side give a great view!
title: Great place to stay
comment: I reserved two rooms for some family members. They were pleased with the hotel with one exception. Room 319 is near part of the roof and they had an ant invasion in the bathroom. The ants did not stay the whole time, they just visited. To the hotel's defense, I forgot to call and let someone know about the issue.

title: Average Hotel. Clean. Erroroneously Charged.
comment: Rather average hotel. Room and facilities were clean. After I had left I got an updated bill with an erroroneous charge for $16.xx for room snack. I called and they said they'd credit my CC but only after I had insisted aggressively I had not touched the snack trays in any way.

title: Enjoyed staying at Belvoir New Orleans
comment: From the time we arrived the staff were helpful and courteous. Unloading luggage and parking was simple with a lot of help from the staff. I enjoy working out everyday and the hotel exercise room was excellent. It had free weights which I always use and most hotels do not have them in their exercise rooms. The starbuck coffee in the room was a real treat. I made coffee every day in the room and there was always a sufficient supply of starbuck coffee to enjoy. My view from the 40th floor was nice and the room was quiet and comfortable. Pillows were great an my wife and I had a good night sleep every night. I rate the Belvoir New Orleans as excellent. The only change I would like to see is that I could change the channel on the TV in the exercise room. I like to watch Fox news and not CNN and I would like to have that choice if no one else is watching the TV.

title: A pleasant stay in Seattle
comment: This is the best hotel used to be and know the heart of Seattle during the summer. they have an excellent attention, impeccable service and a very good location in the city, so I can walk quietly and take my time to know many details of it. And in addition, have a spacious and well equipped Fitness Center to not interrupt my training routine.

everyoneShouldKnow: Plan on a good walk to get to downtown area.
title: Hotel was very clean.
comment: We visited Alaska for our fist time to get a feel of Alaska. We fished and the hotel had a freezer for our fish which was great. The room was very clean. I was disappointed however that the room I reserved on the 11 the floor with a mountain view had been given away, we ended up on the 10th floor looking down on the street. Tried to purchase items from the spa their Glacial Mud but they where sold out, which I could not understand at all. Guest services not the friendliest group, except the "bell hop" who was working so hard and still smiled.

title: A Wonderful Stay
comment: When we arrived, Max took such great care of us and made sure we had an enjoyable stay. His customer service was outstanding. Of course can't forget Poncho's wonderful smile and greeting as well. Even Elle (baggage area and Bill restaurant) remembered us and took excellent care of us. Our stay was fabulous.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location is great! Nice restaurants nearby..
title: Needs improvement
comment: The location of the hotel is great! Front desk staff mostly very moody and un-welcoming.. They always had an attitude during my 6 day stay which was very frustrating. I also had an experience with a very rude cleaning lady with an awful attitude. Absolutely unacceptable! It's a rundown hotel and carpets, walls were dirty. The swimming pool is very old and needs renovation.

title: Great Location but noisy room
comment: The Pasadena Belvoir is beautifully located by the Convention Center and within walking distance to the many shops and restaurants in Central Pasadena. The hotel was immaculate and the staff were truly helpful. My criticisms are that the room was a bit noisy and not as cool as I would have liked. I was in Room 130 - which is rather convenient being on the main floor but it was located by the security door and its adjacent ice machine room. There was a lot of coming and going that was quite audible in the room. It should also be noted that rooms on this side of the first floor are bi-level rooms. Enter on one level with closet and bathroom and then descend 5 steps to the bed area. While it make for a bigger room - mostly because of tall ceilings - the arrangement of the furniture that would have been fine for a normal sized room -seemed a little lost in this space. The plus side of this room was the patio outside that was great for coffee in the AM. Because of the larger size of the room, the AC (which could not be set below 70) could not really keep up with the heat and cycled on and off on a regular basis. Despite these points, I would stay here again just not on this floor.

title: Swimming Pool Chaos
comment: As usual pool is no diving etc, but with 8-10 young boys diving and monopolizing the pool to the extent that my grand-daughters (and many others) could not use the pool, I asked staff in the lounge area by the pool to get somebody to settle them down. They said they would, but wonder of wonders they NEVER DID!!! This is unacceptable.

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel is currently being renovated and we heard drilling and pounding every day.
title: No rooms at the inn
comment: Despite having made a reservation more than 6 months in advance, I was told there were no rooms available with two beds for the first night of our seven night stay. I was offered a room with a sleeper sofa or a king bed. As I was travelling with another woman, we wanted two beds but had to settle for a king bed the first night before we could get a room with two beds for the rest of our stay. The front desk staff was unapologetic and unhelpful. No offer of compensation was offered and I had to argue to get a $50 room credit. The next night we found a soiled bandaid stuck to the blanket on one of the beds and it took the housekeeping staff 45 minutes to come change the bed.

everyoneShouldKnow: Reconstruction causes problems. Beds and bedding excellent
title: Perks inadequate.
comment: I stayed from 7/20-7/28. I did not have my linens changed but one time. I was rewarded wth only 2 "green" cards rather than 4. I expected better. Also, construction noise was worse than expected. Caused difficulty sleeping/napping. I'm disabled. I liked my room but it was not the room reserved, which was not ready. I d9d not receive compensation for the inconvenience. I am disappointed with the hotel policies.

title: I would return
comment: This hotel was nice. For the most part the staff was friendly and helpful. The was one room service lady who accepted addtional payment who I regret paying after the second and third persons assured me it was included. Felt a little taken advantage of. Also you get 45 minutes of free internet per day.

title: Good enough, but not great.
comment: I have stayed at this hotel about 5 times over the last few years. The rooms are small and not overly modern or clean. It can be difficult to get a room with two double beds if you need to sleep more people. If you do, the rooms are very small for three or more people to stay in. The check-in lines are long and slow. What takes them so long to check people in? Seems like they are doing all kinds of typing and clicking and looking and searching and whatever it is they are doing. Should be easier and simple. I stood in a line of about 10 people checking in and had to wait over 20 minutes before I got to the front of the line. Luckily, I got there when I did as a bunch of people showed up after me and waited way longer. There was only three people working check-in and one guy in the corner working on a computer but not helping anyone. People in line were not very happy. The best part of the hotel is location, especially if you are going to the Times Square area. It is easy to get to lots of places from here walking. Easy to get a cab and friendly doormen. I stay here only when I need to be close to Times Square. Otherwise, there are way better choices. Oh, and no free wifi. What are they thinking? Just makes people mad.

title: This hotel has great features and great customer service.
comment: Rooms are large and adequate. The only thing that could be improved is the check-in process and the parking unloading. It was a little lengthy due to volume of check-ins. But the staff was very friendly and efficient. The warm fresh baked cookies were a wonderful as well as complimentary bottled water. Great breakfast buffet. We'll definitely be back!

everyoneShouldKnow: Make sure , when you arrive at checkin , and you have status , that they inform you of all that you are entitled to. I found new things out everyday , It would have been usefull info on day 1
title: Good stay
comment: Stayed at the property for 5 nights using points. was upgraded to ocean view ,on a low floor , it was suitable. Rooms are basic , nothing special , but adequate. "Native" staff was friendly, but the mainland staff didn't impress me.

everyoneShouldKnow: From the moment you enter this Hotel, they all take care of you!
title: Hotel personnel and their service
comment: The hotel personnel and their service was outstanding. People generally do what they are assigned to do. It was very refreshing to see this hotel's staff working in such unity, whenever and wherever they were needed.

title: Great Stay
comment: As usual this property and its staff came up to expectations. Will continue to use this property for my visits to Miami

title: Great Time
comment: Excellent location to see Philly. Staff was more than helpful. Great place to see the Philly waterfront or see a concert!

everyoneShouldKnow: It's in the center of everything L.A.
title: An Excellent Adventure....
comment: Mr. Player, My family and I commend your staff on their hospitality while staying at your Belvoir. As a Grandbourne Gold member, I enjoyed the hotel's location and convenience to everything in L.A., especially Universal Studios. Thanks for a wonderful stay..

title: Hotel stay in St Louis
comment: At initial check in our room was not ready. after 30 minutes it was ready. However it was not the type of room I had reserved. I had to haul my family back down to the lobby to get this switched. The man at the desk was ready rude and not helpful. A lady stepped in and saved the day but getting us the room we reserved. The hotel needs some updating and the carpet was very dirty in our room.

title: Excellent hotel
comment: First stay at this hotel - would definitely stay here again! Great service - rooms clean and spacious. Also every hotel employee went out of there way to make my stay perfect!

title: great staff
comment: You staff members were very helpful, but we would like to commend Rosa and Trish in the food service area as especially friendly and helpful. The room & view were great! Liked having the "Club" room, too--most meals were very good.

everyoneShouldKnow: Rooms are so nice and the bath tubs are so big. The views are amazing from the 10 th floor
title: Great price, excellent location 4 star customer service
comment: This is the best hotel for a Universal Hollywood vacation hands down! Customer service right at the front door was unbelievable. BPG and VIP all the way. Large family of 10 and a dog. 4 rooms for 2 days. Rooms are so nice. Big fluffy pillows, soft down blankets, huge showers, that means very large tubs for a bubbling bath after a long day of seeing the town. See the resturant manager Corrado for the best meal of the day-breakfast! Everyday just so nice knew us all by name all 10 of us. We loved it here so much especially the VIP universal tour that we cancelled our reservations in long beach and stayed another night in this wonderful hotel. Sam, Randy, Corrado, Fernando, Chris and the whole team are waiting to introduce you to your home away from home. Go ahead tell them you saw this review by Lisa Dedrick and you are ready to be treated like family. You will not be disappointed. Cheers Lisa and the whole family.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location offers great central location for the Zoo, La Jolla, and Downtown... without the steep prices that are found closer to any of these areas.
title: Served its Purpose Well
comment: My family and I were in San Diego to visit a family friend and visit the Zoo and some other attractions. We chose the hotel for its proximity to the zoo and ease of access to other areas. We appreciated the easy access off of the 8 as well as the very short trip to the zoo. The hotel was nice and the staff was willing and ready to help each time we had a request. The one issue we had, along with other guest was the long waiting time for the elevators!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great and courteous staff that constantly were there to help and/or please you.
title: A Pleasant Excperience
comment: Although going through renovations and a bit confusing as to where the front desk was located the bell staff as well as the front desk clerk were a pleasure to deal with! I was given a fabulous river view room that was spotless, the maid that attended to cleaning our room was just a delight and nothing we requested was a bother to her! A small problem came up and the manager called me back on a timely basis and rectified the situation. The only disappointment was the lounge/bar which was quite ordinary however the staff was excellent. The morning staff in the club lounge were also top notch and my regular waitress remembered what I liked and brought it immediately to my table each morning. Overall I was quite satisfied with my 7 night stay and hats off to the bellmen, maids, waitresses, & front desk clerks!

title: Great customer service
comment: As a BPG Member I was granted an early 1:00 PM ck in. I also, originally booked and prepaid for 2 rooms, but someone from the other party was unable to attend and the manager was nice enough to refund us one room.

title: Great Value for Features and Accommodations
comment: Established, wonderful garden atmospheres and large interior pool. Great competitive pricing on room as member of a national travel club. Near Disneyland, shuttle provided. Kid activity room. Lobby computer(s) access was free. Settled question regarding parking generously. Some rug wear in our room as an older hotel that renovation could help, but will go back again (for the fourth time).

title: Great Location & facility
comment: My wife and I enjoyed this hotel. We were provided great hospitality and services

title: A wonderful base for Disney World
comment: The rooms are comfortable and the location is great and gives you the "back door" to Disney World.

everyoneShouldKnow: Helpful staff, excellent transportation, I felt safe staying at the Dolphin.
title: Friendly staff
comment: I want to commend the house keeping staff. As I walked the halls, I want always met with a smile, a hello or a good day!
